content.text: The Sarrabus-Gerrei (SE-Sardinia/Italy) deposit province and its geological framework. Folding text: The first part of the work presents the geological framework of the Sarrabus-Gerrei deposit province. However, the actual focus is on investigating the facile dependencies of the mineralization in the Silurian black shale and describing their complex tectonic-metamorphic development during the varistic orogenesis.
content.title_en: The Sarrabus-Gerrei Deposit Province (SE-Sardinia/Italy) and its geological framework

content.text: Studies of the annual dynamics of a great-mice population. From the introduction: The number of great-mice breeding pairs, which colonize certain biotopes annually, varies considerably from year to year. The aim of this work is to determine the annual dynamics of a great-mice population in the region Schlüchtern-Steinau (Hessen) between 1972 and 1977. It is to be shown, among other things, to what extent migrations (inward and outward migration) take place outside and at the beginning of the breeding period and how strongly this breeding and winter population influence. To achieve this, not only breeding biological parameters have been recorded, but further important information has been collected through intensive net-catching of feeding places and by night-time controls of nesting caves in winter. They are to show that time outside the breeding period has been wrongly neglected and decisive insights into the annual dynamics can only be achieved by intensive study of this period.
content.title_en: Studies on the annual dynamics of a large-mice population

content.text: The results are discussed in connection with the vitality-enhancing and differentiation-promoting effect of glucocorticoids on hepatocytes primary cultures.
content.title_en: Regulation and function of polyamine biosynthesis in cultured rat hepatocytes

content.text: The compaction spaces in the Federal Republic of Germany: development, re-delimitation and regional stress analysis. Klappentext: The development of compaction spaces is of great importance for society and the state. The prerequisite for the development of spatial planning concepts and programmes is a deeper knowledge of the causes and trends of the compaction process. These are therefore at the centre of the first part of the investigation. Subsequently, the basics for a multi-level model for the assessment of the negative consequences of regional compaction processes are attempted. This includes a problem-oriented concept for the new delimitation of compaction spaces as well as a specific instrument for intra-regional stress analysis. Both models are examined using test calculations.
content.title_en: The compaction areas in the Federal Republic of Germany : development, re-delimitation and regional load analysis

content.text: The study of the natural science and technical subject-matter teaching in primary school is based on the controversial discussion among didacticians about the ability of primary school children to deal productively with facts from nature and technology. The present work is based on multi-annual, audiovisually recorded surveys in educational-like, problem-oriented situations, which are documented and interpreted in this volume. In the interpretation, especially the hitherto neglected non-language media of the discussion, such as action, gesture, facial expressions and drawing, and their networking in their meaning for thought and interaction processes were analyzed. The author manages to prove that primary school children in an action-intensive learning process give up their naive and precausal theories in favor of well-founded, verified, comprehensible and communicated statements. This book offers rich material for the design of productive, knowledge-oriented learning processes in natural science and technical material teaching.
content.title_en: Action, thinking and understanding : Studies on science and technology in primary school

content.text: Trends in urban development of open spaces in politics and administration. From the introduction: The focus of this study is on the urban green space offices, which have so far hardly been made a research subject by the landscape planning. It is mainly about the level of awareness of the actors, who design and implement the urban open space planning decisively in the municipal council and the municipal administration. In particular, the question is to be examined which perspectives and opportunities arise from the awareness of the actors for the urban green administrations.
content.title_en: Trends in urban space development in politics and administration

content.text: Static and dynamic oligopoly models: a contribution to the decision theory in oligopoly situations. All considerations in this work are business oriented, thus are employed from the point of view of the enterprise. Therefore, the focus of interest is the question of which price a company in an oligopoly situation must set in consideration of the given data constellation in order to behave accordingly to its objective.
content.title_en: Static and dynamic oligopoly models: a contribution to decision theory in oligopoly situations

content.text: In addition to data from the Dortmund database, the data are used to review and extend UNIFAC (in the case of the Diffusion of Diffusion) and the Diffusion of Diffusion of the Diffusion of Diffusion.
content.title_en: Experimental and theoretical studies to extend the group contribution methods UNIFAC and Modified UNIFAC (Dortmund)

content.title_en: Human-tech interaction by means of free space gestures

content.text: LINDA : Performance management in networks with service quality adaptation - using the example of an Ethernet middleware. This work presents a solution proposal for the realization of service quality in Ethernet networks. The central element for this is a software system consisting of a middleware which regulates communication in the network according to the specifications. This approach was theoretically conceived as well as practically programmed. The implementation of the solution served as the basis for the performance evaluation of the presented approach. In addition to the evaluation of the characteristic behavior of the middleware under various requirements, investigations and alternatives are presented which show how the system can be adapted in terms of the requirements that arise with larger networks. The presented solution approach offers an alternative to existing service quality functions, which are implemented by means of communication protocols and Ethernet hardware. The advantage of the middleware is that it works independently of the functions of the network, so that no special specifications need to be set to the communication infrastructure. Since the realization of service quality is implemented purely by the software of the middleware, all degrees of freedom are given in addition, in order to freely adapt the service quality concept to the service quality to individual needs.
content.title_en: LINDA : Performance management in networks with service quality adaptation - using the example of an Ethernet middleware

content.text: Advances in laboratory measurements for hydraulic and coastal engineering. Hydraulic engineering, coastal engineering, advances in measurements. - Hydrogen engineering, coastal engineering, measurement technology
content.title_en: Advances in laboratory measurements for hydraulic and costal engineering

content.text: The need for ever more powerful LED systems with a limited space for building requires increasing demands on thermal management. Not only the life expectancy, but also optical properties, such as the luminous flux and the colour of the light, depend on the chip temperature of the LED. As a result of a pronounced temperature dependence, the development process of the LED systems is very complex. This complexity is due to the larger number of interconnected elements that are realized in different disciplines. Due to this fact, there is a need for a cross-disciplinary development process that takes into account the tasks, problems and requirements of all disciplines. Within the scope of this work, a possible interlinking of the thermomanagement-relevant disciplines relevant for the error-free functionality of the thermomanagement with the engineering approach in product development was specified. The result is a systematic system that structures the development process of the LED systems and arranges suitable methods and tools for thermomanagement. The applicability of the development system was presented on the basis of the design of two demonstrators. The result is shown that the interaction of the various disciplines opens up potentials for the design of new products and applications.
content.title_en: Development system of thermal management of high-quality LED systems

content.text: Enzyme-catalyzed, kinetic racemate splitting α-quartary β-oxoester. The aim of the asymmetric synthesis is to display optically active compounds, whereby a possible approach is to separate racemic substrates. In the course of this dissertation project, a kinetic racemate splitting was decided on, in which an enzyme for enantioselective acidification should be used as a catalyst. <dt.> Asymmetric synthesis is acting at the preparation of optically active compounds. One suitable approach is the resolution of racemic materials. Herein we have chosen a kinetic resolution process using an enzyme as catalytic for an enantioselective saponification which has been successfully applied before by Christoffers et al. on the synthesis of (–)-kjellmanone. <engl.>
content.title_en: Enzyme-catalyzed kinetic racemate fission α-quartary β-oxoester

content.text: Is there a connection between the reason of the officially established danger and the shown behaviour of the dog in the Lower Saxony essential test since the abolition of the breed list?. In the context of the present work the essential test reports of 124 dogs were evaluated, which had to pass the Lower Saxony essential test due to a hazard classification according to §7 of the Lower Saxony law for keeping dogs. Only expert reports could be used, which included a copy of the official letter of the competent authority, which gave the reason for the determination of the danger. The essential tests took place in the period from December 2003 to December 2016 on the premises of the veterinary college. The essential tests were evaluated by scientific staff of the Institute for Animal Welfare and Behaviour of the University of Veterinary Medicine Hannover. It was examined whether a connection between the reason of the hazard classification and the shown behaviour of the dog in the Lower Saxony essential test was identified. Furthermore, the breed, age, as well as the sex of the dog were recorded and included in the evaluation.
content.title_en: Is there a link between the reason for the officially detected danger and the shown behaviour of the dog in the Lower Saxony essential test since the abolition of the breed list?

content.text: It is the legal aspects of the online dating: in particular the remuneration claim of the partnership mediators on the Internet. The work deals with the pitfalls of this industry with regard to contracts in the field of online dating and its various forms. These are generally service contracts. German (consumer protection) law applies. The contracts can be concluded effectively with few exceptions. -- § 656 BGB does not apply directly or analogly. The standard itself has become obsolete and cannot serve any legitimate purpose any more; it is not applicable to the law. If, in the run-up to the conclusion of the contract or in the execution of the contract, the parties are not entitled to any secondary claims. -- In order to terminate the contract, the user has only the right to terminate for important reasons in accordance with § 626 BGB. A right to terminate the contract under § 627 BGB is not open to him.
content.title_en: Legal aspects of online dating: in particular the remuneration entitlement of the partner intermediaries on the Internet

content.text: Interface-controlled mineralization of calcium phosphate. In this work it was shown that the two amphiphiles used with cholesterol as a hydrophobic block, are good templates for the mineralization of calcium phosphate at the water/air interface. By means of infrared reflection absorption absorption spectroscopy (IRRAS), X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDXS), electron diffraction (SAED) and high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM), the successful mineralization of calcium phosphate for both amphiphiles at the water/air boundary area could be demonstrated. It was also shown that the phase behaviour of the two amphiphiles and the crystal phases formed during the mineralization of calcium phosphate are not identical. Both amphiphiles thus exert a different influence on the mineralisation course. At CHOL-HEM, both after 3 h and after 5 h octacalcium phosphate (OCP) are detected as the only crystal phase, HRTEMS ...
content.title_en: Interface controlled mineralization of calcium phosphate

content.text: Publicist sources protection in German and European law. Who is now entitled to use source protection? In view of the technological development in the media and an increasing number of attacks on media freedom, this question has recently gained a new relevance. In this respect, the author analyses the legal situation regarding source protection, i.e. the protected relationship of trust between an informant and a journalist, in German law, in the system of the European Convention on Human Rights, in the law of the European Union and in US law, in a comparative manner, and always focuses on the journalist. Thus, the work is of particular interest to legal scientists and journalists.
content.title_en: Publicist protection of sources in German and European law

content.title_en: Copper, lead and silver mining : Central European metallurgy in the early modern era : a comparative presentation of scientific literature

content.text: The European Commission's proposal to the SUP Directive has sparked a heated discussion on the question of whether the German legislator should allow the purely electronic establishment of capital companies. The research results of this work are based on the comprehensive analysis of the rich argumentation about the electronic foundation, its systematic focus and critical penetration; on the other hand, and above all, the study provides a critical and forward-looking examination of the electronic identification means on which the EU Council of Ministers has based its compromise on the general orientation towards the SUP Directive on this central issue. For the "Company Law Upgrade Package", which is in-house, the investigation provides usefully usefully usable raw materials.
content.title_en: The creation of an electronic company across the border

content.text: The process of resinat pastes and resinat pastes is successfully demonstrated by the high-level multilayer ceramic systems. The present thesis presents the integration possibilities of resinat pastes into the low-level multilayer ceramic technology (LTCC) that are dissolved in aromatic oils. These pastes can be applied by means of low-cost screen printing such as classic thick film pastes. The sintered layer thickness is only 100 nm to 1 [my]m. By etching these thin burnt-out layers can be very finely structured. The structural resolution is mainly limited in the single-digit micrometer range by the roughness and depletion of the substrates. The use of a fully-faced resinat layer as the starting point for a galvanic layer structure is particularly interesting. In this process, the desired structures are galvanically enhanced and the start layer is then etched. For the fully-faced resinat layer is presented as a basis for the fully-scale resintegration of the resinat structure.
content.title_en: Integration of metal organic resin pastes in low sintering multilayer ceramic systems

content.text: Experimental and numerical analysis of flow in pumps of small specific speed taking into account the roughness influence. In industrial pumps with small specific speed significant deviations to reality occur in flow simulations. In this work, the faulty modelling of wall boundary layers with the logarithmic wall law and the neglect of the effect of hydraulic rough walls are identified as essential reasons. An improved method is developed and validated by means of measurements (including wall shear stress). The flow field of a test pump is analyzed and essential phenomena and loss sources are worked out.
content.title_en: Experimental and numerical analysis of flow in pumps of small specific speed taking into account the roughness influence

content.text: Development of biocompatible superparamagnetic nanoparticles for use as in vivo diagnostic, especially in magnetic particle imaging. Magnetic iron oxide nanoparticles have been successfully used as MRI contrast agents in clinical imaging for some time now. Optimising the magnetic properties of nanoparticles can improve the significance of MR images and thus further increase the diagnostic value of an MR application. In addition to improving existing methods, imaging diagnostics is also driven by the development of new methods, such as magnetic particle imaging. As the measurement signal is generated by the magnetic nanoparticles themselves, the MPI has an enormous advantage in terms of sensitivity with high temporal and spatial resolution at the same time. However, since there is currently no commercially distributed in vivo-compatible MPI tracer, there is an urgent need for suitable innovative tracer materials. This resulted in the motivation of this work biocompatible and superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticles for use as in vivo diagnostic...
content.title_en: Development of biocompatible superparamagnetic nanoparticles for use as in vivo diagnostic, especially in magnetic particle imaging

content.text: Information practices in educational research: ethnographic information research on research environments, apparatuses and research data in interaction. How are data used in educational research or, in other words, how are data on research data with appropriate significance for the relevant research question and thus relevant information in research practice? To investigate this question, information practices are analysed, described and contrasted in five different educational research projects. This shows how these research projects are enabled to investigate their respective research questions through the production, use and re-configuration of apparatuses, materials and data in an examination of an object of investigation. In this work, therefore, less – as is usually the case with information science – only the end product of scientific work, the scientific publication, is placed in the focus of the interest of knowledge. Instead, the information practices, especially the interactions in the production and use of research data in their compounds, are assigned a priority position in research interest, without neglecting publications. Here – as with other entities – are considered part of the interaction that exists with educational research.
content.title_en: Information practices in educational research: ethnographic information research on research environments, apparatuses and research data in interaction

content.text: The social acceleration in non-Western societies: the case study Iran. The present dissertation is dedicated to the question of the establishment and development of modern social institutions in so-called non-Western societies. Iranian society serves here as the case study to paradigmatically place social, economic and cultural relations in a non-Western society. For empirical support, the work uses above all a historical-sociological perspective on Iran. It is based as a theory foundation on the theory of social acceleration and it is argued that the different types of functional mechanisms and potential connections of motors of social acceleration draw correspondingly different accelerated social formations or social constellations. A detailed study of the modes and motors of social acceleration, their functioning and mutual linkages, forms the basis for understanding the problem of the establishment of an accelerating social formation in Iranian society. It is shown that in the course of the 20th century the three motors of social acceleration in Iranian society had to fight continuously with three corresponding problems: the „autocratic modernization measures (the economic engine) and the „structurally unenthusive differentiation" (the motor).
content.title_en: The social acceleration in non-Western societies: the case study Iran

content.text: The book deals with the question of the constitutionalization of international law and examines it from a system-theoretical perspective. The work deals intensively with the system theory of Niklas Luhmann and then analyses both prevailing constitutionalization and fragmentation tendencies. In detail, the work deals with the approach of the so-called Societal Constitutionalism and critically appreciates the main thesis of the representatives of this approach. Finally, the work examines the constitutionalization of international law from a system-theoretical point of view and examines the extent to which an autonomous or even autopoietic legal and political system exists at an international level and whether these two systems are connected to the national state level by a kind of structural coupling. In essence, the work affirms a structural coupling and thus also a constitutionalization at least in a weakened measure. -- 1. Theoretical foundations - System theory of Niklas Luhmann -- 2. Constitutionalization in international law -- 3. Fragmentation - 4. Plural conception of the global order - 5.
content.title_en: The constitutionalization of international law from a system-theoretical perspective

content.text: Biofuel Policy in Germany: On the Discursive Construction of Multiple Problem-solving. Biofuels in Germany -- Interpretive Policy Analysis -- Discourse Coalitions -- Environmental, Agricultural and Energy Policy -- Ecological Modernization -- Neoliberalization Biofuels have been propagated since the 1980s as a potential solution to a variety of problems: from oil dependence to structural change in agriculture to climate change. Against the backdrop of the erratic, sometimes contradictory course of German biofuel policy, Thomas Vogelpohl traces the social construction of biofuels in the past thirty years and their reflection in political decisions in a discursively analytical manner. He examines how biofuels in Germany can become and maintain a political solution option and how this complex social construction process can be understood against the background of historically specific political-institutional and paradigmatic framework conditions. The content Biofuels in Germany Interpretive Policy Analysis Discourse Coalitions in Germany Environmental, Agricultural and Energy Policy Ecological Modernization Neoliberalization The target groups Dozierende und Studieren der Politikwissenschaft, Soziologie und Humangeographie Anbifolioren Anbieien in der Praxis und Vogelfeld Wissen.
content.title_en: Biofuel policy in Germany : The discursive construction of multiple problem solving

content.text: The study examines the complex relationships between state housing policy, social spatial segregation and the stigmatization of social housing residents. In this context, the author analyses many different contemporary sources from the 1940s, 1950s and 1960s, as well as interviews with witnesses from the large housing complex Conjunto IAPI in Belo Horizonte. Social inequalities are part of most aspects of daily life and have persistently characterized life in Latin. As soon as the population is living in the city, the population is divided into two groups.
content.title_en: Apartments for workers : social housing, segregation, and stigmatization in urban Brazil

content.text: The legal review of the international financial crisis that broke out in 2008 has not been completed even ten years after the crisis broke out. Part of the legislative measures addressing risk management is the regulation of remuneration in banks by the national regulations based on CRD IV (§ 25a KWG, InstitutsVergV n.F.).The work examines on the one hand whether the regulatory intensity created against the background of the initially discussed risk management function of variable remuneration is justified. On the other hand, application and practical implementation of the provisions in compensation agreements are the focus. The regulatory requirements pursue objectives that are in conflict with labour protection mechanisms, so that their compatibility raises relevant questions for practice. The author gives legal users proposals for practical contract design to the legislator. Furthermore, he addresses with suggestions on legislative further development to the legislator
content.title_en: Variable remuneration in institutions as part of risk management

content.text: The Whole-Nation Bias in empirical research: Theory and Empirie was awarded a doctorate in the field of democracy measurement in 18 federal states. In this book the Whole-Nation Bias, a highly relevant distortion problem for country-comparison research, is subjected for the first time to empirical investigation and extensive theoretical exploration. In the theoretical part of the book a conceptual differentiation of the Whole-Nation Bias takes place. Felipe Böttcher also outlines the state of existence, possible manifestations and consequences of this distortion problem. The empirical survey finally aims to quantify the magnitude in different state contexts. In a comprehensive data collection of 6,150 indicator values for 410 regions in 18 federal states were calculated and thus the democracy quality recorded both at the subnational and national level of these countries. The content of theoretical and empirical exploration of the Whole-Nation Bias in the field of democracy measurement in 18 federal states was calculated.
content.title_en: The Whole-Nation Bias in empirical research : Theory and Empirie using the example of democracy measurement in 18 federal states

content.text: However, the presence of the anti-corrosion coating is clearly reflected in the presence of the anti-corrosion coating. The anti-corrosion coating is not only a suitable coating for the use of the anti-corrosion coating, but also a suitable coating for the use of the anti-corrosion coating. The nickel-phosphoric coating used in the high-warm aluminium alloy EN AW 2618A is also a suitable coating for the use of the anti-corrosion coating. The aim of this dissertation is to re-examine the stress of the anti-corrosion coating wheel in suitable tests and to create a comparable data base for various anti-corrosion coating materials. The stress of the anti-compressant coating is to be considered in tensile tests, various corrosion tests, cavitation and thermal ageing. As investigated basic materials, the current used material EN AW 2618A and an alternative anti-condension coating AA 2055 are considered as possible coatings, but the anti-corrosion coating coating resistance is clearly superior to the anti-corrosion coating coating resistance.
content.title_en: Characterization of NiP layers and alternative coating systems as wear and corrosion protection on aluminium knet alloys

content.text: Anion receptors based on hydrogen and halogen bonding. The development of selective anion receptors, which enable the targeted detection and binding as well as the transport of relevant anions, has been one of the most important research areas of supramolecular chemistry for many years. So far, these receptors have been based mainly on the donation of hydrogen bridge bonds, but recently also on halogen bridge donors. Unlike the hydrogen bridge, the halogen bridge closely related to it has a higher directionality, a greater covalent bonding component and a stronger interaction with a Lewis-basic partner, thus enabling the construction of potentially more selective receptors. An important heterocycle, which enables a simple implementation of halogen bridge bonds into various systems through its modular access, is the halogenated 1,2,3 triazole or the corresponding triazolium salt. This component allows a strong polarization of the halogen and thus a very efficient halogen bridgedonation.
content.title_en: Anion receptors based on hydrogen and halogen bonding

content.text: In the context of value-oriented key figures and information on IFRS financial reporting, Alexander Bantz examines whether information on IFRS financial reporting is suitable for the design of value-oriented key figures in general and in particular in fair value accounting. He shows possibilities and limits of fair value-based key figures and de-forces significant criticisms expressed in convergence considerations. He analyses whether convergence potential can be identified in terms of the accounting purposes pursued with value-oriented key figures and information on IFRS financial reporting and the related requirements. Moreover, the convergence potential of fair value accounting is assessed using various scenarios, taking into account the IFRS 13 regulations in particular, in terms of behavioural management in investment decisions. Content • Fair value accounting • Value-oriented key figures • Suitable fair value accounting according to IFRS 13 for value-oriented investment management • Implications for the design of converged value-oriented key figures for Johannes University of Mainz's Chair of Management.
content.title_en: Convergence of value-oriented key figures and information on IFRS financial reporting

content.text: The following sections of the study were presented: The dihydropyridin derivatives for the DHT-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY-MY
content.title_en: Synthesis of dihydropyridine derivatives for biological profiling

content.text: Plastic deformation behaviour of subcooled aluminium alloys in the Al-Mg-Si system. The work contributes to closing existing knowledge gaps in the mode of action of the main alloy elements in Al-Mg-Si-Knetalloys to the strength and flow behaviour. For this purpose, a methodology was developed that allows mechanical material tests on defined metastable material states under varying forming conditions. In order to better assess the influence of the main alloy elements, experimental investigations were carried out on binary model alloys (Al-Mg, Al-Si) with systematic variation of the alloy contents and on a ternary Al-Mg-Si alloy.
content.title_en: Plastic deformation behaviour of subcooled aluminium alloys in the Al-Mg-Si system

content.title_en: Heterochromatic gene silencing and control of the pathogenicity of C. graminicola

content.text: The interim metal simulation was not yet able to show the dynamic of the ultrafast excited state dynamics of transition metal complexes with ab-inito multiple spawning. Since its formation in the last century, quantum chemistry has spread widely, with which a large number of spectra can be calculated routinely. In contrast, the modelling of ultrafast photochemical processes is still very demanding and limited to small and medium-sized molecules. The constantly increasing computer power now enables the calculation of large transition metal complexes. However, due to their high number of electronic states and atoms, these pose some challenges for the quantum mechanical methods for the modelling of ultrafast processes. Therefore, the aim of this work is to identify methods with which these challenges can be addressed. For this purpose, the method ab-initio multiple spawning (AIMS) for the calculation of atomic dynamics was initially selected for the calculation of a further experimental metal of the transition.
content.title_en: Exploring the ultrafast excited-state dynamics of transition metal complexes with ab-inito multiple spawning

content.text: The concept of learning in the context of adult education and life in the context of adult education and adult education: A comparative analysis of the context of the context of adult education and adult education. In connection with the current ubiquitous concept of learning, the human curriculum vitae becomes the reference point of adult education. The term "learning" raises the question of the human phases of life in general and the phases of adulthood in particular. Franziska Endreß examines the pictorial representation of ageing and the age of life in image documents, which are circulating in connection with the concepts of adult education, further education and lifelong learning on the Internet. A particular interest is the relationship between metaphors of education and learning and process metaphors of human life. The content Relationship of image, medium and context of thinking, image, experience image - interpictoriality Alternbild and life phase iconography Adult education, further education and life-long learning in the image of adult education and the target groups of adult education and education as well as the general education of the social sciences and the field of study and the study of the faculty of the humanities.
content.title_en: Images of ageing and age in the picture area Adult education : A comparative analysis taking into account adjacent image spaces

content.text: The multi-diagram multi-diagram is presented with the multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multi-diagram multidiagram multi-diagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidia-diagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidia-diagram multidiagram multidia-diagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidia-diagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiabigram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidiagram multidia-dia-diabigram multidia-dia-dia-dia-dia-dia-dia-diabigram multidiabigram multidiabigram multidia-dia-dia-dia-dia-dia-dia-dia-dia-diabigram multidia-diabigram multidiabigram multidiabigram multidiabigram multidia-dia
content.title_en: Development of an endoscopic fiber probe for optical biopsies using nonlinear spectroscopy

content.text: The Community's structurally weak regions in the run-up to the EC'92: problems, trends and prospects; the example of the Objective 1 regions of Spain and Italy. The aim of the work was to provide an empirical contribution to the question of the spatial impact of the EC internal market. The study covered the structurally weak regions of Italy, the Mezzogiorno, which includes the regions of Abruzzo, Molise, Campania, Apulia, Basilicata, Calabria and the two islands of Sardinia and Sicily, and Spain with Andalusia, Asturias, Galicia, Castilla y Leon, Castilla y Mancha, Valencia, Murcia, Extremdura and the Canary Islands. In Italy, these areas comprise 40% of the total area and about 36.6% of the total population. In Spain, the share of the total area is 76.1% and about 58% of the population share. Particular attention was paid to the problem circles of "direct investment" and "infrastructure" as these areas cover the causes of the feared spatially divergent development, the regionally more one-sidedly-discrimination of the Community's's. The Community's policy is to be concentrated on the overall development market. The Community's policy. The Community's over-distinction is concentrated on the one-distinction is concentrated on the one-disciple of the Community's.
content.title_en: The structurally weak regions of the Community in the run-up to the 1992 EC: problems, trends and prospects, as shown by the Objective 1 regions of Spain and Italy

content.text: Social work and system theories. "System theory" is currently a dominant paradigm of scientific discourse. System thinking has become known as a consulting concept in the context of social work. Moreover, the assumption of systemic approaches also combines the expectation of a stronger independent profiling of a theory of social work. The author considers the various stages of system theory development and its reception within social work and questions them regarding its applicability at the various levels of the theory formation of social work, from interaction to social function determination.
content.title_en: Social Work and System Theories

content.text: Instationary boundary layer effects on wing profiles. Summary: A method for calculating laminar detachment as well as stability and transition of two-dimensional instationary boundary layers is given.
content.title_en: Instationary boundary layer effects on wing profiles

content.text: Structure of knowledge structures : Studies on coherence in knowledge acquisition with texts. A comprehensive overview of the current state of research on understanding texts and learning with texts.
content.title_en: Structure of knowledge: Studies on coherence in knowledge acquisition with texts

content.text: Gas studies on slurry sediments. The formation of gas in the seabed, especially at oversaturated concentrations, can lead to changes in the acoustic properties of marine sediments. This phenomenon is also called the pelvic effect. Gases can prevent the study of sediment layers with flat-seismic systems. Therefore, the concentration of methane and its saturation limits were to be investigated. The possible bubbles should be analysed in terms of their size and distribution in the sediment.
content.title_en: Gas investigations on slick sediments

content.text: The work deals with the internationalization of the housing market in Germany. Here, the question is examined how communication and cooperation on the housing market and in the context of urban development processes change after the complete sale of municipal housing property. Based on case studies in Kiel, Osnabrück and Wilhelmshaven, municipal and housing-related strategies and interaction orientations of local actors are linked. Even if the findings gained with the help of an urban governance approach show large differences in municipal design requirements, a fundamental loss of control after the sale is demonstrable. Especially financial-oriented investors and their low investment interest lead to a sustainably diminishing design power at the quarter level.
content.title_en: Full sale of municipal residential property to international investors : governanceanalytical analysis of the consequences for urban development processes and the housing market

content.text: The Orient journey of Emperor Wilhelm II in 1898: a study on German foreign policy at the turn of the 20th century. Klappentext: In the autumn of 1898 Wilhelm the Second travelled to the Orient. He wanted to visit the Holy Land as a pious pilgrim and to be present at the inauguration of the Jerusalem Redeemer Church. However, the imperial morning journey was more than a pious pilgrimage. At the Sultan Wilhelm the Second engaged himself for the construction of the Baghdad Railway, as "world politician" he expected the expansion of German influence to the Persian Gulf. As emperor of the Joint German Empire he gave the Catholic "Verein vom Heiligen Lande" the "Dormition". He wanted to win his Catholic subjects for himself and his politics. As a temporary enthusiastic advocate of the Zionist idea, Wilhelm the Second had promised before his departure to the Orient Theodor Herzl that he would not protect the Jews' immigration to Palestine. German Turkey policy added irreparable damage to the German-Russian relationship and burdened the German-French relations, but not a state policy that was not recognized in Germany and that it was not a policy of the middle of the German empire and that was not a policy of security.
content.title_en: The Orient Journey of Kaiser Wilhelm II in 1898 : a study on German foreign policy at the turn of the 20th century

content.text: Network management in retail: Process innovations in retail using the example of RFID technology. Introduction -- Introduction -- Challenges in retail -- Competition through new business forms -- Developments in the retail environment -- Process innovations in retail — Response to efficiency pressure in retail -- Trading processes as a starting point -- Process innovations in retail to increase efficiency -- Network management in retail — Management of a network to introduce cross-company process innovation -- Network structures — The network as an organisational form to introduce cross-company process innovation in retail -- Control mechanisms — Control of a network to introduce cross-company process innovation in retail. Network management is not only of great importance for companies in the retail industry, but also associated with significant challenges. Especially when introducing cross-company process innovations such as RFID technology, management in and of networks plays a central role. Thomas C. Salditt shows a selection of current challenges for the retail industry that increase efficiency pressure on individual traders. Cross-company process innovations such as RFID technology can be used to counter this pressure. Business networks and management of these networks are used in the context of the retail network.
content.title_en: Network management in retail : Process innovations in retail using the example of RFID technology

content.text: If controlling is understood as a rationality assurance of leadership, it has the function of identifying and reducing potential rationality deficits in the actions of managers due to self-interested actions and cognitive limitations. Essential carriers of this function are controllers. Anne Paefgen examines the following question: Does not it also have to be assumed that controllers are self-interested and cognitively limited? But who then ensures the rationality of the controllers themselves or – in other words – who controls the controller? From a behavioral perspective, the author analyses potential rationality deficits in the actions of controllers and traces them to their possible causes. From the findings gained, she derives reactive and proactive measures to ensure the rationality of controllers. Introduction -- Fundamentals of work -- Forms of potential rationality deficits in the actions of controllers -- Approaches to rationality assurance of controllers -- Conclusion.
content.title_en: Rationality deficits in the action of controllers : forms of expression and countermeasures

content.text: Theoretical principles -- The catering industry -- Theoretical model and hypothesis formation -- Empirical study -- Results of research -- Discussion and appreciation. The continuing development of the economy makes the permanent adaptability of companies a prerequisite for their long-term survival. Particularly in sectors with less potential for growth, companies need to develop strategies to achieve competitive advantages. Christine R. Schneider examines the question of the success factors in catering from the perspective of industrial economics theory, resource-based theory and entrepreneurship theory with special consideration of the entrepreneur's human and social capital. Starting from a perspective of strategic management and entrepreneurship, the author develops and tests a theoretical model in the context of a quantitative study of St. Gall's catering companies. The author identifies the entrepreneur, a differentiation strategy and the achievement of virtual pensions as critical success factors in small service companies.
content.title_en: Success factors in small service companies : An analysis of the example of gastronomy

content.text: Post-Merger integration in European-Japanese business associations: conflict-oriented analysis using the supplier management example. European companies are increasingly taking over companies in Japan. The success of such transactions is determined by the phase of post-Merger integration. Cultural differences between the acquiring European company and the Japanese target company can however endanger the post-Merger integration. This is often not known to European buyers. Carsten Herbes analyses the integration of the purchasing area, as synergies in this area often make a significant financial contribution to the success of the company's purchase. He presents the typical integration measures of the acquirer, e.g. joint procurement and conversion of the Japanese-specific supplier relationships to market relations, the objectives of the Japanese stakeholders (employees, management, suppliers) and identifies potential conflicts. He illustrates the existing conflict fields and the problems in dealing with conflicts in the overall context of post-Merger integration based on case studies and develops solutions. Theoretical foundations and analytical reference frameworks -- analysis of the individual conflict areas -- Empirical surveys and implications.
content.title_en: Post-Merger integration in European-Japanese business mergers: conflict-oriented analysis based on the example of supplier management

content.text: The Accounting of Economic Property in IFRS Accounting: A comparative analysis of accounting rules for selected legal entities. The current IASB Work Plan includes projects to re-design the accounting of financial assets, leasing accounting and the framework concept. Currently, there is a parallel approach to the subjective allocation of assets to different mapping solutions that are problematic both for certain accounting practices and from a conceptual point of view. A uniform, cross-relationship approach is missing. Sigrun Scharenberg develops a cross-relationable and appropriate system that allows for consistent accounting in a system-compliant and consistent manner. The focus is on issues where formal ownership and economic content are disparate, such as factoring, asset-backed securities, hedging re-appropriation, leasing. The current accounting solutions for this are analysed and critically evaluated using a uniformly defined risk-chance structure. The final comparative analysis leads to an aggregated accounting solution. The IFRS Accounting of Accounting and Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of the Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting of Accounting.
content.title_en: The accounting of economic property in IFRS accounting : A comparative analysis of the mapping rules for selected legal institutions

content.text: Control of virtual communities: instruments, mechanisms, and relationships. Individuals communicate and collaborate with each other in virtual communities via the Internet, whereby collaboration is mostly voluntary and without financial incentives. Companies use virtual communities for customer relationship management and knowledge management, among others. In universities, virtual learning networks are designed to increase student interaction and learning success. However, the potential of virtual communities is not exploited in many cases, as complex motivational structures make systematic member management difficult. Stefan Stieglitz develops a framework of order that enables systematic construction, operation and, in particular, control of virtual communities. To this end, he analyses structures and functions in open source projects and identifies control instruments that he transfers to other types of virtual communities. In two case studies, he tests the framework of order under real conditions on an expert network of a stock exchange and a university learning network. In the final analysis, the author shows the effects of competitive, cooperative and hierarchical control instruments in virtual communities. Institutions, institutional control and network effects - Virtual control of open-source research projects.
content.title_en: Virtual Communities Control : Instruments, mechanisms, impact relationships

content.text: Health profiling of food brand articles: measurement, determinants and implications. By increasing health profiling, manufacturers and retailers in the food industry are trying to secure market shares. Clemens Jüttner measures perceived health profiling and examines correlations to determinants and effects of success causally and experimentally based on a consumer survey of selected food brand articles. He shows that by increasing health profiling the brand value can be increased. At the same time, consumers are also willing to pay higher prices for the corresponding food. Health-oriented brand strategies as an option of brand policy in the food sector -- The investigation design of the present work -- The development of a scale for measuring the moderate health profile of food -- The theory-led model development for analysing the determinants and success effects of a health profile of food -- The development of a field experiment for measuring perceived health sponsorship and the effects on selected brand policy targets -- The development of a model for analysing the determinants and success effects of a health profile of food -- The development of a field experiment for measuring perceived health sponsorship and the effects on selected brand policy targets -- The design of an experimental and causal analysis of the consequences- The analysis of the evaluation of the impact assessment of the impact assessment.
content.title_en: Health profiling of food brand articles : Measurements, determinants and implications

content.text: Innovation strategies of Japanese and German companies: A comparative analysis. Introduction -- Case study Flat screen industry -- Innovation in Japan -- Case study Automotive electronics -- Dynamic determinants of the competitive success of companies -- Case study Mobile payment -- Success factors in German and Japanese companies -- Conclusion. In a global competitive environment, companies need to adapt their strategies more and more quickly to changing market dynamics to achieve competitive success. Raina Schweikle analyses innovation and enforcement strategies of companies in Japan and Germany. Using empirical case studies in the automotive, flat screen industry and mobile payment industry, she identifies key factors determining success for Japanese and German companies in innovative key industries.
content.title_en: Innovation strategies of Japanese and German companies : A comparative analysis

content.text: The operational management of production enterprises: development of a process model. Management of production enterprises faces the problem that the derivation of strategic plans into operational action possibilities and their implementation often does not lead to the desired success. The goals developed from the strategy process often find no correlation in the action potentials; implementation weaknesses arise. Manfred Bracher puts the operational management of production enterprises into focus from the point of view of a target-oriented corporate management. He critically questions existing management models and examines how they can be applied to solve the problem. The author develops a process model which he illuminates within a multidimensional order system under the aspects of processes, structures, evaluation and corporate culture. In this context, the adaptation and integration of Total Productive Maintenance play a significant role. Using a case study, he examines the applicability and effectiveness of the model and derives recommendations for the management of production enterprises. Problem description -- Management models -- Process model for the operational management -- Case study -- Findings and recommendations for action -- Summary and outlook.
content.title_en: The operational management of production enterprises : development of a process model

content.text: Development and design of a company controlling in medium-sized construction companies: Taking into account two empirical studies in a time comparison. Introduction -- Controlling as an integrated task of corporate management in medium-sized construction companies -- The construction accounting as an information basis for corporate controlling in medium-sized construction companies -- Company controlling in medium-sized construction companies -- Consideration of the own empirical studies in medium-sized construction companies in a time comparison -- Summary. Structural change in the German construction industry is the most severe subject of medium-sized construction companies. For the survival of these companies, the company controlling plays a decisive role. Christian Keidel determines the degree of dissemination and development of the company controlling in medium-sized construction companies. He determines a typical appearance and develops a company controlling for medium-sized construction companies based on the value-added-oriented controlling concept, which provides assistance in adapting to market developments and in the company itself.
content.title_en: Development and design of company controlling in medium-sized construction companies : taking into account two empirical studies in time comparison

content.text: The customer relationship risk from the company's perspective. The significance of the customer relationship risk in customer value-oriented marketing -- Customer relations: Subject area and theoretical reference framework -- The risk from the company's perspective -- The customer relationship risk -- Final consideration. The discussion about the risks of entrepreneurial trading has long been a central priority within business research and corporate practice. Based on value-oriented customer relationship management, Jochen Becker develops a multidimensional concept of customer relationship risk. He refers to existing risk concepts in financial literature and controlling, whose applicability to relationship marketing he critically examines. To determine the individual risk dimensions, models are developed that enable implementation in corporate practice.
content.title_en: The customer relationship risk from the corporate perspective

content.text: The effect of credibility in marketing communication: An analysis of short- and long-term effects. Credibility in marketing communication and persuasion research -- Instruments and forms of marketing communication -- The development of persuasion effects over time -- Empirical investigation -- Final consideration. A credible and convincing marketing communication is of great importance for companies. Franziska Küster-Rohde examines the credibility of various design options and checks to what extent this affects a higher effectiveness and persuasivity of marketing communication. The author also considers the development of effects over time. The author shows that credibility has basically positive effects, but that this advantage is balanced over time and is not long-term. The results of her investigation provide valuable evidence for a goal-oriented design of marketing communication.
content.title_en: The impact of credibility in marketing communication: An analysis of short- and long-term effects

content.text: Councils Organization : Structures, processes, persons and relationships. Aim and research question -- Inventory of the state of research for internal corporate communication -- Reasoning the suitability of basic theory and the research method -- Basic theoretical foundations -- Description of the Councils Organization -- Optimality and efficiency criteria -- Human resources economic conclusions -- Result summary and outlook. Relational social capital influences the competitive position of companies as well as financial and material capital, thus making communication a key function for companies. As a communication-oriented organizational form, Inéz Labucay presents the Councils Organization. Using the structures, processes, persons and relationships categories, it designs a powerful grid and displays personnel-economic, organizational and management-related links to implementation in company practice.
content.title_en: Council Organization : Structures, processes, persons and relationships

content.text: Improving attitudes towards geometric proof through a suggestive story-based dynamic geometry approach. This paper presents and explores an approach in which students are presented with geometrical problems about a daily history using dynamic geometry software. This aims to enable them to recognize the importance of geometry for daily life, to experience the process of formulating geometric statements and assumptions together, and to perceive geometrical evidence as something beyond the mere confirmation of the correctness of geometrical sentences. They begin with the real situation and are led by seven steps towards geometrical proofs. The content of the teaching material is structured in a structured manner, each unit being the prerequisite for the next, either geometrically structurally or embedded in history.
content.title_en: Improving attitudes towards geometric proof through a suggestive story-based dynamic geometry approach

content.text: GIS concept and contours of an IT master plan: planning and system development for information technology. Geographical information system (GIS) as an information medium -- Purpose of GIS use and actual location -- Core problems and contours of strategic GIS planning -- Implication -- Summary -- Conclusion and outlook. The development of information technology has been experiencing a variety of application euphoria since the late 1990s. This is based on a redundant, superficially integrated and not systematically designed IT landscape. To ensure its competitiveness, administration, industry and economy are now more dependent than ever on ICT technologies. However, the need to invest in IT infrastructure is often faced with analysts' statements that the majority of IT investments hardly achieve the original objectives. Ghader Haghwerdi-Poor investigates the goal and purpose of high investment in IT as part of a ten-year balance sheet analysis. Using methods of action research, he describes the actual position of the use of geographical information systems (GIS) and the implementation of this policy of the information system (GIS) as a toolkit.
content.title_en: GIS concept and contours of an IT master plan : planning and system development for information technology

content.text: Audit quality of the auditor : The influence of the term of office on the client's balance sheet policy. The question of the extent to which a statutory limitation of the auditor's term of office contributes to an increase in the quality of the audit is the subject of a controversial discussion for more than 30 years. The debate about such an external mandatory rotation was initiated due to numerous balance sheet scandals of the past years, which have led to doubts about the quality of the audit. Daniela Wiemann first analyzes in an empirical study the influence of the term of office of the auditor on the quality of the audit for Germany.
content.title_en: Audit quality of the auditor: influence of the term of office on the client's balance sheet policy

content.text: Interactions between organization and social software in knowledge work. Knowledge enables companies to build a long-term competitive advantage. Social software is often used for the purpose of knowledge work, but its implementation in the company is not always satisfactory. Simone Kansy therefore deals with the influence of the organizational structure on the use of social software in knowledge work and the implications for the organization resulting from the use. The author develops an integrative reference framework, which is based on aspects of economic information technology, organizational theory and sociology, and then on a comparative case study of the importance of the organizational structure for the use of social software.
content.title_en: Interactions between organization and social software in knowledge work

content.text: Computer criminal law in comparison with law - Germany, Austria, Switzerland. Main description: Daniel Schuh presents the provisions of the German Criminal Code on the fight against computer crime as amended in the context of the 41st Criminal Law Amendment Act (§ 202a, 303a and b) and newly inserted (§ 202b and c). After an explanation of the basics for the reform (Cybercrime Convention and EU Framework Decision), a comparison is made, among other things, on the basis of selected examples, such as phishing and hacking, with the regulations of our neighbouring countries Austria and Switzerland. -- The author concludes that the German standards consistently implement the regulations of the Cybercrime Convention and the EU Framework Decision, effectively combat computer crime and require only small adjustments. The regulations in the Austrian and Swiss Criminal Code, however, reveal criminality gaps. Taking into account the results, the author ultimately proposes amendments to the German regulations.
content.title_en: Computer criminal law in comparison - Germany, Austria, Switzerland

content.text: Integrated Usage Mining : A method for analyzing user behavior on the web. How do users use websites? With established methods, it is not possible to find sufficiently detailed, objective and representative answers to this. Kai Honsel closes this research gap with a new methodology: the integration of web usage mining and eye tracking. In addition to the theory, the author describes the software-technical implementation and demonstrates the added value and efficiency of the process in a large-scale reference study.
content.title_en: Integrated Usage Mining : A method for analyzing user behavior on the web

content.text: Visual Communication Research: Media images as a challenge for communication and media science. We live in a visual media culture, a 'visual culture' in which we are constantly confronted with 'images' of a variety of kinds: advertising tries to seduce us with perfectly staged images, press photos let us become eyewitnesses of distant wars and catastrophes and politicians strive to present themselves in a camera-friendly manner. But also in everyday life we capture all important events photographically, in order to remember and share them with others. But how can images be decoded? And how is the communicative 'power of images' to explain? Katharina Lobinger determines the approach of 'visual communication research' in relation to other image sciences. Here the central research fields are worked out: images in journalism, in advertising, public relations, political communication and in mediatized everyday communication. In a metaanalysis, the author examines the development, establishment and research activities of 'visual communication research' in the last 20 years and shows which methods were produced in the previous university of communication.
content.title_en: Visual Communication Research : Media Images as a Challenge for Communication and Media Studies

content.text: Communication networks and productivity of inventors : An empirical analysis of the German tissue engineering industry. In knowledge-intensive industries inventions are considered as an essential source of future competitiveness. In this context, the communication networks of inventors play a central role in the invention process. Maria Heibel analyses the relationship between the communication networks and the productivity of inventors. Based on a quantitative empirical analysis, detailed knowledge about the importance of communication networks in the invention process as well as the dual causality between the networking and the productivity of inventors is gained.
content.title_en: Communication networks and productivity of inventors : An empirical analysis of the German tissue engineering industry

content.text: Liability, assignment and proof of impossibility at the beginning and at the end of the period. Main description: Daniel Peres is dedicated to problem areas at the interface between material law and civil procedural law, which have not yet been satisfactorily resolved even ten years after the reform of the law of the law of the guilty. As much attention has been paid to the elements of liability for impossibility, so little literature is found that is decisively concerned with the respective impossibility of impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the impossibility of the law of the law of the law of the law of the law of the evidence.
content.title_en: Liability, impossibility of attribution and evidence

content.text: Criminal prosecution aspects of criminal doping. Main description: Jan-Frederik Kolbe deals with the criminal prosecution aspects. The starting point of the investigation is the view prevailing in the literature that the criminal prosecution standards of the AMG are so-called "dead law". This thesis is confirmed first by an empirical investigation conducted by the author, involving all the German general prosecutors and all the federal ministries of justice, before the application of the criminal prosecution rules in the criminal proceedings is examined under orientation to the chronological course of the criminal proceedings – and here a focus on the initiation of proceedings. This approach shows several specificities, discusses controversial problems and gives suggestions for the revitalization of this "dead law".
content.title_en: Criminal procedural aspects of criminal doping prosecution

content.text: The organizational involvement in criminal law: the actual behaviour of the organizational crimes and the phenomenon of terrorist financing. Main description: In this work the facts of §§ 84, 85 StGB, § 20 para. 1 no. 1 to 4 VereinG and §§ 129, 129a StGB are presented as a uniform complex of organizational crimes. The focus of this study is the specific organizational involvement. This reduces the organization at the same time to an environment in which the participation behaviour takes place. Natalia Eroshkina uses this view to address the group dynamic explanation approach of the organizational crimes. In detail, in the course of the work, the organizational criminal law is examined in a context with the constitutional limits of the freedom of association according to Art. 9 para. 2 GG. This criticism is presented and the calculation structure of the participation in an association and its expression in the system of organizational-specific participation roles can be described in the context of the legal protection of the legal offence.
content.title_en: Organisational participation in criminal law: the actual behaviour of the organi zations and the phenomenon of terrorist financing

content.text: The identification of persons by witnesses in criminal proceedings: requirements for the proper conduct of recognition procedures and the assessment of the proof value of identification services with particular consideration of legal psychological and criminal aspects. False identifications by witnesses represent a significant proportion of the total number of judicial errors in German criminal proceedings. How can false identifications occur? -- Recognizing a person as a former perpetrator is subject to an extremely complicated cognitive process. The identification performance of witnesses can be impaired by a number of psychologically investigated factors and is extremely flawed. Nevertheless, the identification of persons by witnesses in criminal proceedings often leads to a pioneering significance. -- Anja Hofmann shows that by nature the recognition of persons who are prone to error can be made more reliable by observing certain methodological methods. It strongly demands that the persons responsible for the identification of persons in criminal proceedings pay sufficient attention to these legal psychological and criminal tactical findings and that the recognition of persons who are susceptible to error can be made more reliable by observing certain methods.
content.title_en: Identification of persons by witnesses in criminal proceedings: requirements for the proper conduct of recognition procedures and assessment of the value of evidence of identification services with particular regard to legal psychological and criminal aspects

content.text: Urban transformation processes in Central and Eastern Europe: Urban development between growth and shrinkage using the example of Łódź and Gdańsk. Urban transformation processes in Central and Eastern Europe are linked to profound social and spatial changes.The development processes in many cities are also influenced by the increasing globalization, demographic change and the effects of the financial and economic crisis. Against this background, Anja Erdmann examines the development and effects of shrinking and growing urban development processes in Central and Eastern Europe. Using the two case studies Łódź and Gdańsk, she also looks at the independent and quite divergent development paths and thus contributes to a differentiated understanding of the urban transformation process.The content of the basic conditions of transformation in Central and Eastern Europe since 1990 Urban transformation processes Regional context – Poland Current urban development processes in Łódź and Gdańsk Large cities in the field of growth and shrinking The target groups Dozierende and students of urban geography, sociology and politics in the field of urban planning and urban planning in the field of urban politics.
content.title_en: Urban transformation processes in Central and Eastern Europe: Urban development between growth and shrinkage using the example of Łódź and Gdańsk

content.text: School policy in cities with a decline in school attendance: A governance analysis using the example of Leipzig and Timişoara. The governance approach as an analysis perspective -- Historical-political context of East Germany and Romania -- The way in which the numbers of pupils in Leipzig and Timişoara are treated in comparison -- The number of pupils at the interface between education and urban policy is decreasing. Anne Walde analyses political negotiation processes in connection with falling student numbers in cities affected by demographic change and migration. Using the example of Leipzig and the Romanian city of Timişoara, she considers the decisions on school closures that are often controversial and the clash between conflicting interests of parents, schools, politics and administration. Using the governance perspective, the author shows that the political decisions depend on the actors and their options for action against other actors and how this is concretely presented to students in the field of education research in the context of the German student population and the context of the school administration in the context of school attendance.
content.title_en: School policy in cities with a drop in school attendance : A governance analysis using the example of Leipzig and Timişoara

content.text: Strategic planning of a circular economy system for photovoltaic modules: Data-based forecasting and development of a comprehensive system understanding. The author develops the necessary information, in particular the expected amount of material to be recovered in a cycle. This results in a comprehensive understanding of the system, which enables the conception of a circular economy system for photovoltaic modules at a strategic level. This allows valuable resources to be returned to recycling due to the strong spread of photovoltaic systems in large quantities. The content • Technological and economic framework conditions • Forecast of installed performance • Revenue for the recovery of existing material quantities • Modelling of the circular economy system • Implications for the optimal design of the circular economy system The target groups • Lecturers and students of the economic engineering, the economic sciences and the applied natural sciences • Specialists and managers from the field of photovoltaics and the waste economy The author Dr.-Ing. Martin Dirr is a scientific employee at the Chair of Production & Supply Chain Management at the University of Augsburg. In addition to classical questions of operation management in the field of production and logistics, he deals with aspects of sustainability, especially of the economic management of the forecasting systems for the recycling of energy systems.
content.title_en: Strategic planning of a circular economy system for photovoltaic modules : Data-based forecast and development of a comprehensive system understanding

content.text: Method for evaluating fatigue resistance of friction-resistant systems. Friction-prone applications -- Tribological systematics -- Calculation approaches for strength assessment -- Universal test method -- Calculating strength verification. The author analyses friction-prone fatigue as a combined tribo-mechanical damage phenomenon and develops an approach based on it for the strength assessment of friction-prone systems. He extends the FKM detection and uses a universal test method to determine the necessary parameters, the tribological roughness factors, experimentally depending on the most important system parameters. Thus, he achieves a significant improvement in the prediction of failure compared to the classical approach. The content of friction-prone applications Tribological classification Calculation approaches for strength assessment Universal test method Calculating strength detection The target groups Dozierde and students of mechanical engineering, automotive technology, aerospace and materials sciences are among the research groups of the company.
content.title_en: Method for assessing fatigue resistance of friction-resistance-stressed systems

content.text: - Leonhard Euler's work on celestial mechanics. This overall presentation of Leonhard Euler's work on celestial mechanics shows how mathematical methods and physical principles developed in the solutions of celestial mechanical problems, gradually established and developed into standard methods through versatile applications that are still valid in classical astronomy and physics. In an introductory chapter, familiar and newly discovered original sources and publications are described, whose authorship could be assigned to Euler. The second chapter introduces in a compact way the development of the problems of time and in Euler's methods of solution. In the third and fourth chapters, Euler's contributions to celestial mechanics are described point-shaped and extended bodies according to their content and their chronological evolution. The extensive appendix consists of summary tables and German translations of some works of Euler's work on celestial mechanics. Introduction -- Problem positions and Euler's methods of solution -- Euler's works on celestial mechanics point-shaped bodies -- Euler's works on celestial mechanics extended bodies -- Summary and conclusions -- Annexes and directories.
content.title_en: Leonhard Euler's work on celestial mechanics
