content.title_en: With multi-level knowledge acquisition to increase innovation success : A conceptual and empirical study in technical industries

content.text: The use of the height objecticity information in criminal proceedings is the basis of this work's application rules according to § 161 para. 2 sentence 1 and § 477 para. 2 sentence 2 StPO, which allow a purpose-changing use of data in criminal proceedings "for evidence purposes only under the condition of the hypothetical possibility of ordering the origin measure. Whether the prohibition of use resulting from this prohibition of use "for evidence purposes also concerns the ordering of coercive measures – in this respect, the investigation and the detention is dealt with as a central question of this work.
content.title_en: Use of unusable random knowledge in criminal proceedings

content.text: The energy efficiency of factories in automotive production. Energy use in vehicle manufacturing -- Concept for the energy improvement of automobile factories -- Identification of energy-efficient processes -- Measures selection and potential evaluation. Patrick Dehning designs a four-step overall concept for a continuous energy-efficient improvement process in manufacturing companies. It makes internal knowledge usable and thus contributes to a reduction of the energy-efficiency gap. Within the concept, the author identifies energy-efficient manufacturing processes by means of a statistical comparison at the trade level. In the second step, he makes available to the user existing ideas and "good practices" within the company by means of a concept for selection and decision support. The content of energy use in vehicle production Concept for the energy-efficient improvement of automotive factories Identification of energy-efficient processes Measures selection and potential evaluation The target groups Dozierende and students of the fields of production technology and environmental engineering one energy representative, energy supplier and energy supplier.
content.title_en: Increasing the energy efficiency of factories in automotive production

content.text: Science, technology development and the modes of play of capitalism: Analysis of the development of seeds in the USA and Germany. Types of knowledge capitalism -- intellectual property rights -- science and technology development in the agricultural sector -- Green biotechnology. Barbara Brandl illustrates the intertwinedness of technology development and socio-political setting by using the example of agricultural innovations. In particular, she works out how the focus on a one-sided innovation ideal in late capitalist societies in the long term poses a risk of significantly limiting the knowledge potential that is ready to solve future problems. The development of seeds is particularly important in terms of sustainability, as the quality and diversification of seeds not only results in the quality of food, but also provides a decisive contribution to biodiversity and thus to the future of this planet.The content • Types of knowledge capitalism • intellectual property rights • Science and technology development in the agricultural sector • Green biotechnology The target groups • Docents and students of sociology • Practitioners in policy advice, innovation and science policy as well as agricultural policy The author Barbara Brandl is a scientific employee at the professorship of economics of the university.
content.title_en: Science, technology development and the modes of capitalism : Analysis of the development of seeds in the USA and Germany

content.text: The product design of climate protection funds as a sustainable investment product for private investors: An empirical analysis of the preferences and product requirements of German retail investors. Market overview of climate protection funds and their preference-based scoring -- Preferential measurement by means of conjoint analysis -- Importance and content of a label for sustainable funds with regard to climate protection. Thomas Steiauf reveals in this book the preferences of retail investors for climate protection funds. He works out the importance of traditional product characteristics of a fund such as risk and return compared to sustainable product characteristics and how these characteristics should be designed. In addition, the author shows how the preferences of investors are perceived by product providers and recommendations are given for the improvement of sustainable funds for three clusters of different investor types. Because, although the achievement of the German climate protection goals requires investments of the private sector, sustainable investment funds with regard to climate protection so far have few means. The content of market overview of climate protection funds and their preference-based scoring Preferential measurement by means of conjoint analysis are important and content of a label for sustainable funds with regard to climate protection The target groups Dozende and students from the financial industry and marketing departments of the business administration of the fund.
content.title_en: The product design of climate protection funds as a sustainable investment product for private investors: An empirical analysis of the preferences and product requirements of German retail investors

content.text: For a period of over 30 years, Kathrin Konrad traces the main trends in everyday mobility of men and women, classifys these trends in the change of norms and gender relations and includes a research gap in the field of gender and mobility through her holistic approach to traffic behaviour and its framework conditions. The quantitative study takes into account the social diversity of society and the spatial context as a framework of everyday mobility in the gender relationship based on the complex regression models. In men and women, both everyday mobility itself and its framework conditions change significantly during the period of observation – partly very different depending on the social and spatial environment. While in the course of time, many behavioural differences between men and women disappear in some population groups, however, with regard to some dimensions of everyday mobility and in individual groups, some differences are persistent.
content.title_en: Mobile everyday life in the change of gender relations

content.text: Carsharing and the Society of Tomorrow: An environmentally conscious approach to car sharing?. Based on a quantitative survey of about 1500 young people and young adults from Baden-Württemberg, Sarah Witzke shows a restrained tendency towards the intention to use car sharing vehicles instead of their own cars in the future. It shows that the ownership of a car is therefore of great importance for this group. A linear regression calculation has also identified key factors influencing car sharing intentions. In particular, the influence of significant third parties, the perceived car sharing availability and the awareness of the environmental impact of motorised individual traffic are therefore decisive.The content Problem outline: More sustainable mobility as a challenge of the future Car sharing – a classic example of collaborative consumption The youth and the concept Car sharing Theoretical explanatory models for the choice of transport Quantitative main study: Car sharing as an alternative to their own car?The research groups Dozierende und Studierende der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Sozialwissenschaften und der Mobilitätsforschung Fach und Executiveen aus der Automobilitätsbranche, Car sharing Die Unternehmenschaftsverbieten von Abwörständerung istschaftsbeiträgerstandin Ulm am Forschungsmittschaftsmitt.
content.title_en: Carsharing and the Society of Tomorrow : An environmentally conscious approach to automobiles?

content.text: Constitutional evolution in the world society : Differentiation problems of law and politics in the age of global governance. The focus of the volume is on the topic of global constitutionalism and the resulting problems of global governance. The starting point is the question whether global law is capable of taking on important tasks of global governance and can remain receptive to problems of social exclusion, even if there is no political world constitution.
content.title_en: Constitutional evolution in the world society : Differentiation problems of law and politics in the age of global governance

content.text: The reliability of the notes in the IFRS financial statements: A theoretical and empirical analysis. An annex from the theoretical, normative and empirical perspective -- The significance of the audit for the reliability of financial statements -- The significance of the annex in the annual financial statements -- The reliability of the notes in the annual financial statements -- Reliability depending on the location of the statements. Stefan R. Grabs shows that the reliability is limited in particular by subjective notes in the IFRS financial statements and, in particular, the audit in this case can only contribute to a limited increase. The author first considers the theoretical, normative and empirical perspectives of the annex and the final audit with the focus on the concept of sufficient audit certainty.In the context of his own empirical analysis, the determinants of the maximum audit reliability of notes in the financial statements are shown and also analysed the effect of the disclosure location (Annex or balance sheet/calculation of results).
content.title_en: The reliability of notes in IFRS financial statements : A theoretical and empirical analysis

content.text: The key actors of the waste disposal management system: Disposal options and strategies of radioactive waste from the perspective of regional actors. Social science ‘End-camp research' -- Individual expectations of waste management policy (after 2014) -- Fair and effective citizen participation in potential sites -- Individual evaluation of waste management options. Cord Drögemüller deals with the regional dimension of the waste management conflict of high-radioactive waste in the Federal Republic of Germany. From the perspective of governance and participation research, he examines local problem perceptions. Here, local politicians and civil society stakeholders' expectations of a 'good' waste disposal policy are demonstrated. The author highlights opportunities and limits of citizen participation as well as the evaluation of various waste management options. He shows that a reliable and equally flexible disposal management system requires a high-quality and demand-oriented participation of citizens with fair negotiation processes. Classical management approaches are too short to meet the demanding civil society expectations. The content of social science ‘End-camp research' Individual expectations of waste management policy (after 2014) The effective disposal management of waste management systems in Berlin
content.title_en: Key actors in the repository governance: disposal options and strategies of radioactive waste from the perspective of regional actors

content.text: The book deals with the topic of violence in the youth and peer approach. Detailed theoretical explanations about peer involvement and peer education are made as a pedagogical method, which is used in a growing number of projects. The peer approach is presented and analysed in terms of its relevance to the practical relevance of participatory work with children and adolescents and especially its possibilities for preventing violence. The topic of youth violence, which is increasingly in the focus of the public and media, is presented and analysed taking into account causes and origin and actual occurrence. Special features of youth age, current violence numbers and violence in the school are at the centre of this issue. A special focus of the book is on the connection of peer education and violence prevention. To this end, the violence prevention project ‘Schlag.frei' is presented and evaluated in terms of "Schlag.frei" (prevention of violence) is then examined in terms of how to conduct the student's own actions in terms of how to conduct the student's activities.
content.title_en: Peer Education & Violence Prevention : Theory and Practice presented at the project Schlag.schick

content.text: Research on the vibration and noise behaviour of the crank drive of an internal combustion engine. Body sound conduction in the internal combustion engine -- Measurement of condensation vibrations -- Measurement of the value transfer system for real motor operation -- Comparison of experimental results with simulation calculations. By combining various measurement concepts in the field of body sound measurement and the use of detailed signal analysis methods, Daniel Hrdina can represent a holistic understanding of the body sound transmission via the crank drive of an internal combustion engine. He examines the sensitivity to various parameters in the internal control path and in the excitation conditions. As the most influential factor, the author identifies the pressure increase rate – and thus the injection parameters. Based on this, he introduces the concept of the operational point-dependent combustion chamber pressure gradient, the potential for optimization under NVH vision points at a passenger car diesel engine with common rail injection.
content.title_en: Studies of the vibration and noise behaviour of the crankshaft drive of an internal combustion engine

content.text: Innovation Paths: Evolution and Institutionalization of Complex Technology. The model of innovation paths presented by Uli Meyer opens up a new perspective on the development of complex technology. To this end, it integrates insights of sociological neo-institutionalism and social evolutionary theories to explain how innovation paths develop and what mechanisms they stabilize and strengthen. The presented perspective is justifiable to the fact that technology is increasingly being generated in stable networks of many organizations and no longer by individual organizations or inventors. Innovation paths are expression and at the same time drivers of the increasingly routine and stable search for new things. The model is developed using the example of the establishment of electronic systems in the automotive industry, in particular driver assistance systems. The content A sociological perspective on technology development and the underlying processes describe innovation paths, how concrete forms of the development of complex technology institutionalize and certain technological development dynamics solidify driver assistance systems electronics development in the automotive industry The target groups scientists, lecturers and students of sociology, in particular technology, and organizational sociology and innovation research social scientists The author of the German Research Center for Technology Research.
content.title_en: Innovation Paths : Evolution and Institutionalization of Complex Technology

content.text: The SE Works Council : Application requirements and the design of the operational co-determination by the SE Works Council by agreement and by law. The core topic of the work is the prerequisites and contents of the operational co-determination by the SE Works Council by agreement and by law. In this context, it is mainly examined to what extent the social partners can negotiate a tailor-made participation agreement, which is tailored to the respective Societas Europaea (SE) and precisely adapted to the respective Societas Europaea (SE). The limits of this autonomy against the background of the requirements for the SE Works Council by law have so far been treated only "deeply" in the literature. The inclusion of exemplary participation agreements from practice rounds off the examination of theoretically permissible and appropriate agreement options.
content.title_en: The SE Works Council : Application requirements and organization of the operational co-determination by the SE Works Council by agreement and by law

content.text: Open Source Compliance. Many companies define "Open Source Compliance" rules for dealing with open source software. This work, using the example of the GPL, describes the legal specificities and risks and examines common best practices for establishing an open source compliance system.
content.title_en: Open Source Compliance

content.text: The Department of Urban Governance and the Department of Urban Governance in the district: A format of integrated and cooperative district development. The Department of Urban Governance and the Department of Urban Governance in the district of Cologne are responsible for the planning of urban planning. The Department of Urban Governance and the Department of Urban Governance in the district of Cologne are responsible for the planning of urban planning. The Department of Urban Governance and the Department of Urban Governance in the district of Cologne are responsible for the planning of urban planning, urban planning, urban planning, urban planning, content.title_en: Alliances for housing in the neighbourhood : A format of integrated and cooperative development of quarters

content.text: International Corruption and Jurisdiction Conflicts: The Sanctions of Companies in the Case of Bribing Foreign Officials. Claudia Letzien examines the criminality of bribery of foreign officials and the various sanctions that can be imposed on companies in this context. The author addresses the problem of legal disputes that arise if different states want to enforce their claim for sanctions against a company and makes it clear that these cannot be resolved with the principle ne bis in idem. She proposes a procedure that best compensates the different interests in the sanctioning of companies by several states in criminal cases. The content Penalty of bribery of foreign officials in the USA, Germany and in the UK Special features of the company sanctions Procedures and extrajudicial proceedings Basics and limits of national jurisdiction in criminal cases The principles ne bis in idem and double jeopardy Transfer of criminal law to a state and criteria for determining the most appropriate legal system The law enforcement officers and lawyers in Berlin are lawyers, law enforcement lawyers, law enforcement lawyers, law enforcement lawyers, law enforcement lawyers, lawyers.
content.title_en: International corruption and conflict of jurisdiction: sanctioning companies in case of bribery of foreign officials

content.title_en: Emergency algorithms : Dilemmas in automated road transport

content.text: Electromagnetic couplings of hybrid AC-DC lines: Calculations based on a distributed line model. Jakob Schindler uses an analytical, distributed line model based on a modal transformation adapted to the line geometry for the exact calculation of the basic frequency couplings of AC to DC in hybrid transmission lines. The author illuminates a variety of different influencing factors such as line configuration, phase arrangement, load flow and distortion. The parameters matrix of overhead lines are determined by modal transformations Calculation of hybrid lines as distributed line model Hybrid lines with partial dirching Burning duration of the secondary light arc The target groups of scientists, practitioners and lecturers in the field of hybrid AC-DC transmission lines The author Jakob Schindler completed his bachelor and master studies in the field of electrical transmission lines from 2008 to 2015 as a result of the study of electric transmission lines.
content.title_en: Electromagnetic couplings of hybrid AC-DC lines : Calculations based on a distributed line model

content.text: Interorganisational information systems in the maritime transport chain: An information-economic investigation in the field of containerised inland transport. Holger Pontow demonstrates that interorganisational information systems in the maritime transport chain promise numerous potential benefits. In order to be able to assess these qualitatively and quantitatively in advance of investment decisions, he uses methods and tools from the areas of business process management (especially business process modelling using BPMN) and decision theory in the core of his investigation. It is evident – mainly on the basis of the inter-organisational business process understanding mediated – that alongside organisations that implement transport and handling, in particular shippers suitable systems for communication should use to realize theoretically possible potential benefits in practice. The content of surveying and analysis of business processes and information flows in import and export as well as a loader survey and analysis of utility functions for shipowners, terminal operators, rail operators, railway transport companies The target groups of lecturers and students in the fields of logistics (transport) logistics and business information practitioners in the field of maritime transport chains (as well as a specialist in business administration and logistics) know business management of business and business administration.
content.title_en: Interorganisational information systems in the maritime transport chain: an information-economic study in the field of containerised inland transport

content.text: Online communication of members of the Bundestag: politicians in the new country. With a complex statistical analysis strategy, Christoph Blank succeeds in validating the selective political online communication behaviour of members of the Bundestag. At the same time, he expands the usual member typologies from the member of parliament's sociology with his result. His research toolkit and his differentiated findings from a written survey of 208 MdB in 2009 offer themselves as foundations for special follow-up studies. "Self-marketing" is the primary motive of members of parliament when using digital political communication possibilities. One-way communication determines predominantly their network activities. Interaction and participation offers offer them rather rarely to the citizens. The content Effects theses on the relevance of the Internet in the parliamentary representation system Application examples of political online communication between parliamentarians and citizens Model of influence factors on the online media usage behavior of members of parliament typology in the use of digital communication channels The target groups Dozierende und Studieren der Politikn Kommunikation, Kommunikationsberater, Politikverantar, Campaigner, Deputer Behörunger von Behörungen der Behörungen-Blaurendetagung-Blauben-Blauben-Blauträs-Blautrags-Blautragung-Blaus-Blautung-Blautung-Blautung-Blautung-Blautung-Blaus-Blaus-Blautung-Blautung-Blaus-Blautung-Blaus-Blaus-Blautung-Blautlautung-Blauslauslaus-Blaus-Blaus
content.title_en: Online communication of members of the Bundestag : politicians in the new country

content.text: This compliance in the inpatient care of the elderly: concepts and strategies to prevent crime against the person. The aim of a responsible nursing home management must be to identify, evaluate and prevent criminal risks in the institution. Based on the right to non-violent care and criminal-related statements for causes of violence in nursing institutions, this work is a manual of care practice which is intended to explore the chances of criminal compliance in the inpatient care of the elderly. The findings show that not only home residents can and must be protected from overruns but also caregivers who are authorised to visit nursing facilities.
content.title_en: Criminal compliance in the care of the elderly: concepts and strategies to prevent crimes against the person

content.text: The topic of the lecture is: "Dreinhalts-based Advertifzen" (Dreinhalts-based Advertifzen der Konsumerabnahme) (Dreinhalts-based Advertifischen Dreinhaltungs-Bestimmung) (Dreinhalts-based Advertifischen Dreinhalts-Bestimmung) (Dreinhalts-based Advertifischen der Konsumerabnahme von LBA und der Konsumerabnahme) (Dreinhalts-based Advertifischen Dreinhaltungs-Bestimmung) (Dreinhalts-Bestimmanten der Konsumerabnahme von LBA. Claudius Warwitz shows that privacy concerns play little role in the decision to use location-based advertising (LBA).
content.title_en: Location-based advertising in the context of big data : determinants of consumer acceptance

content.text: The Palestinian Authority is analysed as a strategic terrain in which cooperation, conflicts and struggles between the Israeli occupation power, Western development agencies and Palestinian organizations are concentrated. This makes it visible how competitive, dependent and at the same time neoliberal the state formation in Palestine is fundamentally shaped as well as by multiple crisis dynamics. It is not the much-conceived insolubleness of the Middle East conflict that is continued here, but the complex responsibility for the status quo is explained.The content of PLO and Oslo peace process Political Islam Neoliberal development policies Israeli occupation regime Political economy of state formation Materialistic state theories The target groups Dozierende und Studierender aus den Fachgebiete Politikwissenschaft, Internationale Beziehungen, Soziologie, Internationale Entwicklung, Kultur- und Sozialanthropologie, Friedens- und Konfliktforschungslehre und Volkswirtschaftsle Prakturen aus den Fachgebieten Entwicklungsarbeitschaft und Kriegerschaftsmittels, Universität der Kriegerschaften, Soziologischien und Forschungsmittelsbehörstander.
content.title_en: Fighting Statehood : Palestine between occupation, development and political Islam

content.text: The function integration of electric drives in mobile working machines. Introduction -- Functional integration of drives in mobile working machines -- Drive systems in mobile working machines -- Decision aids for the evaluation of drive lines -- Research and developments on electric drives in agricultural machinery -- Development study of functional integration for threshing drum drive -- Test bench tests for the determination of the characteristic fields. Laboratory tests for the function testing in the material flow -- Summary -- Outlook. In this book, the function integration of an electric drive in mobile working machines is explained and implemented. Up to now, functional integration has not yet been carried out in mobile working machines. The drive types mechanics, hydraulics and electrics have been compared and evaluated according to various evaluation criteria. The state of the art of electrical drives in agricultural machinery has been comprehensively and fully researched and described by the first use in the 19th century to this day. With the introduction and calculated complexity costs, the complexity of an electric drive strand can be compared with the usual mechanical drive line in the concept phase.
content.title_en: Functional integration of electric drives in mobile machines

content.text: Social Media as a tool of customer communication: Comparative study of companies in China, Germany and the USA. Anja Corduan examines the extent to which the communication approaches for social media, which are argued in science, can claim universal validity and whether these cultural peculiarities are subject to. The comparative study analyses the USA, Germany and China, which have similar values in the variables Internet penetration and bandwidths, but are culturally very different. Using ten case studies of international large companies such as adidas or Samsung, the communication of the companies on Weibo and Facebook is examined in detail. Finally, concrete and practical recommendations for action are derived.The content • Social Media in companies and current challenges in intercultural context • Analysis of social media customer communication by companies The target groups • Lecturers and students in the fields of International Marketing, Interactive Marketing, International Communication, Social Media Management • Social Media Manager and Digital Manager from practice The author Dr. Anja Corduan has been working as a manager in marketing and online communication in companies worldwide for about 15 years. As a lecturer at various universities in Germany and Hong Kong, she teaches in the areas of social management, social media management, and in Dresden.
content.title_en: Social Media as an instrument of customer communication : Comparative study of companies in China, Germany and the USA

content.text: Frugal Innovations: An investigation of the criteria and the procedure for product development. Criteria for defining frugal innovation -- Design of the innovation process -- Procedure for identifying customer needs -- Procedure for conceptual development. . Timo Weyrauch examines which criteria define a frugal innovation and how frugal innovation can be developed. In the first part of the study, three criteria are developed on the basis of a literature review and a qualitative survey to delimit frugal innovation from non-frugal innovation. In the second part, the application of action research will investigate how the innovation and product development process should be aligned. The author shows with which approaches and methods frugal innovation can be developed specifically. The content Criteria for defining frugal innovation Design of the innovation process Procedure for identifying customer needs Procedure for conceptual development The target groups of lecturers and students in engineering, technology and innovation management, business engineering and business economics can be developed. The content Criteria for defining frugal innovation Design of the innovation process Procedure for identifying customer needs Procedure for conceptual development The target groups of lecturers and students in engineering, technology and innovation management, business engineering and business administration.
content.title_en: Frugal innovations: An examination of the criteria and the approach to product development

content.title_en: Interdisciplinary cooperation in the creation of 3D models of history

content.text: Vehicle Drives for Electric Mobility: Total Cost of Ownership, Energy Efficiency, CO2 Emissions and Customer Benefits. Danny Kreyenberg shows the technological status of alternative drives and examines the conditions for achieving the ambitious target costs for batteries and fuel cells by means of a novel 2-factor experience curve. He also discusses the legal and fiscal instruments available to the state to promote alternative drives. The author shows that their complex impact has not been investigated to date with a focus on private users in Germany. He determines their preferences when buying a middle-class passenger car based on a conjoint analysis of 408 private customers. After market development and analysis of the funding instruments, a rapid market upturn in Germany seems impossible without state funding. The content of the research framework and vehicle technologies Cost analyses, eco-balance and customer-benefits of alternative drives Model development and evaluation The target groups Dozierende and Zentrum in the department of Vehicle Technology, especially in the fields of alternative drives, electric mobility and renewable power generation, politicians and decision makers with a focus on electric mobility The author of the vehicle and Krey Kreyenberg has been working with the project leader in the field of electric mobility and the field of research for the development of automotive technology.
content.title_en: Vehicle drives for electric mobility : Total Cost of Ownership, Energy Efficiency, CO2 Emissions and Customer Benefits

content.text: Electronic press and citizen journalism: rights and obligations of word media on the Internet. The numerous publication possibilities of the Internet make it possible for every Internet user to act casually and casually, but also regularly, as a citizen journalist.The work investigates the question of how this is to be legally classified. First, it is comprehensively examined to what extent the conventional term of the press and its historical development enable the electronic press to be included in the protection area of freedom of the press. Subsequently, a new term of the press is developed, which combines old and new criteria, in order to better meet the technical development.Finally, it is analysed in detail to what extent existing press rights and obligations of the printed press are transferable to the electronic press. Furthermore, the press law specificities of the electronic press are presented, which find no equivalent in the printed press, since they are purely Internet-specific
content.title_en: Electronic press and civil journalism : rights and obligations of word media on the Internet

content.text: Intellectual property related generic defence strategies in the European pharmaceutical market : implications of the EU Commission's sector inquiry from an IP, competition law and economic perspective. The book evaluates the investigation of the pharmaceutical sector of the European Commission. The focus of this study is on the practices of pharmaceutical companies to prevent or hinder competition from generics and the development of competing original drugs. Interdisciplinary work gives valuable information to decision-makers in the pharmaceutical industry on the impact of the investigation.
content.title_en: Intellectual property related generic defense strategies in the European pharmaceutical market : implications of the EU Commission's sector inquiry from an IP, competition law and economic perspective

content.text: The family business as a socialization context for business children. Simon Caspary examines how the socialization of descendants from business families is influenced by the existence of a family business. In order to answer the initial question, a pluralistic approach is chosen, which reflects the mechanisms and factors influencing the socialization and identity formation of the descendants.In addition to a determined overview of the relevant literature, the extensive theoretical examination contributes significantly to the advancement of knowledge for the socialization context of family business in scientific discourse.The content The family business: specificities, development levels, familiarity and enterprise, succession, socialization context FU Theory part: System theory, symbolic interactionism, role theory, excursion: bringing together the theories The family business from a system theoretical perspective: change of structural coupling, socialization of descendants from family businesses The target groups Dozierende and students of business economics with the focus on family business and SME management Family business, successors, mediators, consultants and executive employees in family business The author Dr. Simon Caspary completed his doctorate at Prof. Manfred Lueirische Institut für Wirtschaftsforschung und Wien Empirische Institut.
content.title_en: The family business as a socialisation context for business children

content.text: Science-based urban development: An investigation using the example of the city of Mainz. Against the background of the increasing importance of knowledge resources for sustainable urban development, Marie-Theres Moritz shows the effects of the title gain City of Science 2011 on the further development of the city of Science Mainz. The starting point of the evaluation are concepts of knowledge-based urban development as well as the call for tenders of the city of Science of the Stifterverband and the concept of the city of Mainz for further development as a city of Science. The author gives central recommendations for action, which may also serve as a direction for other cities of Science.The content Concepts of knowledge-based urban development Knowledge production and innovation processes in networks Evaluation of the overall project Mainz – City of Science 2011 Effects of title gain and action tasks for the further development of the city of Science Mainz The target groups lecturers and students of geography with a focus on regional and urban planning as well as urban marketing and sociology interested in human/social geography, urban geography, urban research, urban planning, city marketing The author Marie-Theres Moritz is Managing Director of the Gutenberg Lehrkolleg (GLK) of Johannes Gutenberg University Mainz (JGU). Their research focuses on science and urban development.
content.title_en: Science-based urban development: An investigation using the example of the city of Mainz

content.text: Data-based state monitoring in passenger vehicles with application on a three-way catalyst. Feature generation for dynamic operating states -- Two-Class Support Vector Machine based error detection -- One-Class Support Vector Machine based error detection -- Support Vector Machine based condition monitoring. Chris Louen develops data-based state monitoring for dynamic operating states for passenger vehicles that can be realized in today's control units. It is applied using the three-way catalyst removal after thrust operation and demonstrates the effectiveness of a simulation and real vehicle data. The presented condition monitoring is characterized by a low demand for training data and computing power in the control unit. The content feature generation for dynamic operating states Two-Class Support Vector Machine based error detection One-Class Support Vector Machine based error detection Support Vector Machine based condition monitoring The target groups Doziering and students of control technology and automotive technology Practitioner in the field of vehicle diagnostics and automation systems for the field of application diagnostics and diagnostics.
content.title_en: Data-based status monitoring in passenger cars with application on a three-way catalyst

content.text: When voters decide : processes of decision-making processes and the timing of the election decision. This volume deals with the measurement and theoretical interpretation of the timing of the election decision. For this purpose, a theory of the decision-making process is developed which produces a synthesis of previously disparate research results.Two results are to be highlighted: First, no significant increase in later election decisions can be demonstrated. Secondly, it can be shown that the timing of the election decision results from a complex interplay of electoral characteristics, characteristics of the decision-making situation and the information environment
content.title_en: When voters decide : processes of decision-making and the timing of the election decision

content.text: The Commission has also adopted a proposal for a Council Directive on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to the application of the laws of the Member States relating to the application of the laws of the Member States relating to the freedom to provide services to persons moving within the Community (Articles 3 and 4 of Directive 92/43/EEC) and the right to provide services to persons travelling within the Community (Articles 4 and 5 of Directive 92/43/EEC) and Article 5 of Directive 92/43/EEC (Articles 5 and 6 of Directive 92/43/EEC).
content.title_en: Cooperation in cross-border European long-distance rail transport: European antitrust law and application of competition law

content.text: The study concludes the gap between the research and the inter-professional comparisons and reconstructs interdisciplinary cooperation contexts, which are exemplarily for representatives of medicine, police and social work. The results of this study are presented in the form of theoretical and empirical textures of the suspect work The target groups of teachers and students of social work, sociology and social sciences The relationship work from the point of view of the profession sociology Child protection as a field of action and professional challenge The suspected work with police, doctors and social work The theoretical and empirical textures of the suspected work The target groups of teachers and students of social work, sociology and social sciences The relationship work from the point of view of the profession sociology Child protection as a field of action and professional challenge The suspected work with police, doctors and social work The research team of the university is theoretical and empirical textures of the suspected work The target groups of the faculty of the University of Kassel "Kunstährungswissenschaft" (German Research Group for the Protection of Children) "Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunstellen-Kunst.
content.title_en: Suspected work in child protection : A comparative study on the occupation

content.text: System justice and coherence: legislative unity and multiplicity through constitutional and Union law. Peter Dieterich examines and compares the constitutional postulate of "system justice" and the Union legal figure of "coherence". Overall, the work traces the charged debate about legislative rationality requirements to its legitimate normative core. -- The analysis of the justifications for a requirement of system-compliant normation (especially equality, rule of law, proportionality principle) proves that this remains only a very narrow scope of application: it is only evident that contradictory justifications for fundamental rights interferences are prevented. -- For the Union-law coherence principle, two functions can be identified in the justification of fundamental freedom interventions: as a justification it remains limited to a role as a qualified (preliminarily tax-legal) compensation argument, as a justification limit it constitutes a legitimate tightening of the suitability examination, which largely corresponds to the constitutional system.
content.title_en: System justice and coherence : legislative unity and diversity through constitutional and Union law

content.text: The National State Formation, War and Consolidation of Democracy: Croatia, Serbia and Montenegro. Similar initial constellations -- Actors' theories -- The type of institutionalization -- The influence of external factors -- The emergence of the Competitive-authoritarianism regime -- The phase of consolidation of democracy Filip Milacic develops mechanisms that reconstruct a causal influence of war on the consolidation of democracy and shows how national state formation and war have influenced the process of democratisation in the states of Montenegro, Serbia and Croatia. An investigation of the transformation processes and the hybrid regimes that arise there, which sees the causes of success and failure in a particular mix of the three factors, is not yet available. Thus, the book contributes to the the theorization of the connection between national state formation, war and democracy. The content • Similar output constellations • Actors' theories • The type of institutionalization • The influence of external factors • The emergence of the Competitive-authoritarianism regime • The phase of consolidation of democracy The target groups • Dozende und Studieren der Politikwissenschaft, und Soziologie • Praktikerrei der Hirstreichen der Universität (Studien)
content.title_en: National State Formation, War and Consolidation of Democracy : Croatia, Serbia and Montenegro

content.text: The project manager has been involved in the transport planning of the German economy since the year 2009: A cross-local analysis based on the input-output-account. Spatial planning and transport planning -- freight flows of the German economy -- Transport flows of the German transport statistics -- Linking the freight flows with the transport flows -- Transport flow-visualisation model – TraViMo 2.0. The author provides a contribution to the improvement of the Federal transport infrastructure planning in particular under spatial-folding aspects. As a result, the project is gradually presenting how to carry out regional data mining with traffic statistics using the Business Intelligence Software Tableau. By combining input-output-referencing and traffic-interconnection forecast, new scientific findings are gained and made user-friendly for the practice. With the development of the transport flow-visualisation model (TraViMo), the author succeeds in developing a tool in the era of big data that makes large data available to the general public. The content • Spatial planning and transport planning • Freight flows of the German transport statistics • Connection of the transport flows and traffic flows.
content.title_en: Integration of spatially-folding concerns into traffic planning : A super-local analysis based on input-output calculation

content.text: Criminology in Civil Society : Science Discourses and the British Public, 1830-1945. Why do people become criminal? What causes can be found for delinquent behavior? Experts and the wider public are concerned with such questions - and both are in greater exchange of ideas than one might think. Sabine Freitag approaches places of knowledge production about the causes of crime as well as civil society spaces in which the theses of the experts were discussed.
content.title_en: Criminology in Civil Society : Science Discourses and the British Public, 1830-1945

content.title_en: Process management in indirect areas : Empirical investigation and recommendations for action

content.text: The study raises the question of the extent to which a pedagogical approach beyond the solidification in systemic structures can be flexibly and systematically thought. This paradoxical initial constellation can be met with the late system theory of Luhmann, which attempts to advance a differentialist shift beyond the classical concept of difference. The hitherto open ends of this project are further developed with Deleuze. In a topological reading - especially from the perspective of a topology of difference - pedagogy can thus be refigured as an expression system.
content.title_en: Passages of Pedagogy : to the version of the pedagogical moment following Niklas Luhmann and Gilles Deleuze

content.text: Digital transformation of business models in the medium-sized enterprise: theory, empiria and recommendations for action. This book includes both a theoretical and an empirical study of the digital transformation of business models in medium-sized enterprises. Tim Botzkowski deals in particular with the original decision to digitise and formulate specific recommendations for action in corporate practice. In addition, the development of a digital governance concept and a structured transformation roadmap is carried out. The content Digital Governance Roadmap of the Digital Transformation Recommendations for action in the medium-sized enterprise The target groups Lecturers and students of business administration with the focus on corporate management, strategic management, business information technology and computer science Specialists and managers in medium-sized enterprises in the areas of corporate management, corporate strategy, business information technology and computer science The author Tim Botzkowski is a research assistant and doctoral student at the Chair of Corporate Management and Controlling, employee at the European Competence Center for Applied Medium-sized Business Studies (EKAM) at the University of Bamberg and at the Competence Center for Business Models in the digital world.
content.title_en: Digital transformation of business models in the middle class : theory, empiria and recommendations for action

content.text: School autonomy as an element of new control: re-contextualisation between pedagogical and structural perspectives. Nicole Miceli describes the individual re-contextualisation processes of school actors and shows the contrasts in the way they deal with the reform conditions of the "Self-employed school". She contributes to the complex processes of the implementation of educational policy reforms within individual schools. The participants' struggles in adapting non-technical concepts – such as project management – to school structures, the acquisition of new competences and the establishment of professional approaches can also be derived from the findings for school development research and for professionalization theories.The content of the control as an element of school development School as an organisation School development and innovation research Comparative comparison of the handling with the stress areas of re-contextualization profiles The target groups Dozierende and students of school education education, education sciences and education research School leaders, teachers and actors of educational administration The author Dr. Nicole Miceli is an educational scientist and has a PhD in the field of continuing education and further education in the fields of teacher research.
content.title_en: School autonomy as an element of new governance : recontextualisations between pedagogical and structural perspectives

content.text: The Drpetitor Relationship Management: Description, explanation and design of relationships between competitors. Theoretical analysis of competition and competitor relations -- Spectrum of competitive organisational forms -- Performance measurement in competitor relations -- Competition costs and competitive benefits -- Instruments of shaping the relationship between competitors -- Design of coupling competitive and non-competitive relationships. . Oliver Neumann develops an innovative and holistic approach to cost- and use-oriented management of relationships between competitors. The author derives an innovative coordination model for competitors' relationships based on existing governance and theory models, modeling for the first time types, structures and processes of competition costs and competitive benefits. The design approach presented in the work includes both the perspective of a competitor and the perspective of organisers of competitions. It is shown how the intensity of relationships between competitors can be influenced by a configuration, interaction and infrastructure management of the relationships.
content.title_en: Competitor Relationship Management : Description, explanation and design of relationships between competitors

content.text: Process evaluation in logistics : Key figures-based analysis methodology to increase logistics competence. Knowledge of the weaknesses in company's logistics is the first step in unlocking new performance potential. However, in order to be able to use specific logistics knowledge to initiate process improvements in a targeted manner, structured analyses are needed that allow a detailed evaluation of the own logistics processes in the performance dimensions of time, quality and costs at different process levels. Christian Büssow develops a multi-stage analysis methodology for the continuous evaluation of company's own logistics systems based on performance indicators. It is comprehensively supported by partial results and individual instruments such as a logistical reference model with an extensive catalogue of approx. 350 key figures and allows adaptation to its own framework conditions and objectives. The author presents the prototype of an internet-based application that captures key figures, analyses logistics processes and assigns specific contents of a knowledge platform for a targeted process improvement to the identified weaknesses.
content.title_en: Process evaluation in logistics : Key Figures-based analysis methodology to increase logistics competence

content.text: The purpose of the book is to examine whether Article 8 ECHR can effectively protect individuals' rights against government interference on the Internet. It is to be noted that Article 8 ECHR does not contain any explicit reference to data protection, other than Article 8 ECHR. The paper shows that Article 8 ECHR nevertheless guarantees an independent right to informational self-determination and that personal data is also covered by the scope of this guarantee. It details the intervention in the right to respect for private and family life under Article 8 ECHR. In particular, it distinguishes between the protection of individuals on the Internet. Finally, the justifications set out in Article 8 ECHR - Part Two - The justification of the interference in the internet - The four rights of persons in the internet - The protection of persons in the internet - The protection of persons in the internet - Part Two - The protection of persons in the internet - The protection of persons in the internet - Part Two - The protection of persons in the internet - The protection of persons in the internet - The protection of persons in the internet - The protection of persons in the internet - The protection of persons in the internet - The protection of the privacy in the internet
content.title_en: The protection provided by Article 8 ECHR against state interference in the personal rights of the Internet

content.text: Reintegration difficulties of expatriates: investigation of the return shock after international personnel deployment. Basics of reintegration after international personnel deployment -- reintegration as a re-adjustment process in research literature -- factors affecting reintegration difficulties and return shock -- requirements for personnel management to ensure successful reintegration measures -- Empirical investigation of the reintegration difficulties and return shock of German foreign returnees. Kristina Mnich conducts a comprehensive literature research on reintegration difficulties of expatriates and the existence of return shock. In an empirical study on German foreign returnees, the author emphatically shows the relevance and relevance of the reintegration problem and illustrates the consequences of the return shock. The content • Basics of reintegration after international staff deployment • Reintegration as a re-adjustment process in research literature • Factors of influence on reintegration difficulties and return shock • Requirements on personnel management to ensure successful reintegration measures • Empirical investigation on reintegration difficulties and return shock of German international staff deployment The target groups • Dozierde and students of the economic sciences with the focus on staff management and personnel management The humanities of the university The humanities of the humanities of the humanities and humanities The humanities of the humanities
content.title_en: Reintegration difficulties of expatriates : Investigation of the return shock after international personnel deployment

content.text: - The automated modelling of forest landscapes for virtual worlds and mobile robots. Remote sensing data such as aerial images, terrain and surface models are now available globally and have found their place in our everyday lives. On the other hand, landscape models for simulations and representations in virtual reality are in many cases still elaborately generated by hand. Arnold Bücken shows a way of how forest landscapes can be derived from remote sensing data in an automated process on a large scale. The result are detailed forest models with geographically located, attached individual trees, which are suitable for a variety of simulation tasks and at the same time offer a highly detailed cartographic image of the forest, for example for localization tasks of robotic systems. The content Efficient and realistic segmentation of individual trees from remote sensing data Attribution of trees with visualisation-relevant parameters Application of forest models in simulation and for localization in closed inventory The target groups of the individual applications of the robotics department Virtual reality, mobile robotics, geodata processing and remote sensing Practitioners content.text: The principle of company continuity in insolvency. Insolvency and continuation -- Insolvency law and insolvency accounting -- The continuation premise in insolvency accounting -- A heuristic solution to the time problem -- The summary of the results. The assessment of the principle of corporate continuity is therefore considered one of the most difficult problems in accounting. As a fundamental principle, it has direct consequences for the accounting system according to the reason, the amount and the identification. Precisely the determination of the time from which the continuation principle can no longer be assumed from the balance sheet is therefore crucial. In addition, it is necessary to consider when a resurgence of the continuation principle is necessary. Using a normative research approach Stefan Eickes penetrates this problem position in the case of the company in insolvency and shows which problems in timing determination in particular have to be considered. The content The design of the commercial insolvency accounting system The distinction between continuation forecast and continuation premise The consideration of the moment of departure of the continuity of the company's presiding on the resurgence of the company's executives and the administration of the university's executive administration has been the focus of the business administration.
content.title_en: The principle of company continuity in insolvency

content.text: Mentoring during the transition from study to the profession: An empirical study on success factors and perceived benefits. Stephan Pflaum systematically examines the benefits of mentoring during the transition from study to the profession in a three-year panel study. The author presents framework conditions for good mentoring and successful mentoring programs based on quantitative and qualitative data. The subject of research is the largest, faculty and cross-sector mentoring program of the Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München in this form nationwide. From the results of the study, recommendations for the optimal design of mentoring programs at universities are derived. The content Mentoring in the context of other forms of counselling and support Mentoring from the perspective of social sciences and education Empirical findings on the benefit and framework conditions of successful mentoring Determination factors successful mentoring during the transition from study to the profession The target groups Dozierende und Studieren der Pädagogik und Soziologie Organiseren Universitärer Mentoringprogramm as well as its participants The author Stephan Pflaum is also a teacher and sociologist. He directs the faculty and cross-sector mentoring program Mentoring in the field of the profession.
content.title_en: Mentoring in the transition from study to work : An empirical study on success factors and perceived benefit

content.text: Customer service through user information : Technical documentation as a secondary service in marketing. The service policy of the providers of investment and consumer goods requiring explanation includes the product-accompanying secondary service of user information, i.e. the task of providing customers or users with all the information necessary for full product use. Although the user information - also called technical documentation - is a mandatory customer service with considerable sales policy opportunities, this instrument is often considered in practice and science as "stepchild" of marketing. Tobbias Schlömer analyses the position and tasks of the technical documentation in the sales policy bundle and in the service policy of the provider. Taking special account of complex investment goods (especially in plant marketing) the use and impact of the technical documentation to support customer acquisition and customer loyalty as well as to achieve competitive advantages are shown. In addition, sales policy decisions about offer, instruments and organization of a professional customer service through user information (documentation service policy) are elaborated
content.title_en: Customer service through user information : Technical documentation as a secondary service in marketing

content.text: The subordinated position of shareholder loans in insolvency in consortium financing and the majority of creditors. In the case of financing by several borrowers, numerous problems arise in connection with the law of shareholder loans, in particular § 39 para. 1 no. 5 InsO. In order to be able to assess a subordinated and countervailable risk in the insolvency of the loan-taking company as well as possible, clear parameters are required. The author analyses the vulnerability of credit consortia and creditor pluralities at the actual, culpable and collateral-law level. This is done on the one hand by a scientific examination, especially with § 39 and § 135 InsO, around the right of shareholder loans in financing by several. On the other hand, the findings and solutions are also projected on practical scenarios and evaluated legally.
content.title_en: The subordinated share of loans in insolvency in the form of syndicated financing and the majority of creditors

content.text: Port cities in the eastern Mediterranean from Hellenism to the Roman Empire: urban development, function and perception. Due to their location, ancient port cities were important nodes within the Mediterranean-wide communication and thus represented the crucial interfaces between the habitats of land and water. The study deals with the urban development of selected Mediterranean port locations. The focus is on the question of how strongly the location of coast and sea influenced the physiognomy and functional structure of a city. The focus is on the eastern Mediterranean from early Hellenistic times to the late Roman imperial period.
content.title_en: Port cities in the eastern Mediterranean from Hellenism to the Roman Empire: urban planning, function and perception

content.text: The reduction of land use by the construction planning law: legal validity and implementation in the social system. Land use is an old-known problem in Germany. The policy is aware of the effects at the latest since the 1970s. Political objectives, for example in the sustainability strategy of the Federal Government, are repeatedly presented. The construction planning law plays a decisive role in this. The work illustrates for the first time comprehensively and in detail that the building planning law holds a large number of options for a reduction of the area use available and at the same time examines whether it is sufficiently equipped to push forward an extensive area use. The numerous measures for a reduction of the area use are highlighted by examples and precise definitions and placed in a ranking order. In each measure the relevant standards are presented and weighted. The work covers both the presentation and fixing possibilities in the building guidance plans, the planning objectives and planning guidelines of the consideration, the planning replacement regulations as well as the measures of the special town building law. In addition, the work on the effects of the relevant standards are analysed under the management of the management of the land.
content.title_en: The reduction of land use by the building planning law : legal validity and implementation in the social system

content.text: Abstract period spaces, projectors and traces of hedge operators. The dissertation is concerned with the purely algebraic construction of a projector on abstract period spaces. The abstract period spaces can be understood as generalization of the period spaces from the context of the classical elliptical module forms (manine relations). The projector then derives an abstract trace formula of hedge operators and reconstructs the trace formula of Zagier to stage 1 (1990) as an application of this.
content.title_en: Abstract Period Spaces, Projectors and Traces of Hedge Operators

content.text: Lobbyism and Transparency: a comparative study of a complex relationship. Determinants of lobbyist transparency -- Motives of transparency creation -- Levels of transparency creation -- Governance of transparency creation -- New perspectives for lobbyism and transparency research Although the number of publications on lobbyism and transparency has increased significantly, little is known about the relationship between the two phenomena.The motives of transparency creation or transparency obstruction by lobbyists have remained unexplained in the scientific debate until now, as blurred or contradictory concepts of concepts made it difficult to compare and connect the research results.After an intensive examination of the definitary foundations, findings derived from theory and practice as well as data from a quantitative survey with qualitative follow-up research show that the connection between lobbyism and transparency is much more complex than widely assumed.The content of determinants of lobbyist transparency Motives of transparency creation of transparency levels of transparency creation of transparency control of lobbyism and transparency research The target groups of political science, economics, law, lobbyists and political representatives in the field of journalism and female journalists' activities in the field of politics and female journalists' activities.
content.title_en: Lobbyism and transparency: a comparative study of a complex relationship

content.text: Investigation of combustion methods for natural gas and biomethane using the example of industrial engines for agricultural use. The work deals with a systematic study and evaluation of various ottomotor combustion methods with regard to the lowest pollutant emissions and the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions based on a converted diesel engine for agricultural use. Based on the stoichiometric energy conversion, the influence of a charge dilution by additional combustion air and exhaust gas recirculation is analysed in detail. An engine concept, which has significant advantages over the conventional diesel engine, is derived from the partial results.
content.title_en: Investigation of combustion methods for natural gas and biomethane using the example of industrial engines for agricultural use

content.text: The following results confirmed that it was possible to convert moor biomass into carbon-containing products with sufficient efficiency for ammonia removal into aqueous solution in order to potentially use it as a filter material.
content.title_en: Investigation of the applicability of wetland biomass for producing hydrochar by hydrothermal carbonization and its effectiveness for the adsorption of ammonia

content.text: "Whoever preserves forty hadithe in my community...": Creation and development of a collection type. "The forty hadithe is of great importance to the religious and life practice of Muslims from the 9th century until today, but has not been scientifically considered. For a manageable collection of selected prophetly traditions, the content of the forty hadithe is extremely diverse and ranges from child education and religious-spractical aspects to jihad. In Part 1 this topic area is completely reopened on the basis of the collection of over nine hundred collections. In Part 2, the elaboration of thought and ideology of jihad is based on prophetic traditions from the time of the crusades to the present. A translation of the original texts makes the relevant hadithe material also usable for interested parties outside the Islamic sciences." (Verlagsinformation)
content.title_en: "Who keeps forty hadiths of my congregation..." : Origin and development of a collection type

content.text: For the development of the bonding element for the construction of wood. The focus of the present work is the constructive development and the scientific investigation of the load-bearing element for the construction of wood. The newly developed connections consist preferably of steel parts with threaded connection and are anchored with a polymer casting in the wood. The coupling element allows the simple assembly-compliant connection of wood components to each other or to other constructions. They take the tensile or pressure load axially and ensure a powerful and slip-free connection to the wood. For the casting a minerally filled epoxy resin with very good adhesive properties against wood and most usual building materials is used. In the wood, the expansion of the joints between the coupling element and the wood walling from 7 mm to 17 mm is beneficial both for technological reasons as well as for a uniform stress distribution. The diameter of the bore is significantly greater compared to the connection element, thus increasing the connection area to the wood at constant length.
content.title_en: For the development of polymer-casting coupling elements for timber construction

Copper prefers to release electrons to the oxide layer, which results in a reduction of the ceions from a Ce^4+ to a Ce^3+ charge state. A clear indication of this can be found by means of XPS. The influence is strong enough to drive the highest reduction of the films from 17% to over 50%. content.text: The author deals with the question of whether and how international barriers already limit the power of states on the Internet and what these could look like in the future. In particular, he addresses a human right to access the Internet. A focus is on freedom of expression and information at the level of the United Nations and the Council of Europe, which are examined from the perspective of various intervention dimensions. To this end, a detailed analysis of the existing documents and the case law is carried out. Subsequently, the author provides a proposal for a specific formulation for a human right to access the Internet de lege ferenda. Due to the qualification of the Internet as an international (over)space, further international barriers, which arise in particular from the field of environmental international law, the rules of international relations and international humanitarian law, are examined for their transferability.
content.title_en: Free space or domain : Human right to access and international law principles as barriers to state action on the Internet

content.text: The following dissertation describes a method that can be used to evaluate and optimize chassis concepts in terms of their assembly capability from the early development phase. The method is based on a detailed analysis of the development process in the automotive industry. It shows which roles are responsible for the development of an axle concept, which can be produced in the context of industrial series production. The developed method supports these development activities specifically and thus enables an increase in efficiency. The content of basics.- state of the art.- Requirements management for early phases of product development.- Generic solution approach and methodology.- Exemplary implementation using the example of aggregate installation. The target groups of vehicle and engine engineers Professors, lecturers and students at universities and universities The author Bastian Leistner worked between 2016 and 2019 with the Technical University of Chemnitz and in cooperation with the West Saxon University of Applied Sciences Zwickau and the BMW Group Munich to develop the contents of this book. He has been a successful doctoral student at the BMW Group as an engineering specialist in the field of driving dynamics - Application of the basics of the basics of the technology-methodology-Integration of the advanced-Integration of the advanced-Integration of the advanced-Integration of the advanced-Integration
content.title_en: Chassis development and production engineering integration from the early product development phase

content.text: C-Arylglycosides and Chalkone: new ways to treat heterocyclic agents by ru- and pd-catalysed reactions. In the present age of scientific medicine, a wide range of active substances have been combined to treat various diseases. Nevertheless, organic synthesis chemistry has made it its task to expand this spectrum on new or known ways and for various reasons. On the one hand, the presence of certain compounds in nature is often limited, so that synthetic methods increasingly replace a less sustainable degradation. On the other hand, the physiological effect or bioavailability of an active substance can be increased by derivatization and drug adaptation. In this work, some representatives of the known active substances C-Arylglycosides and Chalkone were first synthesized by the key step of the palladium-catalysed MATSUDA-HECK reaction. On the other hand, in the case of C-Arylglycosides, unsaturated carbohydrates (glycalides) were first described above via a ruthenium-catalysed cyclolysis reaction. These reactions were then brought to the reaction of the hypo-sal reaction of the hypothium.
content.title_en: C-Arylglycosides and Chalkone : new ways to heterocyclic agents through ru- and pd-catalysed reactions

content.text: Sect images in experience reports : Hybridities between literature and religion. Klappentext: Literature on cults-exhibitors is a multitude. But what significance do these autobiographical experiences really have? Can they be scientifically assessed? Using the example of Scientology, Jehovah's Witnesses and Satanism, the author shows exemplary how a religion-scientific and source-critical approach to the works can look. The individual experiences described here are taken into account as well as collective sect images and discourses that form the narrative framework.
content.title_en: Cult images in reports of experience : Hybridities between literature and religion

content.text: The study focuses on the palladium catalysed and the acid-mediated cycloisomerization of quinoline derivatives. The indolochinoline was synthesized by a palladium catalysed suzuki-miyaura reaction followed by a Buchwald-Hartwig-mediated cycloisomerization. The optical properties were investigated by absorption and emission spectroscopy. <ger> The thesis deals with palladium catalysed as well as Brønsted acid mediated cycloisomerization of quinoline.
content.title_en: Palladium catalyzed functionalization and cyclolysis as well as acid-mediated cycloisomerization of quinoline derivatives

content.text: The best of two divergent working environments: An analysis of individual career patterns and concepts of persons in a double job, including self-determining theory. An indication of the change in individual careers is the increasing number of persons who pursue more than just a career. This phenomenon addresses the present work by examining narrative interviews of double-employed people. The focus is on the analysis of the research questions why individuals voluntarily pursue two jobs simultaneously and how they design their careers. The results show that the career concept of self-determined double-employment can be linked to the satisfaction of work-related needs and enable optimisation of these needs. These findings partly underpin the concepts of the new career idea and reflect the three psychological basic needs of autonomous, relatedness and competence of self-determination theory (SDT). The integration of this motivation theory into the present analysis also confirms a fruitful and comprehensive interdisciplinary connection between SDT and career research. Moreover, the extensive understanding of career as a resultantly critical and thus discusses the significance of the experience of the two different occupational environments.
content.title_en: The best of two divergent working environments: an analysis of individual career patterns and concepts of people in a double job, including self-determining theory

content.text: Estimation of forest structure parameters in Mexico by integration of remote sensing and forest inventory data. This work provides insights into the current possibilities and limitations of the use of remote sensing data for mapping forest structures at local, regional and national level in Mexico. In particular, the impact of multisensory and multitemporal remote sensing data on the mapping accuracy of forest structure parameters (i.e., surface biomass (GTC) and vegetation height) was investigated. Furthermore, the influence of quality, number and spatial distribution of reference data on modelling accuracy was investigated. To answer these questions, optical and L-band Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) remote sensing data were integrated with national forest inventory data as well as aircraft-based light detection and shunting (LiDAR) data using different modelling scenarios.
content.title_en: Estimation of forest structure parameters in Mexico by integration of remote sensing and forest inventory data

content.text: The Materia prima as a physical principle of being -- Materia prima as a praephysical principle of being -- Mataria prima as a metaphysical principle of being Katharina Dück is dedicated in this book to the extensive doctrines of the term "Materia prima" in the field of tension between theory and repeatable practice in German-speaking alchemic-naturistic material writings of the 16th century. It thus contributes new aspects to the debate of materialism in the early modern era. Texts of so-called master thinkers are examined as well as testimonies of those who have so far been neglected. The corpus Paracelsicum and the current of paracelsism are given special attention. Three raster-like outline basic patterns, to which the "Materia prima , prepositions are assigned, are extensively presented and thereby continuities as well as transformations of existing material concepts are determined. The content of Materia prima as a physical principle of being a praephysical principle of being primaphys and anatology as well as a topic of research in the history of chemistry and chemism The topic of scientific research is the language
content.title_en: Materia prima : On the semantics of the term in 16th century natural writings
