content.text: Communication on Facebook, Twitter & YouTube: Constitutional protection of information intermediaries and their users by means of media freedoms. The information intermediaries are neither classic content providers nor purely technical intermediaries. They design the technical platforms and create communication spaces. The work examines to what extent the information intermediaries and active users are protected by media freedoms. A communication of the active user within a non-public group can be a form of mass communication if the potential addressee is any public, because the friends are selected without regard to the specific person. For the investigated information intermediaries as US legal persons there is a lack of fundamental rights protection. The information intermediaries can also be protected by media freedoms in the isolated distribution of foreign content if the distribution is either based on a separate opinion or if the press-grosso case law is applied accordingly. / »Communication with Facebook, Twitter & YouTube. Constitutional Protection of Social Media and its Users by Freedom of Media.« - Social media are neither content marketing and everyday media.
content.title_en: Communication on Facebook, Twitter & YouTube: Constitutional protection of information intermediaries and their users by media freedoms

content.text: Transnational legal production: elements of a normative theory of Lex Financiaria. Markets for financial derivatives traded over the counter (OTC) have a significant negative impact by increasing food prices, by influencing the fiscal situation of states and by building systemic risks. The democratization of these markets is therefore one of the most important tasks of global law. The International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA) as a private institution shapes the legal infrastructure of these markets. Johan Horst examines the legal practice of ISDA and shows that the ISDA regime has developed its own forms of legislative activity, law enforcement and adjudication. Due to the massive impact of the ISDA's activities, a normative re-binding by establishing transnational responsibility obligations that can be dogmatically anchored in the horizontal impact of human rights, third-party prohibitions of transnational contract networks and a decentralized politicization of transnational law is required.
content.title_en: Transnational legal production : elements of a normative theory of Lex Financiaria

content.text: In the field of teaching in the field of economics, the Department of Economics and Economics, Dr. Stephan Kondi, is working on the development of the emotional experience of learners during a series of self-regulated learning sequences using tablet PCs during the course of the teaching process and on the effects of this on the professional performance of learners. To this end, the study presents the basic mechanisms of action of emotional, motivational and cognitive factors in the learning process and examines the findings of computer-supported teaching and learning. Subsequently, the study presents key results of a field study conducted at the Business School in Baden-Württemberg.The study concludes with a series of practical implications in relation to the learning-enhancing embedding of computer technologies in teaching practice.The content of emotions and knowledge acquisition in computer-based teaching Research on ICT-based teaching environments Implications for teaching practice The target groups of lecturers and students in business and education sciences with the emphasis on business education, business didactics, teaching research, empirical education research and educational psychology Practices of the University of Technology and Business School.
content.title_en: Emotional experience and knowledge acquisition in computer-aided business education

content.text: The influence of welding parameters and polarity modulations on the material transition as well as on and off-burning behaviour of alloy elements during sub-powder welding. The subject of the investigations are caverning processes and material transfer during sub-powder welding, with special consideration of the in- and off-burning of alloy elements and iron companions. The influence of welding parameter variations, especially the effect by shifting the time share of the alternating current half-waves, was investigated. The investigations were carried out on solid and fill wires with different alloy concepts. The transferability of the findings on UP multi-wire welding was illustrated by accompanying chemical studies.
content.title_en: Influence of welding parameters and polarity modulations on the material transition as well as on and off-burning behaviour of alloy elements during sub-powder welding

content.title_en: EPR spectroscopic examination of the solvatization of amphiphilic substances in the aqueous medium

content.text: Work on the field of sound at ADHD : pedagogical and psychodynamic aspects of affect regulation. Begga Hölz-Lindau demonstrates that the haptic approach of the work on the field developed by Heinz Deuser enables affect regulation in children with ADHD symptoms to be achieved. It thus demonstrates the positive benefits of this treatment approach for the patients. Interdisciplinary, Hölz-Lindau describes the development of the method of working on the field of sound and shows the effectiveness in children with ADHD based on her clinical study. It represents the significant improvements in affect regulation in terms of its pedagogical and psychotherapeutic relevance and works out didactic mediation pathways as well as first concrete application possibilities in practice.
content.title_en: Work on the sound field at ADHD : pedagogical and psychodynamic aspects of affect regulation

content.text: Mathematical approaches to solving one-off tasks: an investigation taking into account different teaching methods and the performance of children. Mathematics didactics currently largely consensus on the development of a small one-off approach which corresponds to the contemporary understanding of teaching and learning in mathematics teaching: an understanding-based development that provides for the development of previously known one-off approaches based on insight into operational relationships. However, the effectiveness of this understanding-based development has so far only been analysed in isolated national and international studies. In this volume, an empirical study is presented which examines and examines various mathematical approaches of children in the tasks of small one-off in the third year of school, whether and to what extent different teaching approaches in the development affect the strategy use of children. In this context, the analysis of the strategy use takes into account an additional possible influence factor, the individual performance of a child.
content.title_en: Mathematical approaches to solving one-off tasks: an examination taking into account different teaching methods and the performance of children

content.text: The noise in the hospital-op : Performance increase and error avoidance through optimized acoustics. Optimal room acoustic conditions and noise reduction measures provide the basis for concentrated work and promote error prevention. For the operating physician, communication deficits and distraction can be concrete consequences of a defective acoustics. Philipp Knöfler illustrates with measurements in the ear canal of the operating doctor that the recommended noise maximum level at the operating table is significantly exceeded. For the examined operating room possibilities of level reduction have been developed, which can also be transferred to other operating rooms. However, in order to ensure an acoustic minimum standard in the realization of operating rooms, simple manageable guidelines must be implemented in the planning process. The planning task "noise reduction OP" should urgently find its way into practice, so that the working conditions for the staff are improved and an adequate environment is created for the patient. The content of treatment errors through poor acoustics Field study on the topic of noise reduction in the operating room after-shaft times and sound pressure level in the operating room-op.
content.title_en: Noise in hospital surgery : Performance enhancement and error prevention through optimized acoustics

content.text: Visualizations of the political: homophobia and queer protest culture in Poland from 1980. Homophobober hate in Poland is propagated by posters, pictograms, graffiti and other types of images of nationalist, radical right and Catholic fundamentalist movements. Through the Internet and street protests, these homophobic images are spread in digital and urban space. Thus, they have fundamental influence on Poland's visual culture. Julia Austermann researches these Polish text and image convolutes before and after 1989, which provide information about homophobia and its visualization and fight against them. The focus is on the analysis of the production of these images, their handling and the associated emotionalization techniques.
content.title_en: Visualizations of the Political : Homophobia and queer protest culture in Poland from 1980

content.text: Consideration of statistical surface parameters in the numerical simulation of hydrodynamic radial bearings in the miscrylation range. The subject of the present scientific work was the investigation whether a description of the pressure components in the miscrylation range of a hydrodynamic radial sliding bearing is possible by the consideration of experimentally determined statistical surface parameters. Furthermore, it was examined which surface-like parameters are suitable for the surface definition in the simulation. Based on the model approach of the load distribution in the area of the miscrylation two separate models for the respective pressure components were created.
content.title_en: Consideration of statistical surface parameters in numerical simulation of hydrodynamic radial gliding bearings in the miscrylation range

content.text: The problem of knowledge in asylum law: between material deficits in control and Europeanisation. In the asylum decision, the legal user is confronted with the task of identifying social and political circumstances abroad. These are questions that cannot be answered by merely interpreting legal texts, but rather require the generation and processing of factual knowledge. Due to the material management concept of German administrative law, this constitutes a (knowledge) problem for German asylum law dogmatics. The presentation of the shortcomings of the dogmatism brought about, with particular regard to the Europeanization of migration law, are also the subject of this book, as is the proposal for a redesign for a partial solution to the asylum law knowledge problem.
content.title_en: The knowledge problem in asylum law: between material governance deficits and Europeanisation

content.title_en: From protease to peptide synthase: the influence of the oxyanion hole on reverse proteolysis, using the example of trypsin

content.text: The effects of digitalisation on teaching and learning processes: didactic changes in the example of the FernUniversität in Hagen. Christina Gloerfeld investigates changes in the complex processes of teaching and learning in the higher education sector. Using an developed analytical framework model, the author identifies concrete effects and shows that not only do teaching and learning activities shift into the digital space, but also doactical shifts in teaching and learning processes towards cybernetic approaches. In doing so, she identifies four developmental trends – delimitation, standardisation, professionalization and politicization. However, a transformation of teaching and learning processes from a didactic perspective was not (yet) demonstrated.The content of digitalisation in higher education Teaching and learning processes and their presentation in didactic models Analytical framework model Changes in teaching and learning processes at the FernUniversität in Hagen Developmental tendencies and theses on the impact of digitalization The target groups of teaching and teaching science, media education, empirical education research and learning psychology are research leaders and teaching leaders.
content.title_en: Impact of digitalization on teaching and learning processes : didactical changes using the example of FernUniversität in Hagen

content.text: Immunoelectron microscopic studies of lung development with epithelial and mesenchymal markers in embryonic domestic chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus) were investigated in the study of structural and functional aspects of the embryonic development of the gas exchange tissue of the bird's lung (on the example of domestic chicken). The structural changes and development processes taking place were investigated by means of light microscopy on semithin sections, transmission electron microscopy on ultrathin sections and scanning electron microscopy. The functional connections were presented in the transmission electron microscope using immunogold technology with the markers Anti-E-Cadherin, Anti-SOX2, Anti-alpha-smooth muscle actin and Anti-Laminin.
content.title_en: Immunoelectron microscopic studies of lung development with epithelial and mesenchymal markers in embryonic domestic chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus)

content.text: The two chemical compounds were able to optimize the particle size and width of the size distribution of the composite NP. Carboxy groups on the particle surface could be covalently coupled with antibodies to obtain coloured conjugates. The conjugates showed lower detection limits than corresponding reference particles in the Lateral Flow Immunoassay. Moreover, the derivatives could be directly controlled with active PS-NP-based fluorinated NHS-free. In this case N,N-Nich-disuccimidylcarbonate was shown to be effective reagent.
content.title_en: Functional nanoparticles based on cellulose

content.text: The dissolution and withdrawal of individual shareholders in law firms: a corporate and professional inquiry. The dissolution of a public limited company and the departure of individual shareholders cause considerable complications in practice. Not least because lawyers' professional practice companies are characterized by a special, personal service provision and thus also a special asset structure. The author systematizes and analyses the corporate and professional problems, from the dissolution of the company and the voluntary or forced retirement of individual shareholders, through severance agreements and competition restrictions to the legal position of shareholders without capital share. De lege ferenda are also integrated into the investigation and analyzed the upcoming reform of the law on the legal status of private companies and the law on the modernisation of private company law. Finally, the author outlines complementary draft laws to promote the coherent amendment of both matters.
content.title_en: Dissolution and withdrawal of individual partners in law firms : a company and professional investigation

content.text: In between: a phenomenological approach to school space research. The study asks about the school space experiences of primary school students. With the phenomenological understanding of space and architecture, a focus is placed on the process that must be determined between the world of things and the world of people. In order to open up to the pathic dimension, the exploratory method of narrative school tours was used in addition to the participating experience. In the mobile videographed visits, the response between students and school space is of importance, which is approached in the course of the co-experience on language and movements.
content.title_en: In between: a phenomenological access to school space research

content.text: Analysis of genotypic differences in biochemical and physiological adjustments to N-deficiency and drought stress in potatoes (Solanum tuberosum L.) with consideration of yield components. The aim of this work was to assess phenotyping of potato varieties under N-deficiency and dry stress at morphological, physiological and biochemical levels. In a vessel test, 17 European potato varieties were tested in two N-stages and two irrigation strategies in a rain-out-shelter two years. This work was carried out at comprehensive phenotyping of potato cultivars in response to N-deficiency and driving stress in the brain.
content.title_en: Analysis of genotypic differences in biochemical and physiological adjustments to N-deficiency and drought stress in potatoes (Solanum tuberosum L.) with consideration of yield components

content.text: Computer assisted development and optimization of a variable dietintric barrier discharge. In this work, the Venturi DBD concept is extensively investigated and an adapted process control process is developed. Venturi DBD is a system around a dielectrically disabled discharge for the generation of various compositions of reactive oxygen and nitrogen species. The processes that are primarily relevant for species composition are identified and the overall concept including process control is implemented in a functional pattern. Main areas of application for concept and functional patterns are research and development in plasma medicine and decontamination. <ger> In this thesis, the Venturi-DBD concept is significantly characteristic and approach process control strategy is developed. The Venturi-DBD is an intermediate pressure driver discharging system for the generation of different reactive oxygen and nitrate components. The chemical process determines and affects the intensity of the specified process.
content.title_en: Computer assisted development and optimization of a variable dieelectric barrier discharge

content.text: The presence and prevention of pathogenic clostridia in fermentation substrates and fermentation residues of biogas plants. In the course of a plant screening, inputs and fermentation residues of various biogas plants were tested for the presence of pathogenic clostridia. Independent of the operating mode and temperature, pathogenic clostridias could be identified in input and fermentation residues. The sensitivity of spores of pathogenic clostridia to high temperatures depending on different residence periods was additionally tested in hygienization tests. Spores of C. sporogenes and C. perfringens survive the standard hygienization temperature of 70 °C for at least ten hours.
content.title_en: Presence and prevention of pathogenic clostridia in fermentation substrates and fermentation residues of biogas plants

content.text: The present work presents results of the experimental examination of the original concept for a hot-charge carrier solar cell. The solar cell to be developed is intended to demonstrate an energy gain by photogenerated hot-charge carriers and thus to show a novel approach for the further development of more efficient solar cell. Two prototype structures based on Au:Zn/InP/PbSe/ZnO:Al and Ag/ZnTe/PbSe/ZnO:Al were produced with cost-effective technology processes. The strip offsets and the crystal structure in a novel heteroepitatric ZnTe/PbSe structure were determined and published. The entire strip arrangement of the two prototype cells was reconstructed and analyzed. Both prototype cells were previously characterized by both classical and novel double-beam measurement methods. In the second double-heterostructure a higher yield of hot-charge carriers was found and this was justified.
content.title_en: Band-delayed heterostructures for the use of the hot charge carriers in third generation solar cells

content.text: Search engine optimization and competition law. The present consideration from the perspective of the UWG shows which measures of search engine optimization (SEO) are permissible or inadmissible under competition law. The investigation is initially devoted to a presentation of the SEO, as well as the classification of the latter with regard to the UWG and shows fundamental problems of a cleanliness-legal consideration of SEO. Subsequently the author subsumes a variety of case constellations of the SEO under facts of the UWG. An examination of the previous case law of the UWG and SEO follows. The work provides concrete instructions for the fairness-legal application, which is confronted with cases of the SEO.
content.title_en: Search engine optimization and competition law

content.text: Multivariate hydrometeorological extreme events and their impacts on vegetation: potential methods and applications. Dryness and heat waves affect our society and vegetation. Especially in relation to climate change the effects on vegetation are of particular importance. In the global carbon cycle terrestrial ecosystems are usually sinks of carbon dioxide, but can transform during and after climate extreme events into carbon sources. A crucial aspect here is the role of different plant species and vegetation types on different scales that influence the effects on the carbon cycle. Although physiological differences between different plant species are obvious different reactions to extreme events, these differences are not systematically evaluated and fully understood at global level. Another aspect is that climate extreme events are from nature multivariate. For example, hot air can absorb more water than cold air. Extreme events with strong effects were in the past often multivariate, as for example in Europe 2003, Russia 2012, or the USA 2012. These multivariate nature of climate extremes require a multivariate perspective on these events are not used to improve the detection of individual variables.
content.title_en: Multivariate hydrometeorological extreme events and their impacts on vegetation : potential methods and applications

content.text: Photooxidation of water on WO3(001) : a combined approach of periodic slab calculations, embedded cluster model, artificial intelligence and quantum dynamics. In this dissertation, the photooxidation of water on WO3(001) was investigated. For this purpose, a three-dimensional potential surface was first analyzed using periodic slab models of the water splitting cycle. From the resulting geometries a W12O36 cluster model could be evaluated, with which a three-dimensional potential surface could be calculated with the CASSCF method in the basic state and charge transfer state. These surfaces were interpolated with a neuronal network optimized by a genetic algorithm. Photochemistry could be analyzed in wave packet studies. In this dissertation the photooxidation of water to WO3(001) was investigated. First the water splitting cycle was analyzed with periodic slab models. From the resulting geometries a W12O36 cluster model a evaluated, with the parameter dimensioning dimension.
content.title_en: Photooxidation of water to WO3(001) : a combined approach of periodic slab calculations, embedded cluster model, artificial intelligence and quantum dynamics

content.text: Chance instead of show - citizen participation with Virtual Reality & Co. : Acceptance and effect of visualisation of construction projects. With classical planning documents or image montages, ordinary citizens can hardly assess the benefits and effects of construction projects. Today, 3D models, which are available in a wide range of spatially free-to-live environment, enable spectacular applications in which the viewer dives into the planning as if they had already been realized. Arne Spieker formulates requirements for the use in citizen participation to construction projects and examines the acceptance and effect of different visualization technologies among citizens. He shows that real-time simulations and virtual reality have great potential across groups, when credibility and information content are the main focus instead of chic picture worlds. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Chance instead of Show - citizen participation with Virtual Reality & Co. : Acceptance and effect of visualisation of construction projects

content.text: The results of the research on the reactivity of the known Singulet biradical [P(μ-NTer)]2 are presented and explained in this dissertation. Reactivity to service and diines, diazomethanes and bromalkanes has been investigated. Initial reactions have also been performed with a Brønsted acid, which has a weakly coordinating anion. The novel compounds obtained have been characterized by analytical methods such as NMR, IR and Raman spectroscopy, mass spectrometry and single crystal roe structure analysis. In this dissertation, the results of the investigations on the reactivity of the known single biradical [P(μ-NTer)]2 are presented and explainediented. The reactivity towards dienes and diynes, wheat and waste in broken.
content.title_en: Investigations on novel derivatives of the singulart biradical [P(μ-NTer)]2

content.text: International jurisdictional bases for data protection on the Internet. The omnipresence of the Internet poses challenges for states in the area of data protection regulation. In order to ensure an appropriate standard of protection, they often rely on applying their own legal rules to cross-border situations on the Internet. Stefan Herrmann examines the possibilities offered by the customary principles of jurisdiction recognised under international law and what limits they set. In addition to the fundamental territoriality principle, the focus is on the principle of personality and protection as well as the principle of effect. The latter is particularly used by the Basic Data Protection Regulation as a promising cornerstone in determining the spatial scope of the regulation. Furthermore, the author addresses possible legal conflicts in data protection regulation on the network and proposes an approach to resolve the conflicts. Stefan Herrmann deals the degree of privacy and limitation of cross-border data protection regulations issues on the internal law perspective and demonstrates how regulations conflicts with each other.
content.title_en: International Jurisdiction Basis for Data Protection on the Network

content.text: The atmosphere of the tropical regions is one of the areas in which these disturbances unfold with special intensity. In this region, where the climate is mostly warm and humid throughout the year, these atmospheric phenomena are very intense for the transition between drought periods and periods of rainfall with consequences for agriculture and tropical forests. The tropical areas are the home to important large-scale climate, like the El-Niño Southern Oscillation (ENSO), the Madden-Julian Oscillation (MJO) and the atmosphere of the atmosphere.
content.title_en: Water vapor, precision and evapotranspiration isotopic composition in the tropical atmospheric boundary layer

content.text: In this thesis, the new RC-IGBT structure allows the operation with a conventional IGBT gate driver and has achieved a new RC-IGBT concept, called RC-GID-IGBT, which is a state-of-the-art free-run diode. This is achieved by introducing dedicated areas for the diode mode as well as an auxiliary Schottky emitter in the IGBT range without creating negative electrical effects on the IGBT mode. This allows the new RC-GID-IGBT to fully exploit the thermal advantage.
content.title_en: Backward conductive IGBT with almost independent diode characteristic from the gate emitter voltage

content.text: Europe as a border: an ethnography of the border protection agency Frontex. With the European border and coast guard agency Frontex, the European Union has created a uniformed and armed police unit for the first time. Bernd Kasparek presents a detailed analysis of the development and development of the agency. Through a genealogy of the European border and an ethnographic reconstruction of the crisis of Schengen, he examines the long project of the Europeanization of border protection. The focus is on the analysis of changing rationalities, which are reflected in political and technical programming. It is clear that the governance of the border and migration at the same time means the question of the governance of Europe. With the European border and coast guard agency Frontex, the European Union has for the first time created a uniformed and armed police unit. Bernd Kasparek presents a detailed analysis of the development and development of the agency. Through a genealogy of the European border and an ethnographic reconstruction of the crisis of Schengen, he examines the long project of the Europeanization of border protection. The focus is on the analysis of changing rationalities, which are reflected in political and technical programming.
content.title_en: Europe as a border: an ethnography of the Frontex border protection agency

content.text: Everyday life in the mosque: a field research beyond integration issues. What makes a mosque? In her research of the structures and central offers »Prayer«, »Education« and »public events« Veronika Rückamp gives insights into everyday activities in mosques. Based on qualitative interviews and field research in Zurich and Vienna, she shows that mosques are in a field of tension between changing expectations of members and external influences and have to define themselves again and again. Thus, she makes an important contribution to better understanding mosques in Switzerland and Austria beyond integration issues.
content.title_en: Everyday life in the mosque : a field research beyond integration issues

content.text: Reliable and manufacturer-wide medical device interoperability - contributions to the IEEE 11073 SDC family of standards. Medical devices in hospitals are now almost exclusively isolated island solutions. They do not provide information and interaction options to the outside world - or only within their closed ecosystem. Therefore, this work introduces into the new IEEE 11073 Service-oriented Device Connectivity (SDC) family of standards that enables interoperability across manufacturers. Three areas of application are considered: reliable remote triggering of device functionalities, dynamic association of remote control elements and operations and distributed alarm systems. <ger> Medical devices in today's hospitals are always always always isolated systems, which do not transmit information to or interact with external devices. At the most, this is possible within closed company ecosystems.
content.title_en: Reliable and cross-manufacturer medical device interoperability - Contributions to the IEEE 11073 SDC family of standards

content.text: Modelling and generation of combinable user interface variants and their joint use in service ecosystems. Digitalization enables us to interact with partners (e.g. companies, institutions) in an IT-supported environment and to carry out activities that were previously done manually. One aim of digitalization is to combine services of different professional domains into processes and make many user groups accessible to suit their needs. To this end, providers provide technical services that can be integrated into different applications. Digitalization presents the application development new challenges. One aspect is the need-based connection of users to services. To interact with the services of human users, user interfaces are needed, which are tailored to their needs. For this purpose, variants for specific user groups (technical variants) and varying environments (technical variants) are required. Increasingly, these must be combined with services of other providers in order to connect to processes across domains ...
content.title_en: Modelling and generation of combinable interface variants and their common use in service ecosystems

content.text: Legal and expedient acting of the Executive Director in the preparation of financial statements: the due diligence requirements of §§ 93 (1) AktG, 43 (1) GmbHG to the preparation of annual and consolidated financial statements. The author examines the requirements for the legal and expedient acting of the Executive Director in the preparation of annual and consolidated financial statements, taking into account the planned innovations by means of the law to strengthen financial market integrity. With the aim of clarifying the borderline between legal balance sheet policy and illegal balance sheet manipulation, the Executive Director is working out the corporate due diligence requirements that must be observed in the exercise of financial market integrity strictness Act, the authority first analyzes to what degree IFRS and reporting standards under the German Commercial Code and determine the extent of the determination by the settlement.
content.title_en: Legal and expedient action of the managing director in the preparation of financial statements : the due diligence requirements of §§ 93 (1) AktG, 43 (1) GmbHG to the preparation of the annual and consolidated financial statements

content.text: Models for mexican temperate forests: a sustainable management approach. In Mexico, there is a need for technologies that combine the dynamics of forest resources with forest systems. The deployment and application of these technologies could improve forest management, which could not only be more profitable but also better adapted to climate change. Recently, there has been a debate about forest management in terms of carbon and climate change. Recent studies claim that it is better for carbon capture and storage to grow the forest without management. Other researchers argue, however, that... In Mexico there is a need for technologies that link forest stand dynamics with silviculture systems. Providing these technologies could enhance forest management, not only by making forests more profitable, but by adapting them to climate change. Lately, there has been a debate on how to manage carbon dioxide and increase stocks.
content.title_en: Models for mexican temperate forests : a sustainable management approach

content.text: Promoting attention and motivation through digital game-based learning systems with specific autism skills. Institutional education is linked to diverse and specific obstacles for autistic learners. This is particularly true in connection with inclusion, the relevance of which is not least given by the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. This work discusses numerous learning-relevant features in the context of autism and shows discrepancies with the not always adequately appropriate institutional teaching concepts. A central thesis is that the unusually intensive attention of autists can be used for their special interests to facilitate learning with foreign content. Building on this, solutions are discussed, which result in a novel concept for a digital multi-device-based learning game. An essential challenge in the conception of game-based learning is the adequate integration of learning content into a compelling narrative context.
content.title_en: Promoting attention and motivation through digital game-based learning systems with specific autism skills

content.text: Process as a form: Parametry as a fundamental principle of function of design. The conditions of the digital present no longer allow for design in rigid schemes and isolated individual considerations. The constantly changing contexts demand a fundamental adaptability of design, which can only be ensured by a holistic consideration of things in their contexts and a creative thinking in changes - through parametry. Fabian Collenings suggests a paradigm shift through which designers no longer design the concrete design, but rather the conditions of design themselves: it is no longer finished products, but connectible processes that now obtain a form. Design; Process; Parametry; Artificial Intelligence; Design; Architecture; Culture; Process; Parametry; Artificial Intelligence; Design; Architecture; Architecture; Architecture; Architecture; Culture; Culture; Culture
content.title_en: Process as a shape : Parametry as a basic principle of design

content.text: The Fermente des Soziales : thermal figures in social theory. Elena Beregow's study develops a sociology of temperation. It explores social natural cultures, thermopolitics and temporalities based on the thermal figures of fire, machine and fermentation that have been overlooked so far. The latter is the focus of the work and is developed in readings by Marx, Durkheim, Lévi-Strauss, Serres, Latour and Haraway. The present materialistic discussion of the fermentation metaphor allows new social theoretic figures of the ‹small› to be identified. In them, utopian hopes in the materiality of the social—the new, creative and unexpected—are readable as well as the ‹dark› moments of decay, decomposition and dissolution.
content.title_en: Fermente des Soziales : Thermal figures in social theory

content.text: Between biopower and life power: biopolitical thinking by Michel Foucault and Ernst Jünger. Are there parallels between Michel Foucault's and Ernst Jünger's political thinking? At first glance, this seems absurd. But Nasser Ahmed in Foucault's "sexuality and truth I" and disciple's "The Worker" reveals the same type of biopolitical thinking and shows how close both approaches are. Between the biopower on the one hand and the life power on the other, he illuminates a space that has remained invisible in political classifications to date: Foucault and Jünger stand as biopolitical thinkers on the same side of a fundamental division of political thinking, which understands the political rather than the function of understanding, but rather as the function of struggle.
content.title_en: Between Biopower and Life Power : biopolitical thinking by Michel Foucault and Ernst Jünger

content.text: Students – Students – Inclusion: Orientations on the path to differentiated teacher education?. The implementation of inclusive school education raises questions about the professionalization of prospective teachers – in particular, the importance of the respective school and educational orientations is emphasized. At the same time, it is striking in the discussions about inclusion that the students themselves speak only little. The study takes up these findings by focusing both on the addressee of the pupils and that of the students and by asking how the students refer to the views of students in their understanding of inclusion. The documentary analysis of student orientations shows that students hardly perceive the voices of the pupils as independent positions, but rather rather use them as a starting point for shaping their own future position in the school. The results are illuminated under a praxeological perspective on teacher professionalism and provide information on which differentiation-related norms become effective and from which students make use of the requirements and also of the teaching.
content.title_en: Students – Students – Inclusion : Orientations on the way to differential-sensitive teacher education?

content.text: The spectra of indefinite singular Sturm-Liouville operator. In this work, the spectral properties of singular Sturm-Liouville differential operators of the form Af=1/r((pf') + qf) with real-value coefficients p, q and r are investigated. Here we consider indefinite weight functions r. Based on findings of the relative oscillation theory as well as the floquet theory for periodic Sturm-Liouville operators, criteria are demonstrated which ensure the stability of essential spectra under disturbance of the coefficients. In addition, the accumulation of self-values in the gaps of the essential spectrum is investigated. We formulate conditions that imply an accumulation of self-values within a gap or exclude an accumulation. Furthermore, the non-reel spectra of indefinite Sturm-Liouville operators are determined on the basis of a certain proof of non-reel self-values in terms of their absolute amount and imagarity of the inherently inherently determined parameters.
content.title_en: The spectra of indefinite singular Sturm-Liouville operators

content.text: This involves the use of data to generate data on the vehicle itself and its environment. Consequently, data on the vehicle has become an important resource for the automotive industry, as it also enables (data-driven) services. Ecosystems of actors working together to ultimately generate services are formed. This cumulative dissertation summarises the author's contributions and contains a synopsis and 14 reviewed publications that contribute to the response to the three research questions. Consequently, (vehicle) Data has become an important resource, which can be a way to (data-driven) Services. The (data-driven) service on the industry industry is able to perform.
content.title_en: Quantified vehicles : data, services, ecosystems

content.text: The study on needs-oriented approaches to regionalization in scientific further education is based on empirical data and case studies. The results of the analysis confirm a new regionalization as a counter-movement to internationalization, which is consciously shaped in scientific further education. This also forms part of the economic regional development, because the qualification offers are further developed on the ground. The author presents the first study on this relevant topic of educational and university practice. His practical analysis underpins the regionalization tendencies of scientific higher education with a theoretical foundation and creates a model as a guide for practice.
content.title_en: Educational regions in scientific further education : model and empirical analysis

content.text: Control by Prevention : A Critical Analysis of the Burnout Prevention according to Michel Foucault. In view of the global crisis of mental health, it is essential to consider burnout prevention as a government problem and part of a prevention dispositive. Starting from the perspective of governmentality, Jozef Zelinka shows how the prevention of mental disorders is used to secure the neoliberal performance society: subjects are pushed to self-management by continuous risk pressure and risk calculation. The critical dispositive analysis makes these discursive, everyday practice and above all material manifestations of prevention visible.
content.title_en: Governing by Preventing : A Critical Analysis of the Burnout Prevention According to Michel Foucault

content.text: Heimat. Volkstum. Architektur : Explorations of the popular-oriented construction of the Heimatschutz movement in the context of modernism and National Socialism. Around 1900, the Heimatschutz movement developed an architectural programmatics from the popular discourse that established its own identity-political play style of modernity. Rainer Schmitz examines its origin and conception by actors of the »Federal Homeland Protection« founded in 1904 such as Ernst Rudorff, Paul Schultze-Naumburg or Otto March. His explorations focus on the translation of social phenomena such as the »social question«, homeland, folk or anti-Semitism into the building discourse as well as their architectonization in projects such as the national stadiums or the »German East Colonization«.
content.title_en: Homeland. Folktism. Architecture : Explorations of the popular-oriented construction of the Homeland Protection Movement in the context of Modernism and National Socialism

content.title_en: Cognitive Science Perspectives on Bible Vision Tales : Example of Transfiguration (Mk 9.2-9)

content.text: Read digital : Change and continuity of a literary practice. What is digital reading? How do readers deal with the digital supply? Individual coping mechanisms are often no longer sufficient to overcome this challenge, and the hype about digital media is shifting the focus to their tradition. The development of stable reading strategies and media competence therefore requires a systematic historical and scientific description of the phenomenon. Franziska Wilke develops a reading typology from the synthesis of reading act theory, materiality and media research as well as practical theory, which illustrates the reading of digital literature. Her knowledge is not only useful for readers, but also for those who want to become them.
content.title_en: Digital reading : Change and continuity of a literary practice

content.text: Synthesis and functionalization of carbo- and heterocycles by photocatalytic transformations. A catalyst transformation of a Grubbs catalyst was developed for the photoredox catalyst Rutheniumtris (2.2'-bipyridine), which was synthetically used in a sequential catalysis of a ring-closing metathesis and a 1.2-difunctionalization. Furthermore, the spirooxindol alkaloid dioxyreserpine was functionalized at different positions and the derived derivatives were investigated for their biological activity against different cancer cell lines.
content.title_en: Synthesis and functionalization of carbo- and heterocycles by means of photocatalytic transformations

content.text: Civil cold: affect and colonial subjectivity. "Civil cold" is a state of feeling of the present, with which citizens protect themselves from the violence that they cause themselves. Henrike Kohpeiss looks at colonialism and the philosophy of enlightenment, and explains how racist emotional structures develop. For this, the classical, critical texts by Adorno and Horkheimer enter into a dialogue with the field of black studies and thinkers such as Saidiya Hartman, Fred Moten and Denise Ferreira da Silva. These two intellectual traditions combine radical criticism of the capitalist and colonial institution of the world. The history of European colonialism is thus read as an affect theory of bourgeois subjectivity, it is taken from every appearance of innocence.
content.title_en: Civil cold : affect and colonial subjectivity

content.text: The international protection of privacy against intelligence surveillance: the secret service search for the telecommunications of individuals in the light of the IPPbR and the ECHR. The dissertation examines the intelligence surveillance of private telecommunications and its compatibility with the international human right to privacy in Article 17 ICCPR and in Article 8 ECHR. These articles provide comprehensive protection against the most modern forms of surveillance, including mass surveillance. Concrete criteria for the certainty of the surveillance laws apply. The monitoring must also be approved and controlled by independent authorities and effective remedies must be available. In addition, the study examines the extent to which the monitoring state and the State of residence violate their human rights obligations in cross-border surveillance. The central question is whether the previous definitions of "jurisdiction" are applicable to this extraterritorial scenario. The extraterritorial exercise of the jurisdiction may also rely on control over certain objects relevant to human rights. According to this approach, telecommunications data are objects relevant to the right of individuals to correspondence and data protection.
content.title_en: International protection of privacy against intelligence surveillance: the secret service search of individuals' telecommunications in the light of the IPPbR and the ECHR

content.text: Engagement and memory: left story in novel literature after 1989. It is said that the winners write the story. So how is the memory of the struggles of the workers' movement after 1989 told? Do decay stories and a "left melancholy" dominate or unfold in the memory of what has happened a possibility thinking that can also re-spect the future? Sebastian Schweer analyses committed German-language memory novels in which the workers' history is archived, criticized, reflected and further spun. Following the question of the relationship between the form of novel, memory and the status of utopian thinking, he deals with subjects such as house occupation, terrorism, the heritage of the GDR or socialist cybernetics.
content.title_en: Engagement and memory : left story in novels after 1989

content.text: Indigenous Resistance: the resistance of the Bolivian TIPNIS movement. Klappentext: Latin America knows numerous protest movements of its indigenous population. One of the most emblematic cases is the social movement against a prestige project of the Morales government: the construction of a road in the indigenous territory and the National Park Isiboro Sécure (TIPNIS) in the Bolivian Amazon region. With regard to the perspectives of the heterogeneous protest actors Maximilian Held reconstructs this resistance in its complex manifestations. He highlights how problems of weakened indigenous self-government, socio-ecological threats, deficits of the neo-extractive development model and lack of legal implementation are related.
content.title_en: Indigenous Resistance : the resistance of the Bolivian TIPNIS movement

content.title_en: The obligation to block airspace over conflict zones: an investigation of sovereign responsibility during the launch of flight MH17 over eastern Ukraine

content.text: Edge resistance optimized (further) development of a process for separating ultra-thin glass. The use of glasses, especially ultra-thin glass, is restricted in numerous innovative applications by their brittle fracture behaviour. In the present work a new, ready-to-work edge resistance measurement method for ultra-thin glass samples is described, compared with established strength testing methods and found to be suitable for use. In the further course of the work, an edge resistance optimized scratch and break process for ultra-thin glass is developed by the construction of new machine components using a high number of tested samples and advanced statistical methods. In addition, it is demonstrated that the strength resulting from the process can be predicted by means of a linear model when a cutting liquid is used. A large amount of tested samples are then demonstrated that the resulting strength follows a 3-parameter cross-section and therefore has a strength threshold below which the fracture probability is negligible in engineering terms. This enables product designers to develop innovative products that are based on a reliable high strength of ultra-thin glass and thus extend the range of lenses significantly.
content.title_en: Edge resistance optimized (further) development of a process for separating ultra-thin glass

content.title_en: Good morals as a barrier to protection : an investigation into German and European intellectual property law

content.text: The development of Internet platforms has an increasing impact on business and trade. This also poses challenges for tax law in the definition of commercial and business activities. This volume examines the tax law treatment of Internet trade in terms of revenue and turnover tax law. It analyses case law, financial administration and literature and examines whether alternatives to the previous approaches exist. The development of internet platforms is having an increasing impact on economic life and trade. This also poses challenges for tax law in the development of commercial and entrepreneurial activity. This volume deals with alternative to the internet commerce in terms of income and turnover tax law.
content.title_en: The treatment of Internet trade in terms of income and turnover tax

content.text: Talking with data: Practices, expertise and visualization modes in data journalism. Data journalists use digital data, which they process, visualize and publish in a journalistic manner. Rahel Estermann develops on a practical and field level which expertise, materialities, cultures and social processes intertwine in data journalism. Data visualizations are shown as common vocabulary, which enables us to speak with the data in two ways: on the one hand, to produce insights, on the other hand, to present insights using data. Thus, the processes of renegotiating epistemological and professional cultures in a data-infected society become visible.
content.title_en: Talking with data: Practices, expertise and visualization modes in data journalism

content.text: The Odeion in the Artemision of Ephesos. During the 125-year history of the artemision of Ephesos, the temple rediscovered around 1870 was the focus of the archaeological work, while the holy district surrounding it, once densely built, remained unexplored. In 2009, the Austrian Archaeological Institute initiated a project to become the only visible Roman ruin within the holy district to extend the research focus from this building to the Roman usage phase and the entire sacred district. The construction, previously known as the "Tribune", could be identified as early imperial odeion due to close structural typological comparisons and specific finds. In the 125 years of research, the legendary temple of Artemis was always the focus of the archaeological fieldwork, while the once settled settled desert up.
content.title_en: The Odeion in the Artemision of Ephesus

content.text: The furnishing of smaller houses in Pompeii (Insula IX 5) : Decor decisions and their effect (62-79 A.D.). The book examines the interplay of old and new decor elements on the Insula IX 5 in Pompeii in the final phase of the city between 62-79 A.D. The first attempt is made for the houses to grasp construction and equipment phases. However, the equipment is not only chronologically classified, but also in terms of the decor decisions made for them as well as the effect of the Decor. The book examines the interplay of ancient and new decor elements on Insula IX 5 in Pompeii during the final phase of the city between AD 62-79 . This is the first time that attempt has been made to grass the construction and equipment phases of the houses. However, the décor is not classified of the terocordically
content.title_en: The furnishing of smaller houses in Pompeii (Insula IX 5) : Decor decisions and their effect (62-79 A.D.)

content.text: The dangers of networking through networking: a critical examination of the concept of organized crime in the analogue and digital world. The dangers of networking through networking -- Organized crime in the analogue and digital world – Criminal perspective -- Organized crime in the analogue and digital world – Criminal perspective -- Final consideration – Function and value of the label Organized crime. This work is dedicated to the dangers of networking through networking. The aim is to critically examine the concept of organized crime in the analogue and digital world, highlighting the criminal and criminal perspective. To investigate and objectify the myth surrounding the phenomenon Organized crime, first of all, the change and importance of social, economic and criminal networking and then the resulting dangers are highlighted in particular by cybercrime and the relevance for organized crime. Subsequently, etymology and the concept of concept of organised crime are discussed in the analog and digital world from a criminal perspective and to what extent criminal law is oriented towards the findings, new value-based crime.
content.title_en: The dangers of networking through networking: a critical examination of the concept of organised crime in the analogue and digital world

content.text: Decentralized applications in the sharing economy: market access, consumer protection, liability. Blockchain technology has long been used only as a synonym for bitcoin. At the same time, the sharing economy has become a mass business by representatives such as Airbnb and Uber. Blockchain-based business models in the form of decentralized applications are subject to the same legal restrictions as previous models of the sharing economy. More and more business models are developing based on blockchain technology and in the area of sharing economy. This raises the question of regulatory requirements. Kai Georg Hindahl examines this in his work using examples of decentralized applications. For a long time, blockchain technology was only used as a synonym for Bitcoin. At the same time, the sharing economy became a mass business and the subject of regulatory attention through reflected as Airbnb and Uber. In the same time, more and more business models based on the migration of the migration into the hierarchy.
content.title_en: Decentralised applications in the sharing economy: market access, consumer protection, liability

content.text: How our feelings have changed : Emotional discourses in the "BRAVO". What does a "right", "normal" or "healthy" approach to emotions look like? Depending on the socio-historical context, the answers to this question vary considerably. Manuela Beyer shows how perceptions of feelings and emotion management have changed in the Federal Republic of Germany since the 1960s. Using a discourse analysis of the advisory pages of the youth magazine BRAVO, the study shows how social demands on the management of emotions have changed. Beyond theses of increasing liberation or oppression of feelings, it becomes clear which new emotional practices have developed.
content.title_en: How our feeling has changed : Emotional discourses in the "BRAVO"

content.text: The scandal surrounding Hitler's diaries not only occupied the Federal Republic of Germany in 1983, but was considered worldwide. The magazine "Stern" had published excerpts from the alleged diaries of Adolf Hitler. One came to the public with the demand for interpretation that from now on the Nazi history "must be rewritten in large parts" and thus triggered a storm of indignation. Sebastian Barth's investigation starts here: Adolf Hitler was presented in a "star" and in a "star TV" film with no hesitation, and this taboo break in his historical and historical context as well as his reception in a situation (historically) politically and journalistically heated up at the beginning of the eighties are analysed in detail.
content.title_en: Rewritten history? : the Hitler Diaries and their Echo

content.title_en: Plant genome editing: legal framework and reform options

content.text: Quality Intelligence: IT-based decision support for preventive quality assurance in the early phases of the vehicle development process. Introduction -- Business and technical foundations -- Case Study on the exploration of preventive concept assurance – Methodology and insights -- Development of a specialist concept for decision support for preventive concept assurance -- Prototyping and evaluation -- Abstraction, appreciation and research needs. Due to the high dynamics and complexity in the context of vehicle formation, product quality is an essential challenge for the long-term competitiveness of automobile manufacturers. Product quality is influenced in particular by decisions taken in the early phases of automotive development. Studies show that the availability of relevant quality-related information in this context can make a significant contribution to decision-making. The aim of the research work is therefore to develop an IT-based approach to decision support for preventive protection of product concepts in the early phases of automotive product development process. The solution of the present work includes an exploration of preventive protection of product concepts in the early vehicle development phases. The aim of the research work is therefore to develop an IT-based approach to decision support for preventive protection of product concepts in the early phases of automotive development.
content.title_en: Quality Intelligence : IT-based decision support for preventive quality assurance in the early stages of the vehicle development process

content.text: The American Right and the Environment : History of Radicalization. In January 1970, Republican Richard Nixon signed the National Environmental Policy Act and institutionalized modern environmental policy in the USA. In the two following decades, federal and state governments implemented extensive measures to protect nature. At the same time, a social counter-movement arose: anti-vironmentalism. Protests against parks, drinking water standards and renewable energies are now an integral part of the conservative agenda. Ella Müller traces the historical origin of this phenomenon. It shows how resistance to individual measures could become a reactionary political project whose driving force became the struggle against liberal America. On a broad source basis and with great narrative power, this book reconstructs the history of radicalization: from the 1960s through the Reagan Revolution to the cultural struggles of the present day.
content.title_en: The American rights and environmental protection : history of radicalisation

content.text: Model-based operating strategy for PEM fuel cell systems. Modeling -- Interaction analysis of operational parameters -- Development methodology of the operating strategy -- Functional verification and evaluation of the methodology. Sergei Hahn develops an approach that allows model-based operating strategies for PEM fuel cell systems to be developed. The operating strategy influences on the one hand the performance distribution between battery and fuel cell system and on the other hand the operating conditions within the fuel cell system. By using model-based methods it is possible to optimize both the efficiency and the life of the fuel cell system in operation.The content Modeling Interaction analysis of operational parameters Development methodology of the operating strategy Functional verification and evaluation of the methodology The target groups Dozierende and students from the field of fuel cell and control technology In the business sector employed engineers of these fields The author Sergei Hahn has obtained his doctorate at the Institute for Vehicle Technology Stuttgart (IFS) of the University of Stuttgart in the field of automotive mechatronics.
content.title_en: Model-based operational strategy for PEM fuel cell systems

content.text: Heavy Metal and social change: the social history of a musical culture in the long 1980s. Heavy Metal is a social force that can tell us much about the change in history. Originally a phenomenon of the working class, music culture has conquered new social milieu, regions, media and markets since the 1970s. Heavy Metal has not only become the life content of many fans, but also the work of many people, the musical and commercial fields of experimentation and the social demarcation instrument. For the first time Marco Swiniartzki examines these developments on the basis of a broad source foundation. Numerous interviews with musicians give an insight into the 1980s and show: The social history of heavy metal and the social change of this time go hand in hand.
content.title_en: Heavy Metal and Social Change : Social History of a Music Culture in the Long 1980s

content.text: The expansion of public charging infrastructure for electric vehicles: prospects of state control for climate protection and mobility benefits. The conversion of individual traffic to battery electric mobility is a central component of the traffic transition necessary for climate protection. However, electric cars are not attractive enough without a nationwide network of publicly accessible charging stations. The lack of affordable charging opportunities, especially in the countryside, inhibits the spread of climate-friendly drive technology. Therefore, state support is needed to accelerate charging infrastructure expansion. In assessing various policy options, regulatory questions arise. The focus is on the legal framework for dealing with the grid character of the charging infrastructure and its consequent economic features, in particular in the ratio of accelerated infrastructure development and competitive security. Climate protection in private transport demand a switch to low-emission drive technologies. Electromobility looks partially prohibiting – but its success depends on a nationwide network of charging stations. With Germany still affecting some aspects of the Charlotte option.
content.title_en: The development of public charging infrastructure for electric vehicles : Prospects of government control for climate protection and mobility assurance

content.text: Peptide masking of oligonucleotides with self-decomposing lefters. This work describes the peptide masking of oligonucleotides with self-decomposing lefters for prodrug and release strategies.
content.title_en: Peptide masking of oligonucleotides with self-decomposing links

content.text: The survey of the patient flow management in complex interdependent hospitals: development, implementation and evaluation of procedures based on simulation, optimization and data-mining. Waiting times are the result of an inefficient patient flow management. Instead of high investment in new capacities, this work shows approaches to the use of existing resources to increase patient flow. Hospital-wide overflow rules allow patients to move to other stations to overcome bottlenecks. Because not all bottlenecks with good planning can be avoided a procedure based on medical needs of patients and the skills of the stations, which suggests avoiding stations for individual patients, is quickly and with high treatment quality.
content.title_en: Investigation of patient flow management in complex interdependent hospitals : Development, implementation and evaluation of procedures based on simulation, optimization and data mining

content.text: Computer graphics: the history and production aesthetics of synthetic images. There are numerous methods to create digital images. However, this diversity makes it difficult to differentiate between digital photographs, AI or CGI images. Carolin Scheler, using the example of 3D computer graphics, presents a fundamentally new approach to aesthetically analyze digital image products. Starting from the production process, she describes computer graphics as an independent expression process and works out an inherent ideological idea of realism inherent to computer-generated images. It becomes clear: in computer graphics software development, a certain world feeling is always inscribed - with implications for the relationship between image and reality.
content.title_en: Computer graphics : about the history and production aesthetics of synthetic images

content.text: The EEG levy applied the costs of the green electricity expansion to electricity consumers by 2023. Initially, the levy obligation was linked to electricity supply, which was why the electricity produced was not included. The EEG abolished the so-called "self-current privilege" in principle with the EEG 2014. However, several exceptional circumstances led to the fact that a large part of the own consumption volumes were still privileged. The work examines to what extent this patchwork of different regulations is due to the constitutional and European framework. In addition to a systematic collection of the simple legal framework, an analysis is carried out to what extent constitutional and European law limits the legal scope for state-induced but privately-managed levy systems.
content.title_en: The constitutional and European framework for the burden of own production on the EEG levy
