content.title_en: Combination of nanofabrication and nanometrology on a planar Ø100 mm nanofabrication machine (NFM-100)

content.text: Economic problems of the policy of oil conservation in the USA. This economic analysis of the conservation policy of the USA in relation to its oil economy asks: How can production at the lowest possible cost be achieved while avoiding overproduction and how can it be ensured that the production and consumption of the limited and inexhaustible stocks are carried out optimally over time?
content.title_en: Economic problems of oil conservation policy in the USA

content.text: The novel in the sign of itself : Typology, analysis and historical studies on the discourse of literary self-representation in the Spanish novel of the 15th to 20th century. Klappentext: This book develops a general model that describes the literary thematicization of aesthetic sign practice (writing, reading, textuality) semiotically and reconstructs discurs historicalally. In analyses of Spanish novels of the 15th to 20th century, this discourse appears in the field of tension between media change, poetics, aesthetic subject constructions and narrative strategies.
content.title_en: The novel in the character of his own: Typology, analysis and historical studies on the discourse of literary self-representation in the Spanish novel of the 15th to 20th century

content.text: The vegetation density of the Xerothermrases northwest of Halle/Saale : methods of recording, structural vegetation types and the influence of vegetation density on the reproductive potential of Xerothermrasen species : with 25 tables in the text and on 3 supplements.
content.title_en: The vegetation density of the Xerothermrases north-west of Halle/Saale : methods of recording, structural vegetation types and the influence of vegetation density on the reproductive potential of Xerothermrasen species : with 25 tables in the text and on 3 supplements

content.text: Informative knowledge: a sociology of knowledge of computerized society. Through the massive use of new media in science and everyday life, knowledge about the right information acquisition and use of knowledge becomes increasingly important. At the same time, the use of new technologies changes the knowledge they impart. Nina Degele provides an engaging analysis of the social upheaval that is being set in motion by the increasing dissemination of information and communication technologies. At the same time, it shows how knowledge will be managed, changed and effective in the future.
content.title_en: Informative knowledge: a knowledge sociology of computerized society

content.text: Development of a concept for the modelling and evaluation of workflows. Business reengineering, workflow management and the use of standard business application software lead to new requirements for the design of information systems. The development of reference architectures, models and systems is of great importance here, as such reference instruments can standardize term systems and delimit system components and systematise system components. The book deals with the design of computer-supported workflows and organizational structures using workflow management systems. It provides a comprehensive methodological toolkit for the modelling and evaluation of business processes and workflows. The presented concept covers the complete cycle of a business process, starting from the development of business strategy, through business process analysis and its restructuring as well as modeling to the more detailed workflow modelling, simulation and execution.
content.title_en: Development of a concept for modelling and evaluation of workflows

content.text: The liberation of the living world is a phenomenon of architecture of the 20s and 30s. When Sigfried Giedion published his small book "Free Living" in 1929, classical modern architecture was at the height of its creative development. What was planned and realized in Europe in the period from 1927 to 1932, both the building technology, the spatial thinking and the architectural aesthetics as well as conventional living concepts revolutionized. Le Corbusier, Theo van Doesburg, Mies van der Rohe and other comrades of the avant-garde undertook fascinating attempts of the New Building, which were at that time controversial, but are now admired because of their innovative power and design quality. - The present book turns to the cultural phenomenon of "liberation". In impressive contemporary text works from the numerous publications published for this purpose as well as illustrative illustrations, in which the enthusiastic dynamics of the architects, artists and writers of those years were once scientifically, sometimes pathetic and not seldom also amusingly reflected, the image of a fundamental component of this period is conveyed. "The Excitation of the Reconstitute of the New Testament" was to be established in the context of the common sense of the modern style.
content.title_en: The Liberation of Living : an architectural phenomenon of the 1920s and 1930s

content.text: Intergenerational divorce transmission in Germany: the search for the "missing link" between divorce in the parent generation and divorce in the child generation. The starting point of this study is the multiple replicated findings from the USA, according to which persons who have experienced the divorce of their parents in their childhood or youth have an increased risk of divorce compared to persons who have not experienced this. The aim of this study was to determine whether the relationship between divorce in the parent generation and divorce in the child generation, as described as "intergenerational divorce transmission", could also be demonstrated in Germany and, if this were the case, how this connection could be explained.
content.title_en: Intergenerational divorce transmission in Germany: the search for the "missing link" between divorce in the parent generation and divorce in the child generation

content.text: The area-distributed modelling of water balance and drainage in the catchment area of the Ammer : with 21 tables. From the introduction: In the context of this work the water balance of the catchment area of the Ammer is to be modelled with a special consideration of the previously insufficiently clarified, area-distributed drainage. The focus is on the physical description of the processes involved in the water balance.
content.title_en: The area-distributed modelling of water balance and drainage in the catchment area of the Ammer : with 21 tables

content.text: Theoretical investigation of monovacances in SiC polytypes. Within the scope of density functional theory (DFT), voids (vacances) are investigated in group IV semiconductors, whereby the exchange-correlation interaction of electrons is treated both in local density approximation (LDA) and in local spin density approximation (LSDA). Structural effects such as atomic relaxation or symmetry reducing jahn-teller distortions are considered on the basis of the Hellmann Feynman theory. Here, the ionic interactions are described by non-standard pseudopotentials. The basis is flat waves. For the modeling of a single Vacance, the supercell method is used with cells up to 216 atoms. The semiconductor materials Si, C and SiC (cubal and hexagonal) are examined. The results on the influence of Vacances on the atomic and electronic properties of these materials are compared with experimental data and other theoretical investigations.
content.title_en: Theoretical investigation of monovacans in SiC polytypes

content.text: Observation of structural changes and restriction analysis of individual DNA molecules in the fluorescence microscope. The present work describes the direct observation of structural changes and enzyme reactions on individual DNA molecules in a conventional fluorescence microscope. The marked DNA is linked to a microsphere that serves as a "grip" for holding the molecule with an optical tweezer, allowing the selection of an individual DNA molecule. The stretching of a molecule and observation of subsequent relaxation enables the examination of its structural dynamics. The analysis of enzymatic reactions is performed after microinjection of a restriction endonuclease into the environment of a stretched molecule and the distribution characterized by its microfluidity. The sequence-unspecific binding of restriction endonucleases to DNA is shown, followed by a linear diffusion of the enzyme along the DNA. Furthermore, a distinction between individually selected similar DNA is shown by its characteristic fragment pattern after restriction with a known endonuclease.
content.title_en: Observation of structural changes and restriction analysis of individual DNA molecules in fluorescence microscope

content.text: Early stages of terpene metabolism. Biosynthesis of the universal terpene block isoptentenylpyrophosphate (IPP) can be done via the long-known mevalonate path (MVA path) or via the methylerythritol phosphospar path (MEP path) discovered in recent years. In plants, the MVA path for the biosynthesis of sesquiterpenes and steroids seems to be responsible, while the MIP path feeds the biosynthesis of monoterpenes. By means of installation experiments with deuterium-marked precursors of both pathways, specific inhibition of both pathways and due to differences in the natural 12C/13C isotopic ratio of the resulting terpene, it was shown that this classical classification is not strictly observed in terpenes of the fresinduced fragrance bouquet of the limabanous Paseolus lunate and that the MEP pathway can also be observed in the sesquiterpene biosynthesis.
content.title_en: Early stages of terpene metabolism

content.text: Global conflicts or global governance? : Continuity and change of global conflict lines after the East-West conflict. Does the end of the East-West conflict also mean the end of system-impressive global conflict lines? This question is examined by analysing six world conferences - from the UNCED 1992 to the Fourth World Conference on Women in 1995. Contrasting are the empirical findings of the case studies with various popular scenarios of international politics, such as the "fight of cultures". Since the conflict lines found do not correspond to any of these scenarios, a model of the international conflict event after the end of the East-West conflict is being developed. The focus of this model is the simultaneous development and coordination dilemma, which should be taken into account in the future discussion of global governance, as should the conflict lines analysed.
content.title_en: Global Conflicts or Global Governance? : Continuity and Change of Global Conflict Lines after the East-West Conflict

content.text: "There are no quotations for me" : Intertextuality in the poetic work of Ingeborg Bachmann. Note Internationale Hölderlin Bibliography: pp. 138-148: "Paris" ; p. 182-184: Nietzsche - Hölderlin; p. 409-411: "Störende Memories" - Hölderlin
content.title_en: "There are no quotes for me" : Intertextuality in the poetic work of Ingeborg Bachmann

content.text: Storage and analysis of microarray data. DNS chips ("microarrays") allow globally designed transcriptional studies by simultaneously capturing several tens of thousands of genes. This produces large amounts of data. These data contain measurement noises, signals in the lower intensity range are unreliable and the data sets usually contain outliers. Moreover, the number of spots on a chip is disproportionately high compared to the number of experimental conditions. This results in a large number of genes, for which a certain gene profile has been measured over a series of experimental conditions, containing a significant number of false positive genes, which occur due to the measurement noise and the large number of genes, as well as the ability to visualize both genes and experimental conditions simultaneously. Therefore, a further analysis must be able to integrate several measurements repeatedly executed for an experimental condition, and also be able to suppress measurement noise and tolerate outliers. The present work introduces a system for intelligent storage of DNS chip data, as well as methods for analysing data from a high level of DNA chip measurement series.
content.title_en: Storage and analysis of microarray data

content.text: Water vapor in the tropical upper troposphere : on the influence of deep convection. Water vapor is one of the most important atmospheric trace gases. Its influence on the climate, chemistry and energy balance is significant. Of particular interest is the distribution of water vapour in the upper troposphere, especially in the tropics. The most important water vapour source for the tropical upper troposphere is tropical convection. It counteracts the large-scale sinking that has its cause both in the dynamics and in the radiation budget. It compensates for the convective upward movement and transports relatively dry air downwards. The net effect of these two processes is little known, especially due to a lack of reliable measurements in this region. In this work, the water vapour content and mechanisms responsible for the water vapour distribution in the upper tropical troposphere are examined using a large amount of in-situ humidity measurements. The measurements were carried out on line aircraft within the EU project MOZAIC (Measurements of Ozone and Water Vapore by airplanes).
content.title_en: Water vapor in the tropical upper troposphere : on the influence of deep convection

content.text: Elemental trace analysis and multivariate statistics for the study and evaluation of the load status of flowing waters. In order to describe and evaluate the distribution of elements in sediments, suspended matter and filtrates of the Elbe and the development of the load with inorganic substances in the 1990s, the Elbe was sampled in several campaigns throughout the longitudinal profile and analyzed on over 60 elements of the periodic table. By evaluating the data material with two- and multi-way main component analyses, the elements were selected for anthropogenic and geogenic characterisation of the river, and were described summarizing typical longitudinal profiles of the relevant elements. Sample locations of similar elemental distribution were combined with hierarchical cluster analyses to form characteristic Elbe sections. By comparing the average sectional concentrations, the temporal development of the elemental load could be quantified. By means of two- and three-way PLS regression models, elemental contents could be predicted in a compartment of measured concentrations in one or two other compartments.
content.title_en: Elemental trace analysis and multivariate statistics for the study and evaluation of the state of load of river waters

content.text: The Zeolithic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meothic-Meo-Meothic-Meothic-Meo-Meothic-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meothic-Meothic-Meo-Meo-Meothic-Meothic-Meo-Meo-Meothic-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo-Meo
content.title_en: Zeolithic filters and membranes in gas sensors

content.text: The Conjecture of the Organism : Probability Thinking and Performance in the Late 18th Century. Note International Hölderlin Bibliography: pp. 341-426: Organization of the Aorgian: Hölderlins Poetics
content.title_en: The Conjecture of the Organism : Probability Thinking and Performance in the Late 18th Century

content.text: The MRI-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-E-
content.title_en: Biologically inspired microtechnical tools for microassembly and minimal invasive surgery

content.text: Physical and technological limitations of SNS-Josephson contacts for highly integrable low-temperature superconductor circuits. The present work investigates the physical and technological limitations of novel SNS-Josephson contacts in ramp technology. Based on interinsically sunned Nb/HfTi/Nb and Nb/HfTi/Nb/HfTi/Nb contacts, a manufacturing technology has been developed that allows to produce reproducible sub-æm contacts down to contact surfaces of A = 0.03 æm2. The physical properties of the contacts are measured: temperature and magnetic field dependence of critical current strength IC, influence of microwave radiation: Shapiro levels, differential resistance. To realize superconducting digital electronic circuits (SDE) the current carrying capacity of sub-æm Nb conductors is determined and the Fring factor is determined. It is shown that the novel Josephson contact is suitable for the production of rapid-conductor-Snapsible in the production of rapid-sonic-Snapsible in the production of standard.
content.title_en: Physical and technological limitations of SNS-Josephson contacts for highly integrated low-temperature superconductor circuits

content.text: A new atomic emission detector (AED) for gas chromatography based on a miniaturized capacitive stabilized plasma. The work is concerned with a new atomic emission detector (GC), the æ-ESD. In this work the structure and the functional principle of æ-ESD is presented. The suitability of the detector for element selective determination of Cl, Br, F, S and C in the near infrared after optimization of some operating parameters was examined. Furthermore, possibilities for correction of spectral and chemical interferences were discussed. The characterization of the detector was based on important detector properties such as selectivity and sensitivity. A final comparison of the æ-ESD with a commercial AED and an electron capture detector using investigations on some environmental samples enabled an assessment of the performance of the new detector. In direct comparison with the commercial AED, analytical aspects were also considered.
content.title_en: An element selective detector for gas chromatography based on a miniaturized capacitively stabilized plasma

content.text: Electron diffraction methods for the structural analysis of epitactic silicon carbide layers. The aim of this work is to investigate the application of various electron diffraction methods for the crystal structure analysis of ultra-thin layers using the example of silicon carbide. The focus was on implementation and the application of effective simulation methods. New programs for the simulation of photoelectron diffraction, the diffraction of retro-scattered electrons and dynamic effects in electron channelling patterns based on different theoretical approaches were developed. The commonalities between photoelectron diffraction and electron channelling patterns are used to present a simulation algorithm of photoelectron diffraction on crystal surfaces, which has enabled the computation of complete photoelectron diffraction patterns in the context of the dynamic kikuchi band theory. Thus, the equivalence of the cluster approach and the kikuchi band approach can be shown in both directions using complete diffraction patterns. Together with the analyzed retro-scatter effects of electrons in LEED and RHEE-experigation contribute to the description of the electron diffraction of the electrons of the total electrons.
content.title_en: Electron diffraction methods for structural analysis of epitactic silicon carbide layers

content.text: The effect of flexible pay components on the labour market, taking into account economic aspects. Flexible wages as a contribution to the reduction of unemployment For some years now, the Federal Republic has experienced a phase of high and persistent unemployment. The high costs and social problems will force policymakers and actors on the labour market to take committed measures. One of the main causes of the high unemployment are inflexible wages, which do not adapt to the market situation, regional or qualification specificities. Serious structural deficiencies also contribute to the increase and the consolidation of unemployment figures. This book shows approaches to flexibilisation, such as the participation of benefits, success or capital, and examines the added value of these models from a national and business perspective. Furthermore, the influence on wage and structural unemployment and the compatibility with other concepts to solve this social problem are examined. There are solutions to the problem of unemployment. Can they also be realized in this society?
content.title_en: The impact of flexible pay components on the labour market, taking into account economic aspects

content.text: Customer-specific mass production: development, preparation of production, change management. In order to be able to respond to customer requests individually also in series production, special requirements for development management and production preparation are to be met. Therefore, in the example of mechatronic systems, the special challenges of development processes with regard to interdisciplinaryness and product complexity are taken into account. The book can be used as a guide for the design of development processes in individualized series production. For the examples discussed, the associated method and tool use is described. TOC:Introduction: Is individuality standardizable?.- The competitive orientation as a customer-specific mass producer.- The field of application "mechatronic products".- Development of customer-specific mass products.- Preparation of the production of individual mass products.- Change management as a customer-specific mass producer.- Summary.-
content.title_en: Customer-specific mass production : development, preparation of production, change management

content.text: A coffin of only the 19th century and a corpse dress: death and death; the history of Catholicism in South West Germany; the history of culture and piety; the history of Catholicism in the 19th century; the history of Catholicism in South West Germany. "A coffin and a corpse dress remain with you of all glory." The present book addresses this topic from a cultural historical perspective. The question is: how the phenomenon of death and death was dealt with religiously within South West German Catholicism. In recent years, the phenomenon of death has become increasingly common in the eyes of the study of mentality. The "history of death" has also become the centre of the bestsellers. The present study approaches the cultural and religious perspective of this topic. A wide selection of sources shows how different "death and death" was brought to the attention of the 19th century: church songs interpret death differently than catechisms, dogma books do not interpret the daily life of the Catholic Church.
content.title_en: A coffin and a funeral dress : Death and death in the 19th century ; on the history of Catholicism in South West Germany

content.text: Kiel in the Weimar Republic : the urban development under Willy Hahn's direction. This book deals with an important phase of change in Kiel's city history at the beginning of the 20th century. The focus is on the architect and city construction councilman Willy Hahn, who was elected as the first full-time technical councillor in 1921 < the city of Kiel and who for nine years determined the urban development and artistic design of this city. After the lost First World War, the city of Kiel, which had hitherto been one-sidedly focused on arms production, faced the difficult task of developing an economic reconstruction program on a civilian foundation that also required new urban development perspectives.
content.title_en: Kiel in the Weimar Republic : the urban development under Willy Hahn's direction

content.text: Calculation of selected parameters of electrical energy quality as the basis for planning electrical energy supply systems. In order to ensure conformity in electrical energy supply systems, it is necessary to include the electrical energy quality in the planning process of grids and plants. The parameters of electrical energy quality must be economically feasible by means of appropriate calculation programs. The necessary requirements for such a calculation program, the necessary mathematical procedures as well as the modeling of the equipment of the grids and the customers are derived and implemented in the SALOMON programme system. Furthermore, methodological indications are provided that allow the efficient use of the program technology, but also ensure that the accuracy requirements are fully met when determining the electrical energy quality parameters. Three case studies show how investigations are to be carried out in the planning of electrical systems and networks for the assessment of electrical energy quality and how the SALOMON programme system can be used in an appropriate manner.
content.title_en: Calculation of selected parameters of the electrical energy quality as the basis for planning electrical energy supply systems

content.text: The German health system is undergoing a transformation. The change is mainly reflected in the public and scientific discussion on the reorganization of the financing of the health system, which is dominated by the concepts of civil insurance and the flat rate of the head. The financial changes resulting from these concepts for private households, health insurance funds and other institutions are far from quantified. The methodology of the impact and redistribution analysis developed in this work enables the assessment of these changes from an individual, institutional and macroeconomic perspective. For evaluation, a computer-based microsimulation model of the German tax and social security system is specified, the "Kiel Tax-Benefit Microsimulation Model". The microsimulation model is characterized by the fact that the financial structure of the German health system is taken into account in detail. This consideration allows the interdependence between legal and private health care systems, the accident insurance system, private households, and public households to determine the redistribution of the German health system in addition to the welfare effects of the family-types, which are shown in terms of the "reduction of the family-types of the health system".
content.title_en: Redistributive effects of the German health system : a microsimulation study

content.text: In the debate about scientific realism, structural realism - which is believed to be the real content of scientific theories in their mathematical-logical structure - is gaining in importance. This paper examines this thesis on the basis of the class of theories, which is most important in our fundamental physics, the Eichtheories, which are characterized by special local symmetry structures. The work offers the reader in its first chapters an introduction to the central topics of symmetries, scientific realism and calibration theories. In the analyses carried out in the middle part, quantum and gravitational calibration theories are examined in detail in conceptual terms - especially with regard to the underlying principles - and ontological aspects - with regard to the subdetermining of the entities and various locality assumptions. The result is a support of structural realism, but not in its radical ontic variant, but in the more moderate epistemic or at all intermedial manner, with regard to the structures as well as to the latter being an epimorphic and non-morphic mode, with which, however, is also present and non-existent and non-existent.
content.title_en: Local symmetries and reality: a natural philosophical study of calibrated theories and structural realism

content.text: The architecture of a knowledge-based threat and risk analysis of IT systems with automated selection and integration of security mechanisms. The security of enterprise application systems is becoming increasingly a decisive factor for the continued existence of enterprises. This results on the one hand from the availability requirements for systems and data required for the business's workflows, and on the other hand from external requirements such as the Data Protection Act. In order to be able to assess an application system with regard to security, the threat and risk analysis identifies risks. On the other hand, the risks identified in this way must be addressed by appropriate modification of the application system. In the consistent implementation of the analysis and subsequent protection, the analyst is insufficiently and partially supported by the existing approach models. This work therefore deals with a consistent approach model for the threat and risk analysis of application systems and their protection by integrating security mechanisms. In this approach model, the analysis results are based on possible risk-based security mechanisms and their impact on risk development and the associated costs. Based on this information, the system operator is supported by the use of the risk assessment systems for the purpose of providing a regular hedging.
content.title_en: Architecture of a knowledge-based threat and risk analysis of IT systems with automated selection and integration of security mechanisms

content.text: Fluids in systems of natural rock composition at ultra-high pressure metamorphic conditions : an experimental approach. This experimental study investigates fluids in natural rock compositions under UHP metamorphic conditions. The UHP fluids are quantified, their chemical composition and distribution described in grain scale, and conclusions are drawn regarding their properties under experimental conditions and their behavior during deterrence. Microstructures and phase paragenesis are characterized by pressure, temperature, experimental time, water content and rock type.
content.title_en: Fluids in systems of natural rock composition at ultra-high pressure metamorphic conditions : an experimental approach

content.text: Biography and culture of education : Personal representations of Pliny the Younger, Gellius and Sueton. What significance did biographical information in the culture of education of the 2nd century AD have to be given and which literary forms were chosen for the presentation of persons? Under this double key question Dennis Pausch examines personal representations of persons in the letters of the younger Pliny, the miscelain work of the Aulus Gellius and the emperor biographies of Sueton in a cross-genus perspective. Sales arguments: - of interest to literary scholars and historians alike - new insights through a cross-genus interpretation approach - important results for cultural communication in the Roman imperial era
content.title_en: Biography and culture of education : Personal representations by Pliny the Younger, Gellius and Sueton

content.text: On the cycle spaces associated to orbits of semi-simple Lie Groups. It is G a semi-simple Liesche group and Q a parabolic subgroup of its complexification GC, then Z = GC/Q is a complex GC-like fold. Group G, just like the complexification KC of the maximum compact subgroup of GC, has a finite effect on Z with only many tracks. To each GBahnʿ exists a KC-Bahn, so that the average ʿ is not empty and compact. By considering the characteristics of the cycles on the edge of G-Bahns, a definition of the cyclone space of any G-Bahn was given. By means of Schubert varieties, Schubert cuts and with the help of a certain complementary hyperarea, the complete characterization of all Zykel-Raums, associated with a G-Bahn ʿ, is given. In particular, all Zykel-Raums, with few exceptions in the Hermitian case, to the area AG is equivalent to the Zykel-Raum.
content.title_en: On the cycle spaces associated to orbits of semi-simple Lie Groups

content.text: Axiomatics and Empirie : a scientific theory-historical study of the mathematical philosophy of nature from Newton to Neumann. In order to be able to analyse and investigate the classical Newtonian mechanics in their time, one must particularly consider the change in the relationship between axiomatics and empiries. Helmut Pulte does this here for the first time in a detailed manner.
content.title_en: Axiomatics and Empirie : a historical study of science theory on the mathematical philosophy of nature from Newton to Neumann

content.text: Optimization of complex movement patterns in throwing movements. Maximising the departure speed of the competition equipment and the target precision are crucial for the success of the competition in sports games as well as in the light athletic throwing disciplines. Although the training methods have been optimised in recent years, it is reserved for a few athletes to make the absolute top in this area. These differences in the quality of the movement execution are largely individually determined on the basis of an individually optimally pronounced movement coordination. Since the classical, program-oriented technology training does not represent the desired solution, this band tried to develop a system dynamically oriented, differential training program, which should, in a reasonable time frame, lead to an improvement of the movement coordination. By means of a process-oriented research approach, the kinematic and electromyographic characteristics were subsequently captured within a one year training study, whereby the system dynamically oriented method, unlike the program-oriented training method, proved to be effective.
content.title_en: Optimization of complex motion patterns in throwing movements

content.text: The survey was conducted by the German Ministry of Economic Affairs and Labour in spring 2005. The study was conducted by the German Ministry of Economic Affairs and Economic Affairs and the German Ministry of Economic Affairs and Economic Affairs. The study was conducted by the German Ministry of Economic Affairs and Economic Affairs and the German Ministry of Economic Affairs and Economic Affairs. The study was conducted in the ifo area of industry research and concluded in spring 2005. The study was based on the state and perspectives of the eNew Economy in Germany and a comparison with five other Member States of the European Community (France, Great Britain, Italy, the Netherlands and Sweden) with regard to diffusion and the effects of the use of modern information and communication technologies (ICT). In methodological terms, the analyses are based on a meso-economic approach, in which four sectors were examined in an exemplary way: mechanical engineering, vehicle construction, banking and trade. The question is addressed in an interdisciplinary way. Using existing scientific literature on the eNew Economy, a synopsis of previous results is made and in cooperation with Professor Jan-Egbert Sturm, University of Konstanz, the business-theoretical relationships, in particular the non-explicit assumptions, a statistical analysis of the results are conducted by the survey of the survey of the business and the business and the business sector.
content.title_en: Bridges between ecology and economy : environmental and economic knowledge for sustainable regional economies

content.text: Schooling and organization : the shape and problem of state school regulation. Introduction and questioning - analysis perspective and data analysis - case determination: curriculum work as an organizational tool and as an organization - curriculum work in the Federal Republic between 1990 and 1995 - outlook: rule of authority, levelling and field of tension
content.title_en: Education and organisation: the shape and problem of state school regulation

content.text: From the Chaussee to the rail: military strategy and railways in Prussia from 1833 to the campaign of 1866. In the middle of the 19th century and as a result of the industrial revolution, the technical change also affected the armies of Europe. Of considerable strategic importance were the new railways, with the help of which the general staffs could plan for the first time larger troop transports. Especially Prussia was dependent on this revolutionary means of transport because of the exposed situation of its provinces. After a short initial restraint, the conceptual and organizational conditions for the military use of the railway were determined from the end of the thirties on. In the war of 1866 against Austria it became clear how strategy and warfare had changed through the new mobility.
content.title_en: From the Chaussee to the rail: military strategy and railways in Prussia from 1833 to the campaign of 1866

content.text: Symmetrization procedures for the isoperimetric problem in symmetric spaces of noncompact type. In this work a new symmetrization method for the isoperimetric problem in symmetrical spaces of the noncompact type is developed. This is a generalization of Steiner symmetrization in Euclidian space. Unlike in the classical case, the symmetrized area results from the solving of a nonlinear partial differential equation. Finally, possible applications of the method to the isoperimetric problem are discussed.
content.title_en: Symmetrical procedures for the isoperimetric problem in symmetric spaces of noncompact type

content.text: Analysis of telemetry signals and radar feedback signals for reconstruction of orbital disturbances of interplanetary space probes using the simulated descent dynamics of the Huygens probe. The Cassini/Huygens mission is a joint venture between NASA and ESA with the aim of exploring the Saturn system. The present work has been carried out within the scope of the Doppler Wind experiment. The aim of the work was to develop a method for determining the resting position and amplitude of the set pendulum motion of the Huygens probe during the descent on the Saturn moon Titan. The available data are the Doppler frequency shift and the reception performance of the telemetry signal. In addition, the radar altitude sensor's back-scattering signal is provided. With the information of the telemetry signal, a deterministic approach and a stochastic approach were developed to determine the parameters of the shuttle motion, depending on whether the measurement data provided sufficient information about the movement, or whether there is a periodity of the movement.
content.title_en: Analysis of telemetry signals and radar feedback signals for reconstruction of orbital disturbances of interplanetary space probes using the simulated descent dynamics of the Huygens probe

content.text: Light deflection in the post-linear gravityal field of bounded point-like masses. The expression for light deflection takes a simple form, especially when the undisturbed light beam is perpendicular to the orbital plane of a binary system whose components have equal mass spread. content.title_en: Contributions to the development of a driver assistance system for parking operations

content.text: The choice of transport means in freight transport: an analysis of regulatory and price policy measures; 64 tables. The book explains, on the basis of a broad survey, the decision-making behaviour regarding the choice of transport means in freight transport. Since external costs are caused to a considerable extent by a sharp increase in transport demand in freight transport, transport policy must take specific measures to make this additional demand as environmentally sound as possible. Therefore, the EU and the Federal Government aim to shift traffic from road to alternative transport modes. This work analyses the determinants of the choice of transport means of transport of freight forwarders, in order to then determine the effect of certain regulations. For example, the impact of the truck toll on the choice of transport means is examined.
content.title_en: Choice of transport in freight transport : an analysis of regulatory and price policy measures; with 64 tables

content.text: Work against poverty: basics, historical genesis and empirical review of poverty trap theorem. It is repeatedly claimed that social welfare recipients decide against the inclusion of work because of lack of wage incentives and thus remain permanently in poverty (poverty trap theorem). Social policy reforms are increasingly based on "work against poverty" because of these fears. Ronald Gebauer examines in a first step historically-sociologically the view that work is the key to solving the poverty problem in modern societies. In a further step, the theoretical foundations of poverty trap theorem are discussed. But what about the reality of the poverty trap theorem? Most empirical studies prove that social welfare is predominantly of a short-term nature. Based on these results, a separate data evaluation of the Socio-Economic Panel (Social Assistance) is presented.
content.title_en: Work against poverty: basics, historical genesis and empirical review of poverty trap theorem

content.text: In the past decades, interest in p-conjugated polymers has been steadily increasing due to their optical, electrical and electrochemical properties. As materials for electronic and optical components, increased investigations have been carried out in aca-demic, as well as in industrial research laboratories. In the class of conjugated polymers, poly(para-phenylenvinylene) (PPV) has been established, as well as poly-acetylene (PA), poly(diacetylene) (PDA), poly(para-phenylene) (PPP) and poly(arylenethinylene) (PAE). Furthermore, polymers, with linear conjugated p-bindings, show interesting effects in the electroluminescence, photoluminescence and in the nonlinear optics, whose applicacy possibilities are reflected in the material science. These are used in light diodes, polymer lasers, as photoconductors or optical switching elements. It is not possible to retain the high-level of semiconductors and the high-level of polymers.
content.title_en: Synthesis and characterisation of novel poly(arylenethinylene) copolymers

content.text: Convexity properties of moment maps of real forms acting on Kählerian manifolds. It is X a compact contiguous Kähler manifold with a holomorphic effect of a complex reductive Lie group, so that the effect of the maximum compact subgroup U Hamiltonsch is, i.e. there is an impulse image for this effect. In the present work we look at projections of this impulse image on subspaces that are assigned to compatible real subgroups G of the above complex Lie group. In particular, we are interested in convexity properties of the image of this new picture. A main result is a convexity set in an integral projective case for any completed G-stable irreducible semialgebraic subsets of the projective space. As special cases we receive classic convexity sets from Guillemin-Sternberg and Mumford, as well as convexity statements for complex flag maniflies.
content.title_en: Convexity properties of moment maps of real forms acting on Kählerian manifolds

content.text: CRIC: context-based recommendation of unstructured texts in real-time environments: a method for determining the semantic proximity of text objects based on a heuristic asymmetric distance measurement. The idea of automatically connecting related texts to each other is not new. The solution approach presented in this work pursues two main objectives: to work automatically on the basis of unstructured texts and to support a high number of simultaneous accesses. It differs from other methods essentially by determining the semantic distance between the texts based on an asymmetric precalculated distance matrix. The relationships between unstructured text objects are established by means of a heuristic algorithm for the selection of characteristics independent of the national language. The resulting "wort cloud" is then used as a request parameter for the selection of suitable texts. The user is recommended to use the currently displayed text related to content. The processing speed of the procedure was analysed in the form of the runtime complexity of the algorithms. Over a period of 12 months, extensive practical tests were also carried out on the website of an industrial magazine, in order to present the quality of the recommendations to the editors manually.
content.title_en: CRIC: context-based recommendation of unstructured texts in real-time environments: a method for determining the semantic proximity of text objects based on a heuristic asymmetric distance measurement

content.title_en: Methods of action in social work: to develop an inclusive model

content.text: Shanghai XXL : Everyday life and identity in the field of extreme urbanization. Reform, opening and rapid globalization ensure an extreme developmental dynamic in Chinese metropolises. The most important thing is the ecdynamic space Shanghai: Here economic, urban, cultural and social change meet in a worldwide unique intensity. This study combines the diversely networked dimensions of urban change with the microperspective view of the young population on their own life world in a theoretical approach developed specifically for these new phenomena. This enables a holistic access to the space of the future.
content.title_en: Shanghai XXL : Everyday life and identity finding in the field of extreme urbanization

content.text: The geographical origin of pistachios is proven by the stable isotope ratios. In the worldwide pistachio trade there is always a distortion, because Iranian pistachios are relabelled and sold as more expensive American goods or American pistachios are added. This not only deceives the consumer according to §11 of the LFGB, but also endangers his health. Iranian and Turkish pistachios must be examined by law before importing into the EU for their aflatoxin load, because it is often too high, while American pistachios are not subject to any obligation to demonstrate. However, food monitoring has not yet been available to determine clearly the origin of pistachios and the labelling can be checked. In this work, a discriminant model is presented which, with the help of IRMS measurement technology, provides a clear authentication of pistachios from the three main production countries Iran, USA and Turkey.
content.title_en: Detection of the geographical origin of pistachios by the stable isotope ratios

content.text: The constitutional protection of habilitation by Article 5 para. 3 p. 1 GG : can the legislator abolish the habilitation?. The work deals with the question raised by the introduction of the junior professorship regarding the constitutional protection of habilitation by Article 5 III 1 GG. The focus is on the objective basic rights of Article 5 III 1 GG. It is fundamentally discussed whether Art. 5 III 1 GG contains an institutional guarantee of academic self-administration and the matter of habilitation is to be assigned to the core area of academic self-government. Furthermore, the importance of the standard of value determining the protection of habilitation contained in Article 5 III 1 GG is examined. In this regard, the role of habilitation as a prerequisite for the appointment of the professor on the one hand and as a qualification procedure for the young scientists on the other hand is differentiated between the function of habilitation as a prerequisite for the appointment of the professor on the other hand (HoF/Text adopted)
content.title_en: The constitutional protection of habilitation by Art. 5 para. 3 p. 1 GG : can the legislator abolish the habilitation?

content.text: Numerical and experimental investigation of phase transition materials to reduce high summer room temperatures. Modern office architecture with rooms in lightweight construction and large transparent fassa-densorings strengthens the problem of summer overheating in buildings in conjunction with high internal loads. Phase transition materials (PCM: phase change materials) represent an interesting way to reduce summer overheating in buildings without complex plant technology such as air conditioning systems. The thermal comfort in rooms equipped with a PCM plug can be significantly increased. The work investigates the application possibilities and optimization potential of a PCM plug in an experimental and numerical way.
content.title_en: Numerical and experimental examination of phase transition materials for the reduction of high summer room temperatures

content.text: Public procurement law in competition with the systems: an analysis of public procurement law across the legal boundaries. The open economic constitution of the Basic Law has a wide range of implications for public procurement. Marc Bungenberg analyses the constitutional, European and international law bases of the increasingly important public procurement law. (Source: Klappentext des Verlags).
content.title_en: Competition of systems: a cross-cutting analysis of public procurement law

content.text: Grammar skills for spelling rules? : Three German spelling dictionaries critically analyzed. Which spelling rules require less grammar skills of writers - the old or the reformed? Sabine Mayr examines the rule directories of three common old and new spelling dictionaries (Duden, 20th ed. 1991 and 22nd ed. 2000; Bertelsmann 1999) to determine which grammatical technical expressions they assume as known, where understanding problems lie and whether or how they can be solved (e.g. which grammar helps further). The comparison shows that with the reform the rule clarity has been improved somewhat.
content.title_en: Grammar knowledge for spelling rules? : Three German spelling dictionaries critically analyzed

content.text: Studies to calculate the fatigue strength of edge-layer hardened diesel injection nozzles. Existing methods and guidelines for calculating the fatigue strength of these diesel injection nozzles do not provide satisfactory results on their own. In various test series, the transfer factors relevant to the load cases here were quantitatively determined and the calculation suggestions selected from the published methods and guidelines were compared. Particular attention was paid to surface fineness, medium tension sensitivity, local hardness and absolute notch size. Based on the transfer factors, a calculation method was presented according to the local-elastic concept. The verification of their applicability using 11 independent test series provided satisfactory results, which are limited only by the scope of the experiment. Potentials for increasing the permissible maximum load were found in the surface condition, the insertion of lastin induced pressure stresses and for needle-hub-controlled injection systems in consideration of the actual operating load.
content.title_en: Studies to calculate the fatigue strength of edge-layer hardened diesel injection nozzles

content.text: The history of the e-mail: success and crisis of a mass medium. Millions of emails are going around the world every day. It is all the more surprising that the emergence of this medium seems to have happened by the way and has hardly been scientifically worked up. This study reconstructs the success story of the e-mail service and shows that technology can only be successful as a network of technical, social and cultural references. If this frame of reference changes without the technology reacting to it, it gets into a fatal crisis whose effects in the form of spam and phishing attacks we are trying to combat today.
content.title_en: The history of e-mail : Success and crisis of a mass medium

content.text: The promise of mobile freedom: the cultural and technical history of suitcase radio, walkman and mobile phone. At the beginning of the 21st century MP3 players, mobile phones or laptops function as constant companions of the human being. However, already before numerous electronic devices found their mobile place as "portables" in transport and clothing bags or directly on the body. Their location-independent use changed ideas about private and public and relations with body, technology and identity. Based on the product culture and appropriation history of suitcase radio, cassette recorder, walkman and mobile phone, this volume analyses the new forms of technology use, social cooperation and mobility and thus puts the current debate about a "mobile revolution" in a historical perspective for the first time.
content.title_en: The promise of mobile freedom: to the cultural and technical history of suitcase radio, walkman and mobile phone

content.text: Computer Graphics : Aesthetic Experiments Between Two Cultures The Beginnings of Computer Art in the 1960s. "Computer Graphics" is an innovative contribution to the unwritten history of computer graphics in the 1960s. Against the background of C. P. Snow's "two cultures" discussion, a new form of generative and algorithmic art developed in the Stuttgart school around Max Bense, which marked the beginnings of digital computer graphics. Central theoretical and artistic concepts are discussed using the works of Frieder Nake, Georg Nees, A. Michael Noll and Manfred Mohr. Pioneering achievements, theoretical discussions and the references to contemporary art movements are systematically a
content.title_en: Computer Graphics : Aesthetic Experiments Between Two Cultures The Beginnings of Computer Art in the 1960s

content.text: Biomechanical analysis of the plane locomotion of Ancylometes Bogotensis (Keyserling, 1877) (Chelicerata, Arachnida, Lycosoidea). Spider legs are characterized by their arched configuration and are unique in the animal kingdom due to their hydraulic stretching mechanism&rsquo. Previously, spiders were considered to be stereotyped, velocity-independent step patterns and an essential role of the hydraulic mechanism in force generation. Global kinematics and single-leg floor reaction forces of the continuous and accelerated plane locomotion of the South American running spider Ancylometes bogotensis were investigated. In this process, three step patterns could be distinguished using discontinuous velocity dependencies of various kinematic parameters. The directions of the ground reaction forces vectors show that the hydraulic mechanism does not contribute significantly to the production of soil reaction forces either in continuous or accelerated locomotion.
content.title_en: Biomechanical analysis of the flat locomotion of Ancylometes Bogotensis (Keyserling, 1877) (Chelicerata, Arachnida, Lycosoidea)

content.text: The aim of this work was to identify and investigate ways of approximating the asset value of fund savings plans, typically offered by banks and insurance companies. It is of interest to approximate the distribution function, quantiles, accumulated expectation values and tail values at risk. Modelling the underlying securities price processes is, as usual, a geometric Brownian movement, whereby the asset value of a securities savings plan is structurally a sum of log-normally distributed random variables. However, it is known that the distribution of such a sum is not explicit; its simulation is of course possible, but whether the variety of savings plans to be managed by a bank or insurance is impractical. Again and again, one encounters work in which it is pointed out that the sum of log-normally distributed random variables are well represented by a one-dimensionally randomly distributed, but whether the multiplicity of a bank or insurance is impractical in the case of a variable of the same numerically variable of the result.

content.text: Library flirt: Library as a public space. Is the flirtation between two users meant or the flirtation with the library as a public space? The newly published book Library flirt:Library as a public space, deals with the question: Why do people go to the library or what happens in the interpersonal area when visiting a library. Are it really just the stocks and information services that people can draw into libraries? For too long we have only looked at the classical tasks of our institutions - and almost completely ignored a multitude of other functions that the place library has. However, in libraries there is no more clearly in the air than an "aura of learning" and the famous "psst"? For "Library flirt - Library as a public space" extensive conversations with library users and designers were conducted and documented. The result is a mosaic of human motivations to meet the classical performance requirements, but that they should also accept the design task, which is as if by themselves related to the chacteristic peculiarities of these institutions.
content.title_en: Library space : Library as a public space

content.text: The Budget Act as a time law: the importance of the time ties for the budget and public debt law. The Budget Act is a time law. It must be adopted at a certain time and is related to a certain period and limited in time. Annuality and precedence of the budget are classic budget principles, which have been brought into focus again by current constitutional decisions on the limits of the public debt. Henning Tappe analyses central issues of budgetary law. What legal consequences do retrospective budgetary laws and credit authorizations have? Can supplementary budgets be adopted after the end of the financial year and approve budget implementation? What effect does the separation required by the Basic Law have on the allocation of revenue and expenditure to a specific budget after years? (source: Verlag / Internet).
content.title_en: The Budget Act as a Time Act: on the importance of the time-limits for budgetary and public debt law

content.text: Optical method for two-dimensional measurement of angles and angular changes at large distances. In this dissertation, the development of a new measurement method and a new measuring device for two-dimensional measurement of angles and angular changes are presented on the basis of a concrete task from industrial production. Conventional methods already in use as well as alternative methods based on other physical principles are used and evaluated. A solution based on a so-called vignettizing field blind method is described in its principle structure and its functioning and the suitability for the task is examined. The theoretical foundations are initially presented purely geometrically-optically and in addition subjected to a light-technical examination with natural vignetation. The intensity distribution of the light spot in the image plane, the so-called V-SPOT, is determined by various influence variables analytically. Moreover, intensity and focus shift within the V-SPOT are investigated by means of effects such as geometrical-optical influences, beam characteristic of the object light surface as a function of the beam angle and light density distribution in relation to the field of the measurement.
content.title_en: Optical method for two-dimensional measurement of angles and angular changes at large measuring distances

content.text: The willingness to pay for value-added services in freight transport is shown in road freight transport in Germany. As part of the work, demand for value-added services for transport services in road freight transport within Germany is modelled on a cost minimisation calculation by companies and a method is developed which enables a construct derived from the modeled demand to be quantified in a similar way to that of the willingness to pay. The author develops a complex transport demand model based on the Discrete Choice analysis and allows explicit consideration of qualitative variables such as value-added services. By means of an internet-based survey of German shippers and forwarding companies, which are considered as potential demanders for value-added services, the model is then tested and first empirical results are determined on the willingness to pay for value-added services.
content.title_en: The willingness to pay for value added services in freight transport : shown on road freight transport in Germany

content.text: The BAT-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Etro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Electro-Etro-Etro-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-Et-E
content.title_en: Surface characterization of indium compounds as functional layers for (opto)electronic and sensoric applications

content.text: Validation of biomagnetic methods in isotropic and anisotropic volume conduction in a torsophantome. In this work the accuracy and reproducibility of biomagnetic methods were investigated. Biomagnetic measurements were carried out with a vector biomagnetometer on a realistic, complex, partly anisotropic torsophantome. Various detailed computer models were investigated. The reconstruction of a single dipole with simultaneous activity of other dipoles could be successfully carried out with a torsophantome. The RAP-MUSIC algorithm used could be successfully validated as a current method for source reconstruction. Circular and spiral-shaped currents were systematically investigated in different forms as a possible source for differences in magnetic and electrical data. It could be shown how the circular or spiral form affected magnetic flux density and electrical potential.
content.title_en: Validation of biomagnetic methods for isotropic and anisotropic volume conduction in a torsophantome

content.text: Control in organizations. How can control in organizations be theoretically adequately grasped? Theories of action use individual actors and social structures to explain (control) actions, system theory on social structures and interaction processes. Thus, according to the starting theory of the book, the theories leave one important aspect of the determination of social (control) action disregarded: the theory of action the determination by the ongoing interaction processes and the system theory the determination by the individual actor.
content.title_en: Governance in organisations

content.text: Innovation and cooperation: to organise a regional network. "Cooperation" has become the key concept of regional innovation capability. But how do you initiate cooperation between regional organisations if they do not recognize any reason for this? Traditional ideas about "suitable" cooperation partners prevent you from becoming unconventionally involved in existing actors - thereby giving innovation opportunities. In this case study, Karl Weick's organizational approach is used for the first time to analyse the development of a network-based cooperation. Among other things, it shows how the self-enhanced circles of institutionalized perspectives can break open.
content.title_en: Innovation and cooperation: to organise a regional network

content.text: On the complexity of modified instances. This dissertation examines the complexity of modified instances and how NP-complete problems behave stable under minimal change. We consider for various NP-complete problems whether knowledge of an instance solution can provide help in deciding a slightly modified instance. We also investigate to what extent modified instances can be efficiently decided if not only a solution of the unmodified instance is given, but more general indications, such as a polynomial long string. This question not only plays a major role in where NP-complete problems need to be solved quickly in dynamic situations, but also provides deeper insights into the general nature of the class of NP-complete problems. Furthermore, we consider the problem of reoptimization. This means that we investigate for various optimization problems whether a good solution can be found for modified instances of an optimization problem if an optimal solution of a similar instance is already known.
content.title_en: On the complexity of modified instances

content.text: The DNA-based DNA-based superstructure (bottomup) is a biomolecular component that allows precise (guided) integration of DNA into existing top-down microstructures and their subsequent functionalization (biomolecular). The use of compounded DNA superstructures (G-Wires) as a biomolecular component could be shown in addition to long DNA-molecular elements. The precise correlation characterization of the integrated structures during and after the integration steps enabled the optimization and establishment of the DNA-specifically integrated molecules to be achieved by means of dielectrophoresis. The integration of Lambda-DNA was transferred from the layer silicon to the substrate-drying of the substrate- and silicon. The strain-distillation of the sample-distillation is dependent on the concentration of the sample-distillation.
content.title_en: Targeted micro- and nano-integration of DNA and DNA superstructures in microstructured chiplayouts

content.text: The abbreviation PCC refers here to polymer modified cement concrete, i.e. mortar and concrete modified with plastics. This abbreviation has also been internationally established for this purpose. It refers to building materials that contain cement as well as plastics in addition to the mineral binder. Cement and plastic achieve a joint binder effect in the later mortar or concrete. Repeated object of damage is the failure of the bonding compound to other building substance. Since PCC is often applied as a thin protective layer on existing concrete, a failure of the adhesion sooner or later also leads to a failure of this protective function. Conversely, a failure of protection due to cracks in the PCC can also lead to the subsequent removal of the coating. In this case, the primary reason for this cohesive failure is the selection of false or non-conformative building material systems or simply processing errors. The aim of this work was to investigate the influence of the cohesive and adhesive properties of PCC on the continuous coating, in particular in the case of the coating.
content.title_en: Aspects of the Cohesive and Adhesive Properties of PCC

content.text: Integration of a neuro-sensor into a measuring system as well as investigations into unit separation. In the course of a dissertation at the University of Rostock, a novel CMOS (Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor) sensor chip was used for extracellular analysis of electrically active biological cells. Besides a MEA (Multielectrodenarray) this chip also has further FET (Field Effect Transistor)-based sensors for the detection of different cell parameters. In addition to the commissioning of this sensor external hardware for measurement data acquisition and algorithms for signal preparation were designed and realized. The aim was to create a Cell Monitor System (CMS) for the partial automatic use of the silicon-based sensor chip.
content.title_en: Integration of a neuro-sensor into a measuring system and investigations for unit separation

content.text: A temperature-dependent thermodynamic model for the H+ - NH+4 - Na+ - SO2-4 - NO-3 - Cl- - H2O system. Atmospheric aerosol particles play an important role in various air pollution issues. Inorganic components such as sulphate, ammonium and nitrate are an essential component of their mass, which are supplemented by sodium and chloride in the maritime planetary boundary layer. The effect of an aerosol depends on the phase state of the particles, their water content and the partitioning of volatile components between gas and particle phase. To determine these properties, a thermodynamic model is ...
content.title_en: A temperature-dependent thermodynamic model for the H+ - NH+4 - Na+ - SO2-4 - NO-3 - Cl- - H2O
