content.text: Bypassing of path-blocking proteins on microtubules into kinein-mediated cargo transport. Kinesins are microtubulus-associated motor proteins that convert the chemical energy of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) into motion energy to support intracellular transport processes. It is generally accepted that the kinesin movement along a single protofilament is the thermodynamic preferred transport mechanism. Kinesin-mediated transport into intracellular matrix is subject to complex mechanisms in which a variety of associated cell components or other proteins can interact with the motor proteins and limit their binding on the microtubulus surface. Ultimately this can lead to the succumbing of the transport processes. The present dissertation describes the transport of kinesin-complexed gold spheres along immobilized microtubuli, at whose surface block proteins are moving, which compete with the transporter protein for binding places were irreversibly bound to the binding point of the transporting rest of the kinein without the microtuus's interference was continued.
content.title_en: Bypassing of path-blocking proteins on microtubules in kinesin-mediated cargo transport

content.text: The seismicity of the upper crust of the earth - a topic with great social relevance - is largely controlled by brittle fracture processes. For these, there is no complete description of the energy conditions at this time. Results from energy considerations on a laboratory scale do not seem to be transferable to in situ conditions due to too low breakage energies. In the present work, new methods for geomaterials are used to investigate whether part of this difference results from the fact that cracking speeds in the laboratory - compared to natural earthquake processes - are usually low. For the first time in rocks, energy dissipation of current cracks is determined up to the maximum breakage speed. Overall, a significant increase in energy level results and valuable findings are obtained for the energy balance of the dissipative spread processes in rocks ...
content.title_en: Break energy of continuous cracks in rock

content.text: (Social) democracy as a builder : Town Hall construction of the 1960s and 1970s in the FRG and Essen. How many and which town halls were demolished and built in the Federal Republic between 1960 and 1980? And why did the city leaders then decide on these structural measures - changes that are often scourged today as "mistakes" or "alpine dreamlike"? - - - These questions answer the present book in detail. Based on the knowledge of the developments in 82 West German central and large cities, the author describes a town hall history in which the actors were first led by pragmatic, then ideological and finally pragmatic considerations. - - In particular, the book is directed to the readers of Essen. For the first time, the Essen town hall history, which is to be named, is told in the 1960s and 1970s, which has become one of the greatest myths of the city history.
content.title_en: (Social) Democracy as a builder : Town Hall construction in the 1960s and 1970s in the FRG and Essen

content.text: The design of the early design phases of distributed systems. With the rapid increase in the speed of electronic components, systems with increased complexity, networking and heterogeneity can be developed. This has led to the conclusion that development can only be achieved by teams of specialists. At the same time, development must be carried out in parallel to enable the early introduction of products. In the traditional design process, the design is therefore recorded in the form of a written specification of the overall system and then divided into several teams. This is done in the early design phases, which are characterized by high uncertainty about the product. In the development of the subsystems, assumptions and decisions must be made without estimating the influence on the overall system. Coupling effects are largely ignored. In the design approach Mission Level Design, many critical errors, in particular caused by coupling effects, can therefore be discovered first in the integration at the end of the development. Furthermore, an optimization of the overall system is not possible, since no overall system model exists. The traditional design process therefore has a high development risk. In the design approach Mission Level Design, a written specification is then a written specification of the overall design is optimized.
content.title_en: Contributions to the automation of the early design phases of distributed systems

content.text: The main communication of large-scale construction projects is via computer-generated architectural visualisation. On a journey through the digital "ArCAADia", spatial policies are observed, which find their real counterpart in current urban planning and urban policy as well as architectural planning.
content.title_en: Flanning in Arcaadia : digital architectural visualizations - analysis of an unnoticed image genre

content.text: Influencing pattern formation and localization through disorder. Grid gas simulations; Liesegang pattern formation; Fluctuations; Disorder; Metal-Isolator transition; Anderson transition; Small magnetic fields; Complex networks; Scale-free networks; Clustering The aim of this dissertation is to understand to what extent pattern formation and localization can be influenced by the introduction of disorder. The pattern formation is treated by grid gas simulations of Liesegang strip formation. Thermal fluctuations and homogeneous or inhomogeneous nucleation properties of the medium form the disorder parameters. Interestingly, the disorderization is reinforced or initiated pattern formation. In addition, it could be shown that a continuous modification of the inhomogenities of the substrate can be used to obtain equidistant distances of Liesegang strip at small length scales. Localization is discussed in the context of the Anderson model. Unordering is shown as a small magnetic or topologically complex network order of strain-freeness.
content.title_en: Influencing pattern formation and localization through disorder

content.text: Characterization of the Katkription factor CcpN from Bacillus subtilis. Katabolitrepression, the ability to switch off unnecessary alternative metabolic pathways in the presence of a preferred food source, is an important feature of CcpN. In Bacillus subtilis this task is taken on by, among other things, the transcription factor CcpN, which can compress for transcription of genes gapB, pckA and sr1. In the context of this work, the recently identified transcription factor was investigated in detail. It was shown that CcpN is occupying and co-binding on the three above-mentioned promoters respectively 2 operators. Furthermore, the molecular mechanism of repression by CcpN was clarified to the three above-mentioned promoters. CcpN was shown to bind together all promoters with the CcpN polymeral.
content.title_en: Characterisation of the transcription factor CcpN from Bacillus subtilis

content.text: Modelling impacts of climate change on water resources in the Volta Basin, West Africa. The Volta Basin is one of the largest river systems in Africa and covers an area of approximately 400,000 km2 with six West African states bordering it. The semi-arid to sub-humid regions of the Volta Basin are among the climate-sensitive areas of Africa. The population is largely dependent on rainland construction and therefore strongly influenced by the spatial and temporal variability of precipitation and its change due to climate change. Although the average water availability per capita of the population in the catchment area does not indicate a high water stress, there is a large gradient between the south of Ghana and the north of Burkina Faso. It is expected that deforestation, land degradation and high population growth along with global climate change will lead to a strong decrease in available water resources, so that the water demand of the increasing population cannot be satisfied. In the past, there have been extreme periods of drought, in which rivers and streams are very likely to increase due to flooding, on the other hand, to the fact that the currents and the floods are very dry.
content.title_en: Modelling impacts of climate change on water resources in the Volta Basin, West Africa

content.text: Methods of data mining in application to the flexibility attributes of automotive body construction for strategic investment planning. The concept of flexibility is always on the lips in the world of production, especially in the automotive industry. Increasing derivatives and fluctuations in the sales markets increase the call for flexible production systems.--- The primary problem associated with this is that the concept of flexibility is not clearly defined and accordingly a diffuse general understanding of flexibility exists. Furthermore, the factors describing flexibility and the associated investments are mostly unknown. Especially for automotive body construction, this paradox has been taken up in this work and flexibility in the form of investments has been made measurable.--- After an analysis of the general variant and flexibility management, flexibility can be divided into four areas based on the Kaluza scheme. These four areas or types of flexibility have universal validity and can always be used synonymously for other common terms ...
content.title_en: Methods of data mining in application to the flexibility attributes of automotive body construction for strategic investment planning

content.text: The cityscape in the upheaval: Public and Cologne buildings 1763 - 1814. Revolution and secularization triggered one of the greatest waves of loss in architectural history around 1800. At the same time, the view of historical buildings in the transition from the Enlightenment to Romanticism changed. The real upheaval and the new perspective are discussed in the example of Cologne, a city with rich architecture and multifaceted public. - - How the public discussion contributed to the protection of endangered buildings and their inventories, so the discussion of church and urban buildings offered important free spaces for political criticism. The present study describes the discussion of historical buildings in the example of Cologne. In the Middle Ages and at the beginning of modern times the largest city of Germany, the distance trade center and ecclesiastical metropolis, Cologne had a largely unique architectural stock. As a press city, seat of a university - and station of European educational travellers, Cologne was also a hub of national and international communication. Comparisons with Paris, Mainz and other cities complement the study. The study also exceeds what otherwise happens rarely, the Zäsuren 1789/1799 and compares Enlightenzeit, Revolution decade and Napoleonic era - the facets of insight- and the differenti- and the interpretation- the historical- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the interpretation- the
content.title_en: Cityscape in a change : Public and Cologne buildings 1763 - 1814

content.text: Population and molecular genetic analyses of persistent right aortic arch and primary cataracts in the German Pinscher. German Pinscher, cataract, hereditary. - The German Pinscher is a traditional dog breed, which has common roots with the Dobermann Pinscher, the dwarf pinscher, the monkey pinscher, the dwarf schnauzer, the standard Schnauzer and the giant schnauzer. The first figures of the breed are found in a book from 1884. In the middle of the 20th century the breed was strongly decimated by the consequences of the two world wars and had to be completely rebuilt. Werner Jung took over this task by searching the country for the few remaining, as racially as possible, pinschers and then crossing them with four particularly large dwarf pinschers. Most German Pinschers today are descendants of these few dogs. As a consequence of this, the modern German Pinscher has a relatively small gene pool, a fact that requires special attention in terms of possible race-specific diseases. The increasing knowledge of prevalence and pathogens of these diseases requires to reduce the incidence of these diseases of the new breeds and of the population.
content.title_en: Population and molecular genetic analyses of persistent right aortic arch and primary cataracts in the German Pinscher

content.text: Studies on the protective influence of various feed additives on gastrointestinal and systemic colonization with Salmonella enterica after experimental infection in broilers. Salmonella, probiotics, poultry. - The use of probiotic feed additives is an approach to reduce the entry of Salmonella into the food chain. Salmonella often do not produce clinical symptoms in broilers and infections are therefore often not detected. However, the consumption of contaminated food of animal origin leads to salmonella-free in the consumer, which is expressed in a partly severe enteritis. The aim of this study was to test various feed additives in animal experiments with a view to reducing the salmonella colonization of the intestine and internal organs of broilers infected with Salmonella enterica. For this purpose, five different probiotics and buttolic acid glycoside were tested. All of the products used in this study were previously tested in a live-test in vitro screening procedure against Salmonella-infected before and after the chicks were taken on the 13th day of life using Salmonella-glyceride.
content.title_en: Investigations on the protective influence of various feed additives on gastrointestinal and systemic colonisation with Salmonella enterica after experimental infection in broilers

content.text: Innovative XUV and X-ray plasma spectroscopy to explore warm dense matter. In summary, the present work is dedicated to research into defined conditions of warm dense matter. This knowledge is of outstanding importance for laser fusion research, research into high density material conditions, as well as a wide range of astrophysical-relevant questions in plasma research. This work shows innovative methods of production and characterization of warm dense matter. This non-balance-state between cold solid-coeorper and ideal plasma is generated by experiments with high energy density. Its properties were studied with high precision. The generation of a defined state of warm dense matter with the help of optical short-plus lasers of high intensity is challenging. High-energy electrons from a small, hot plasma on the target front heat the cold matter by shock ionization. High spectral and rapid resolution are necessary to avoid different plasma substances. The author uses highly radiation-deplenishing lines.
content.title_en: Innovative XUV and X-ray plasma spectroscopy to explore warm dense matter

content.text: Environmental certificates as economic control instruments and their impact on small and medium-sized enterprises: a comparative study of the controlability of land sealing and water use in Germany and the USA. The starting point of the paper is the political requirement for the reduction of land sealing and water use in Germany. This ecological goal is implemented by the creation of an economic model for the control of land sealing and water use on the basis of environmental certificates. Starting from an empirical survey on existing environmental governance in the USA and Germany as well as model theory approaches in the literature, a separate economic control model is gradually developed on the basis of tradable environmental certificates. The plant is thus internationally and interdisciplinary at the interface between ecology, economics and legal science. The pre- and post-supposing effect of the control model has been particularly important for SMEs in the context of the area recycling of former farm areas as well as for the municipalities with regard to the degradation of the industrial area overhang. Against this background, the control model can be considered as an appropriate balance between the politically pre- and post-supposing quantity limitation, the interests of SMEs and the municipalities on the one side, and the preservation of the economic management of the environment as an environmental policy.
content.title_en: Environmental certificates as economic control instruments and their impact on small and medium-sized enterprises: a comparative study of the taxability of land sealing and water use in Germany and the USA

content.text: System management algorithms for distributed vision networks. Smart camera networks, distributed algorithms for camera alignment, interaction between users and smart cameras. - Smart camera networks, distributed algorithms for camera alignment, interaction between users and smart cameras

content.text: Sustainability theory: legal, ethical and political approaches - using the example of climate change, resource scarcity and world trade. Sustainability calls for sustainable and globally sustainable life forms. In terms of resource and climate protection, politics and law have so far been little successful. The transdisciplinary habilitation paper analyses and integrates legal, political, social, economic and ethical discourses and critically challenges them. It develops a basic philosophy including a problematisation of growth thinking and the widespread vague sustainability concepts. Furthermore, the work provides an analysis of the causes of non-sustainability in politics, companies and in individuals as well as possible transformation processes. Furthermore, the author develops a legal and ethical justice, human rights and institutional theory of sustainability. In addition to a cost-benefit/balance theory and an analysis of "voluntary" potentials in business, civil society and in the individual, governance concepts for more sustainability are analyzed nationally, European and globally. In particular, the climate protection law de legta and de lege ferenda is deepened and critically examined, but resource and WTO law also find closer attention.
content.title_en: Sustainability Theory: Legal, ethical and political approaches - using climate change, resource scarcity and world trade as examples

content.title_en: Surface active molecules for controlling surface properties

content.text: OFDM-based MIMO channel measurements with different antennas. The present work deals with the measurement and evaluation of radio channels of modern multi-antenna radio systems (MIO) (multi-input multiple output, MIMO for short). Here, MIMO transmissions are carried out in the interior of an aircraft and an ordinary office environment. Based on some characteristics of the radio channel, the influence of the aircraft cabin on the MIMO radio transmission is evaluated in comparison to the office environment. The radio channel is determined in the frequency range using pilot sequences and the Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDM). The MIMO system used is presented in detail. Afterwards, the algorithms used are examined and techniques for reducing the Crest factor in MIMO-OFDM systems are examined. The results of the channel measurements are presented and discussed. The work ends with a short summary of the results.
content.title_en: OFDM-based MIMO channel measurements with different antennas

content.text: The validity of the Jarzynski equation in quantum systems. The Jarzynski equation is part of a series of new theorems of non-balance thermodynamics. It is an equation that contains the second main proposition of thermodynamics, but goes beyond that. It also brings process sizes of equilibrium-remote processes into a new connection with equilibrium variables. However, especially in small systems, the question remains about the validity of the equation for the quantum case. Unlike classical systems, there is uncertainty here and there are very contradictory statements that are based on different definitions and quantum mechanical interpretations of the equation. Simple understanding-enhancing sample systems have so far been lacking. In this work two such sample systems are now considered and how the results differ from the classical results and which of the special properties of quantum systems have an influence on the result.
content.title_en: The validity of Jarzynski equation in quantum systems

content.text: Studies on the variability of diatoms in water of different trophies and their impact on the use of indications. The focus of this work was on the recording of the variability of diatoms species compositions in the presediment of North German lakes and their influence on the reconstruction of paleoenvironment variables based on transfer functions. In this work, a distinction was made between a spatial variability within and between the lakes and a temporal variability within a lake (seasonal and annual). Based on the results, new models were developed which led to a significant improvement in the prediction error of transfer functions.
content.title_en: Studies on the variability of diatoms in waters of different trophies and their effect on the use of indications

content.text: The Afghanistan operations of the Bundeswehr: Political decision-making process with escalation dynamics. This book deals with the German military operations in Afghanistan and investigates the political decision-making processes about these operations. It mainly asks how the German engagement could be escalated, which factors were decisive for this and how the relationship between politics and the military is determined in the political decisions. This book deals with the German military operations in Afghanistan and investigates the political decision-making processes about these operations. It mainly asks how the German engagement could be escalated, which factors were decisive for this and how the relationship between politics and the military is determined in the political decisions. Ulf von Krause is an economist, military economist and political scientist. As a lieutenant general of the Bundeswehr, he was most recently involved in a leading position in the preparation of German foreign operations.
content.title_en: The Afghanistan operations of the Bundeswehr: Political decision-making process with escalation dynamics

content.text: Intermediaries of Change: Innovations and their transfer in the field of education. What influences the transfer of innovation in the field of education and education? Inka Bormann explores how something hybrid like innovation can be precisely defined in theory and conceptual terms and empirically determined. In doing so, she takes a knowledge-analytic perspective and designs a model of discursive innovation that she develops and discusses against the background of educational governance research. The author thus contributes to the systematization and theoretical foundation of educational innovation research as well as to the study of governance in the field of education and education. Inka Bormann, Dr. phil. habil, is a research assistant at the Department of Education Science and Psychology at Freie Universität Berlin.
content.title_en: Interspaces of Change: Innovations and their Transfer in the Field of Education

content.text: Dynamic partial self-reconfiguration : quick modeling, simulation, and synthesis. In this work OSSS+R provides an approach to simplify the design of dynamically partially reconfigurable systems with FPGAs. Modeling is object-oriented and uses both polymorphic elements and the concept of virtual hardware. Here, the focus is on simple modeling and changeability than on maximizing the degrees of freedom in expression. The models can be simulated using a C/C++ library and SystemC. A synthesis at RTL level is described and demonstrated in parts by a tool called "Fossy" which is used to demonstrate the models produced in a cycle-specific manner in their time-behavior with the OSSS+R description. To evaluate the approach, the proposed design flow was applied to a model in C/C++ until execution on a FPGA prototyping platform. <dt.>
content.title_en: Dynamic partial self-reconfiguration : quick modeling, simulation, and synthesis

content.text: In this work, the influence of a fast, spatially and temporally defined change (up to the kHz range) of the polarization state of CO2 laser radiation (Dynamic Polarization DP) is investigated on the dynamic processes in the interaction volume of CO2 laser beam welding. The implementation of this method is based on a special arrangement of an interference laser radiation modulator (ILM-H) and a ? 2 unit, which enables the generation of a beam with constant total power but variable polarization state. Using the example of exemplar welding experiments on the materials Ck45, St37 and 22MnB5 (USIBOR) and on St37 using contrast materials with continuous performance up to about 3 kW, the expected DP effects were experimentally investigated and qualitatively explained by model assumptions and estimates. The arrangement of the ILM-H in double transmission is the basic prerequisite for the DP, which is based on other modulator types (z.B. electro-diagnosis).
content.title_en: Studies for laser beam welding with dynamic polarization

content.text: Urban ageing - residential groups of young age in Erlangen. Germany is getting older and older and the renaissance of urban housing forms also changes the demographic composition of urban housing areas. Old people are not affected by a rigid age delimitation based on a characteristic or a disciplinary definition. Rather, one becomes old due to the change and decline of competences, efficiency and reserves associated with increasing morbidity and the change in social roles. In this case, the reactions to changes are personal different. Despite flowing individual aging processes and age, it is necessary to define a study group, i.e. citizens who have reached the age of 60 years, belong to the group of the elderly. However, it is necessary to distinguish between the young aged 60-80 and the elderly aged (after the age of 80). The basis for delimiting is the often healthier, more powerful physical and mental condition as well as active lifestyle of the first group. In addition, the multimorbidity level is comparatively lower and the degree of self-competence higher. However, it cannot be assumed that a homogeneous group with fixed age limits is not used as a negatively as a whole, but as a part of the elderly person's living activity is influenced by the most often.
content.title_en: Urban ageing - residential groups of young age in Erlangen

content.text: The study shows a significant link between the organisation of building management and the costs incurred by the management of buildings, depending on the type of use. Between July 2006 and March 2007, all municipalities in MV with more than 10,000 inhabitants were investigated. Municipalities with an organisation close to the developed optimal model have only about half of the costs per square meter compared to municipalities with a poor organisation.
content.title_en: Interactions between organisation and costs of management of municipal buildings

content.text: Quantification of the effects of road traffic on particle and nitrogen oxide emissions. In the context of frequent exceedance of the emission limits for particulate matter and nitrogen dioxide, restrictive measures are often planned and implemented for urban road transport, which is considered to be a major cause of the pollution caused by these pollutants. This work deals with the effects of traffic control measures, which can influence traffic flow, traffic demand and traffic composition. However, quantification of the immission-related effects of the mentioned traffic parameters is difficult: Today's models are difficult due to the complex effects of the interactions, but also due to the uncontaminated and time and/or spatially highly aggregated inputs, often deviations from measured values in the range of 20 to 40 percent. Therefore, an optimal selection of measures and measures by dynamic, environmentally dependent traffic management is only possible in the context of the research project AMONES - application and analysis of model-based network management procedures in urban networks, ...
content.title_en: Quantification of road traffic effects on particulate and nitrogen oxide emissions

content.text: The influence of two progesterone-release preparations (PRID®alpha, CIDR®) on the synchronisation of the recipient animals in the context of an embryo transfer program in cattle. Synchronisation, progesterone, embryo transfer. - The aim of this work was to investigate the influence of two progesterone-release preparations (PRID® alpha spiral and CIDR® span) on the endometrial of the recipient animals and the influence of the medication duration on the progesterone level, the synchronization success, as well as the pregnancy rates according to ET. For this purpose, a total of 104 heifers of the breed German Fleckvieh were synchronized at the recipient animal station Brandhof of the Neustadt/Aisch e.V. insemination. Group 2A 11 animals (synchronisation by PRID spiral, medication duration 8 days), group 1B 34 animals (synchronisation by CIDR span, medication duration 8 days), group 2A 11 animals (synchronisation by PRID, medication duration 9 days) and group 9 days were administered by 4 days.
content.title_en: Influence of two progesterone-release preparations (PRID®alpha, CIDR®) on the synchronisation of the recipient animals in the context of an embryo transfer programme in cattle

content.text: The insulin sensitivity and insulin response of the patient following a long-term supplementation of conjugated linoleic acids in lactating dairy cows. Insulin resistance, CLA, cows. - Conjugated linoleic acids (CLA) used in milk cows in the form of supplemental feed are considered to be significant in the pathogenesis of metabolic diseases such as increased lipomobilisation, ketosis and liver fat loss. The hyperinsulinemic euglycaemic glucose clamp (HEC) is the gold standard for demonstrating insulin resistance. It allows the distinction between decreased insulin sensitivity and decreased insulin response when successive, increasing insulin infusion concentrations are used, however, the HEC is between its high cost and labor burden for the patient. Therefore, in the same way as in the human population, the number of insulins in the patient population is not appropriate for the same treatment.
content.title_en: Insulin sensitivity and insulin response after long-term supplementation of conjugated linoleic acids in lactating dairy cows

content.text: The effect of system support on political participation: a comparative analysis of Western democracies. How does the support of the political system by the members of society affect their political participation? So far, research literature has assumed that people with a strong support of the political system use more written political forms of participation, while people with a low support use rather unwritten political forms of participation. Dominik Allenspach argues that the effects are u-shaped. This means that people with a strong and low support of the political system use unwritten political forms of participation, while people who are indifferent to the political system do not participate politically. The author has examined the existence of these effects for various Western democracies. The results show that the effects of the support of the political system on the various forms of political participation are primarily u-shaped, but in some cases also inversely u-shaped.
content.title_en: The effect of system support on political participation: a comparative analysis of Western democracies

content.text: University didactics of futurary research. With a lead by Prof. Dr. Gerhard de Haan Victor Tiberius teaches and researches as a postdoc in the field of strategic management at the University of Potsdam. Future research explores possible and probable futures, evaluates desirable and avoidable future scenarios and discusses options for future design. Since the 1960s, corresponding courses have existed worldwide. The didactic examination of university teaching in the field of futurary research is still at the beginning. Victor Tiberius analyses the study programmes that exist worldwide, evaluates interviews with lecturers and develops his own didactic concept (teaching objectives, content, methods, media and learning success control) for the study of the future. The book is aimed at futurary researchers in research, teaching and practice as well as university didactics.
content.title_en: Higher Education Education in Future Research

content.text: Search for Supersymmetry in single-lepton final states with the ATLAS detector and Improved background model for the search of new physics. Summary: This dissertation presents the author's contribution to the search for supersymmetric particles in end states with exactly one high-energy leptone, caused by proton-proton collision at the ATLAS experiment of the Large Hadron Collider. In addition, a new method for improving the subsurface models in a search for new physics is presented.
content.title_en: Search for Supersymmetry in single-lepton final states with the ATLAS detector and Improved background model for the search of new physics

content.text: The class library is being updated to the class library. The increasing cost pressure in Germany has also reached the health care system in recent years, so that all existing processes, taking into account quality and cost characteristics, are being made available to the process management. The modeling of processes in the target domain medicine is being supported by the class library to be developed, which, according to a fixed structuring principle, provides the domain-specific process steps for the modeling of concrete clinical processes. The modeling of the class library is being carried out using an adapted modeling cycle. In the first phase, the analysis, the specificities of the domain medicine are being elaborated. Building on the analytical results, the formalized requirements in the innovator are being implemented in the conception. Based on the central root class MoBimeP, the separation is being made between process steps and organizational units, by means of a formalization relationship to the class organization. The implementation of the class model is being completed by the phase-modeling of the class-model.
content.title_en: Development of a class library for modelling medical processes

content.text: Preparative and mechanistic studies of the titanmatically modified hydroaminoalkylation of alkenes. Intramolecular hydroaminoalkylation of alkenes were successfully performed in the presence of various ti-catalysts. For the first time, secondary aliphatic amines were successfully applied in intermolecular hydroaminoalkylation of alkenes. Kinetic studies of the reaction of a 1-amino-6-heptens provided detailed information on the reaction mechanism of the hydroaminoalkylation of alkenes.
content.title_en: Preparative and mechanistic studies of titanbatalysed hydroaminoalkylation of alkenes

content.text: Strain field and strain engineering in semiconductor nanostructures: coherent X-ray diffraction imaging and analytical studies. Summary: In special magneto-optical electronic materials, such as Ga1-xMnxAs, the electronic and magnetic properties are set by the concentration of the charge carrier determining component, here by the Mn. However, changes in the chemical composition also lead to a change in the system order. An excellent way to approach this problem is to use external electrostatic fields to obtain a doping effect without changing the composition. This approach not only allows for a development of novel components but can also be used to investigate quantum phenomena, since the basic state in such systems can be controlled. Epitactic nanostructures are suitable candidates, since they allow the required quantum inclusion. Therefore, an elastic grid tension due to a grid mismatch can be used to influence the observed quantum effects. Ga1-xMnxAs is currently of great interest for the magnetic field isotropic anisotic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic angionic ani.
content.title_en: Strain field and brain engineering in semiconductor nanostructures: corent X-ray diffraction imaging and analytical studies

content.text: Drug use and control : To establish a social problem in the first third of the 20th century. Widespread drug use is seen in the populist and scientific image of the Weimar Republic: It is called that in the 1920s a 'drug wave' of Germany had overrun. Annika Hoffmann shows how, at the beginning of the 20th century, the interpretation of non-medical consumption of opiates and cocaine became established as a social problem and what consequences this has for consumers. The author deals intensively with historical sources and shows how the hegemonic view of drugs developed today and what conclusions are drawn from the problematizing discourse of contemporary people.
content.title_en: Drug use and control: establishing a social problem in the first third of the 20th century

content.text: New experimental designs on natural materials in chemistry lessons: chemistry with mushrooms. Jan-Markus Teuscher presents his dissertation thesis on a curriculum development work that has developed as widely as possible and attractive new experimental possibilities for chemistry lessons based on the extremely interesting fungi in chemical terms, in order to promote interest and motivation of the pupils for this subject. The introductory chapters include a brief overview of the biological-mycological basics, a more detailed summary of the knowledge on the chemistry of fungi and a summary and evaluation overview of the already published works on the topic of fungi in biology and chemistry lessons. The experiments described in detail in the main part of the work were tested by students and students. The experiment sets were compiled in a richly illustrated hand-out for teachers and students, the material volume, and can be used directly in chemistry lessons and in cross-disciplinary projects.
content.title_en: New experimental designs on natural materials in chemistry lessons : Chemistry with mushrooms

content.text: The CbfA mutant JH.D has a failure of the multicellular development. The expression of CbfA in a low-copy situation has caused a healing of the phenotype, which is why this system could be used to obtain evidence of the functions of individual CbfA domains by expression of mutated CbfA proteins. However, the catalytic activity of the JmjC domain was not essential for the mediation of the multicellular development by CbfA. The replacement of a histidine preserved in CbfA by alanine in the first zinc finger motif or the deletion of both zinc fingers caused a functional loss of the CbfA protein. However, the complementation of the CbfA suppression strain with CbfA, the mutations in the area of the AT hook, led to the development of the multicellular development.
content.title_en: Function of the transcription factor CbfA in Dictyostelium discoideum

content.text: Violence in domestic relations : Social science and evolutionary biology positions in discourse. Under careful consideration of the respective paradigmatic conditions, Ingrid Kaiser for the first time in this interdisciplinary study presents systematic relationships between social science and evolutionary biology between violence in couple relations and parent-child relationships. Using the biological-functional theory offer, she discusses the conditions of the emergence of violence in domestic relations in an extended theoretical framework and presents new approaches to explaining previously contradictory empirical findings.
content.title_en: Violence in domestic relations : Social science and evolution-biological positions in discourse

content.text: The influence of fragmentation and isolation on the population biology and diaspore bank of lime-magerrases (Mesobrometum erecti) in south-west Germany. Four species were selected to study the effects of fragmentation and isolation on species of lime-magerrases, whose fitness was represented by the study of six parameters. It was found that the germination rate in all investigated lead species significantly increases with increasing population size and the germination density in the open-air area in two species. In all other fitness parameters only few significant results were found. The studies in the present work show that species-specific reactions to the changes in relevant parameters such as the population size are of great importance for the survival of a species. The results of the diaspore bank studies confirm the statements from the literature that the predominant number of typical lime-magerra species is not able to build a permanent diasporen bank. It means that species-rich lime-magerrases for their survival depend on a permanent diasporen replege from the current vegetation. <d.>
content.title_en: Influence of fragmentation and isolation on population biology and diaspore bank of lime-magerratic (Mesobrometum erecti) in South West Germany

content.text: The evolution of the vocals of acrocephalinae (Hippolais, Acrocephalus and Chloropeta) with the inclusion of phylogeny and morphological, ecological and social factors. Acoustic signaling is a central mode of behaviour of acrocephalinae. Their vocals exhibit an enormous variety with considerable inter-art variation. To what extent this vocal variation is more due to adaptive adaptations to morphological, ecological or social factors or to homologous development through phylogeny, is not investigated as much as the complex interaction of these factors. To examine this question, I identified the vocals according to various vocal characteristics, and then compared them with the above factors and corrected the result phylogenically. It shows an unequal influence of the factors on the vocal characteristics. The most important influence have the phylogeny and sexual selection. Through the increased sexual function of the vocals in attracting acrocephalinae these differ in repertoire size and singing place from non-tracting species. The hitherto assumed complexity of the social size and frequency of the vocal systems on the one hand, disappear.
content.title_en: Evolution of the vocals of acrocephalinae (Hippolais, Acrocephalus and Chloropeta) including phylogeny and morphological, ecological and social factors

content.text: Interaction of amino acid with different ionogenic groups. The subject of this work is the study of the amorphous silica gel and the mesoporous silicatic MCM-41. The focus was on determining the influence of the structure of the silicate as a starting material on the properties of the material produced, on the synthesis and on the efficiency of the product in catalytic and adsorption applications. To achieve the above-mentioned goal, the modification of the amorphous silica gel and the MCM-41 was carried out. The silization method was chosen for this purpose. Another important objective of this work was the examination of the adsorption of amino acids from aqueous solutions on the starting materials and modified silicates to determine the influence of the structure of the starting material as well as the built-in functional layer on the adsorption of the biologically active molecules. The type of interactions that took place in the system "Adsorbate - silicatic adsorient".
content.title_en: Interaction of amino acids with different ionogenic groups

content.text: Impact of motif content on dynamic function of complex networks. Network motif; Network analysis; Rail transport; Phase synchronization; Social networks; Motiv theory; Zero model network motif; Network analysis; Train transport; Phase synchronization; Social networks; Motif theory; null model The pattern of over- and under-representation of small subgraphs has become a standard method for characterizing complex networks and evaluating the influence of a mesoscopic organizational level on the function of a network. This work deals with a number of network-based systems with the focus on motives. First, an analytical prediction of the number of subjects and fluctuations is introduced. It is used to predict the characterization of motive signatures resulting from unusual graph properties. We also discuss artifacts that arise from incongruences between the network and its zero model. In a model of social dynamics we show that successful and unsuccessful agents have systematic local after-motivatedness. In law enforcement networks, the most important of these connections are systematically related to the replication of a connection.
content.title_en: Impact of motif content on dynamic function of complex networks

content.text: The landscape development in German and Japanese middle mountains - examples from the Black Forest and the Harima region. The cultural landscape is characterized by the interplay between the natural conditions and sociocultural influences. The central mountain landscapes in Germany and Japan leave the impression that there are several perspectives of a certain similarity. This was the starting point of the research. To examine this impression and to understand commonalities and differences between the landscapes, a comparative cultural landscape analysis was carried out. Methodically, the historical landscape analysis and empirical social research were combined. The aim of the research was to compare cultural landscapes in different (world) regions by analysing the individual components of the landscape. Through a comparative analysis, commonalities and differences between you were recorded. Subsequently, the regional typical manifestations were elaborated. The aim of the research was to compare cultural landscapes in different (world) regions by analyzing the individual components of the landscape.
content.title_en: Landscape development in German and Japanese low mountains - examples from the Black Forest and the Harima region

content.text: Written locational regulations in arithmetical education: an examination using the example of content-related competences. For some years now, it has been required to align mathematics teaching to individual competences and deficits of the pupils. In order to implement this demand in the teaching reality, it must be concretely specified in terms of subject and content. Julia Voßmeier takes up the concept of so-called locational regulations and examines how the knowledge gained through written locational regulations on individual learning levels can be used both by the teachers and by the pupils in the teaching and for the further learning process. Based on an examination with 600 pupils from the school years 2 to 4 and their teachers, it shows that the potential of the locational regulations were recognized, but not always exhausted.
content.title_en: Written locational provisions in arithmetical instruction : an examination using the example of content-related competences

content.text: Commuting calculation of permanent magnet-excited commutator motors of small power. In this work a method for calculating commutation of permanent magnet-excited commutator motors (PM-DC motors) is presented. Furthermore, the basics of the current turn and the factors affecting them are discussed. In the context of the work, a summary of the most important methods for measuring and evaluating commuting are also taken, as these investigations are still highly relevant for small machine development. The methods are explained using concrete examples and evaluated with regard to effort and their significance and used for validating the new calculation approach. The analysis of known calculation methods on their suitability and limits completes this complex.The new simulation approach for a complete drive system can be used to analyse the current turnaround in all operating states. The model description includes the influence of the magnetic circuit, the control system, the drive mechanism and the contact system brush-commutator. The creation and parametrization of the drive models is discussed with the specific characteristics of PM-DC motors of small power.
content.title_en: Commuting calculation for permanent magnet-excited commutator motors of small power

content.text: Toxicological and immunological effects of DON and LPS at the intestinal barrier. DON, LPS, Using Chamber technique. - The aim of this study was to investigate the effects of in vivo-infused DON-containing feed, directly in vitro-applied DON and in vivo intraperitoneally-administered LPS on short-circuit currents and tissue conductivity in the small intestine of growing pigs. In addition, in vitro measurements were carried out on DON transport via intestinal epithelium and an assessment of the immunological effects of DON and LPS, in which the stimulation of cytokines secretion was quantified in vivo. The study was conducted in two series. In the first series, sections from the duodenum, the mean jejunum and the ileum of six pigs were used to quantify the in vitro effects of DON in various concentrations on the short-circuit and tissue conduction of the intestinal epithelium in an...
content.title_en: Toxicological and immunological effects of DON and LPS at the intestinal barrier

content.text: In the study of betamethason and triamcinolonacetonide, the pharmacokinetics of betamethacone and triamcinolonacetonide after intraarticular administration of the triamethacone in the equine population were determined. The aim of this work was to optimize and validate a HPLC/MS/MS method for quantitative analysis of betamethacone and triamcinolonacetonide from horse urinary and plasma, as well as to determine pharmacokinetic parameters based on the conduct of pharmacokinetic studies after intraarticular administration of various corticosteroids in the equine population. At the current level of doping analysis, the validation was carried out using the parameters selectivity, linearity, detection limit, precision, accuracy, stability and reinvention. The method presented was shown to be all the criteria used and thus appropriate for the determination of triamocone in the gastrointestinal population.
content.title_en: Pharmacokinetics of beta-methasone and triamcinolonacetonide after intraarticular administration with regard to doping relevance in horses

content.text: The quality of game meat is determined by the circumstances during the killing and supply, as well as by the handling of wild boar meat and deer meat throughout the ripening and storage period, up to processing. The current EU food law states that game bodies must be cooled down to no more than +7 ʿC within a reasonable time after killing from large game animals. Furthermore, meat from large wild game may only be placed on the market if the game body has been transported to a wild game processing plant as soon as possible. Unlike the previous law with precise time information, game laid down in the ceiling according to § 10a of the replaced meat hygiene regulation at +7 ʿC for up to 9 days and at +1 ʿC for up to 17 days and is transported to a wild game processing plant, the current law situation is determined as soon as possible, making the interpretation more difficult. The present study should ensure the elimination of the storage of new species in the context of the re-explanation of the species.
content.title_en: Series examination for the maturation and microbiological status of wild boar meat and deer meat

content.text: The work summarizes insights into the controlled charging of electric vehicles (EVs) at volatile wind feed. Based on state-of-the-art technology for the controlled charging of EVs, two operating procedures are shown based on the development of methods for exchanging information between EV and charging point for the negotiation of charging operations. The Wind 2 Vehicle (W2V) method is an example of the use of controlled charging of EVs to realize a renewable feed-in demand. The Local Load Management (LLM) is an example of using information from the distribution network to temporally limit the charging power of EVs. In a case study, fifty EVs are controlled by a reduced W2V approach. A second case study shows that controlled and uncontrolled charging can lead to injuries of defined limit values in distribution networks, and that small operating limits are still set without low reduction of the charging target.
content.title_en: Influence of controlled charging of electric vehicles on grid operation at volatile wind power supply

content.text: Development of new group 4 catalysts for hydroaminating and hydroaminoalkylation of alkenes and alkines. In the context of this work, new ligands for group 4 metal complexes were synthesized, which are used in hydroaminating and hydroaminolkylation of alkenes and alkines. The metal complexes were used in alkenic and alkinic hydroaminization. As a ligand class ß-enaminones were synthesized. Various crystal structures of these metal complexes could be determined by means of X-ray structure analysis. After modification of some ß-enaminones, further ligands could be obtained. A catalyst system was developed, which enables the alkin hydroaminization. In this process, the Zr catalyst was transferred to sulfonamides. In addition, the catalytic capability of the complex [Cp2Zr(NMe2)2] was further investigated. In cooperation with the Beckhaus working group, further metal complexes were tested for their activity. <dt.

content.text: Novel ic esters from cellulose and dextran: synthesis, structure analysis and properties. The aim of the work was to synthesise new water-soluble aminogroup containing cellulose and dextrancarboxylic acid esters under homogeneous reaction conditions. The ring-opening reaction of N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone (NMP) in the presence of p-toluene sulfonic acid chloride resulted in the chlorides of cellulose-4-[N-methylammonium]butyrate (with average substitution degrees, DS, from 0.31 to 1.04), hydroxyethylcellulose-4-[N-methylammonium]butyrate (with DS values from 0.28 to 0.98) and dextran-4-[N-methylammonium]butyrate (with DS values between 0.12 and 0.72). Cellulose-4-[N,N,N-trimethylammonium]butyrate chloride was produced by the conversion of cellulose with Ntrimethylmethyl and dimethyl-methyl-methyl-methyl.
content.title_en: Novel icationic esters from cellulose and dextran : synthesis, structure analysis and properties

content.text: The laser beam polish is designed to smooth the roughness profile of a quartz glass surface quickly, evenly and in a way. The laser acts independently of geometry, in the form of a fast subaperture tool. Various machining samples are polished by laser radiation, whereby the process parameters, the interactions between laser radiation and quartz glass as well as the evaluation of the results with regard to surface quality and influence of stresses and mechanical properties, the investigations and the development of an industrially usable laser beam polish process are supported. Experiment planning, implementation and evaluation are carried out using statistical methods. The temperature is monitored during the polishing with pyrometer and thermal imaging camera. The application areas of the process are, among other things, for polishing 2D and 21⁄2D components, tool mould mould inserts (plastic processing) and in parts of optical components.
content.title_en: Development of laser beam polishing process for quartz glass surfaces

content.text: Absentia in praesentia?: for the presentation and communication of digital media in physical space. One aspect of the increasing digitalization of library holdings and the virtualization of library offerings is the excellent master thesis by Janin Taubert "Absentia in Praesentia? For the presentation and communication of digital media in physical space." (Humboldt-Universität Berlin). When looking at libraries as physical spaces, their role as a learning place, cultural or social meeting place is often emphasized. Digital media offered are even more understood as an addition to the primary physical inventory in open questions, how they can be presented and conveyed in the library's premises and even further, whether the necessity of such a presentation in the library's space exists at all. In the master thesis, the visualization of per definitionem is now being examined for the first time in German space, which ideas, trends to the e-media presentation in libraries are realized. Resumingly, it is stated that, for example, the presentation by means of QR codes is seen as a necessary long-term task and in future, which is of importance.
content.title_en: Absentia in praesentia? : to present and convey digital media in physical space

content.text: The foreign exchange market is considered to be the most sales-oriented, liquid and technologically advanced financial market in the world. For example, foreign currency trading attracts a large number of highly professional market participants, who can react to market data changes in a very short time using modern electronic means of communication. This monograph focuses on the question whether this is actually the case with regard to newly published macroeconomic information, by analysing the ultra-high frequency response of the most important exchange rates of the US dollar in the second-range. To this end, a comprehensive presentation of the functioning of the foreign exchange market and the principles of exchange rate formation is provided. Further focus areas of content are information processing in financial markets, the concept of information efficiency and the event study methodology. The results of the empirical study complement the previous findings on news effects on foreign exchange markets, and shed light for the first time on the priceing of new information in the second-range.
content.title_en: Information efficiency of the foreign exchange market : an empirical study of the high-frequency exchange rate response to macroeconomic publications

content.text: The efficient processing of aggressive liquid materials, such as aluminium or copper, often requires knowledge of flow rates and the spatial distribution of the velocity field. It is the declared goal of the local lorentz force anemometrics to achieve this. In this case, the larentz force induced by the nearby flowing metal is measured on a small magnet. However, this force also affects the fluid and deforms the flow profile. In this work, the magnetohydrodynamic equations are used in quasistatic approximation, i.e. to determine whether they change the measurable force, were investigated by means of analytical and numerical methods. The simplest spatial variable configuration is chosen as magnetic field. In this context, the magnetohydrodynamic equations are used in quasistatic approximation, i.e. for small magnetic reynolds, by means of direct numerical simulation. Two dimensionless indicators are decisive: the hard man number Ha and the reynolds number Re. The laboratory analysis of the flow parameters is nevertheless usefully over-examined for the measurement parameters.
content.title_en: Magnetohydrodynamic duct flow in the presence of a magnetic dipole

content.text: Participation in society: People with disabilities between inclusion and exclusion. 'Participation in society' initiates the entire system of rehabilitation as a goal perspective and fundamentally changes the tasks of politics and social services. The book introduces from a sociological perspective into the general conditions of inclusion and risks of exclusion in modern society and concreteises them using the example of the situation of people with disabilities. Based on a detailed analysis and criticism of the welfare state models and concepts for the treatment of their special exclusion risks, new approaches of an effective gesture 'participation in society' initiates the entire system of rehabilitation as a target perspective and fundamentally changes the tasks of politics and social services. The book introduces from a sociological perspective into the general conditions of inclusion and risks of exclusion in modern society and concreteises these by means of the example of the situation of people with disabilities. Based on a detailed analysis and criticism of the welfare state models and concepts for the treatment of their particular exclusion risks, new approaches of an effective design of rehabilitation services are shown and discussed.
content.title_en: Participation in society: people with disabilities between inclusion and exclusion

content.text: The modern portfolio of waste management industry is the most important source of investment in renewable energy. The modern portfolio theory shows how the combination of assets that are subject to different and complementary risks leads to a reduction in the overall risk of investment returns on these assets. The theory, which is largely based on the principles of diversification, has been developed in the field of securities management. Given the significant differences between securities and physical assets, the work examines the limits of a theory that has been designed for financial assets when applied to physical investments such as wind farms. The Modern Portfolio of waste management industry in renewable energy sources, this work addresses the Modern Portfolio theory when applied to investments in wind farms.
content.title_en: The modern portfolio theory applied to wind farm investments

content.text: The role of microRNA-155 in innate immunity and immunopathology. Summary: In the last 10 years microRNA (miR) research has "exploded" and is now part of general education. Much effort has been made to investigate the biogenesis of these short RNAs. However, it is only little known about their physiological role. MicroRNA-155 (miR-155) is an inducible microRNA, which plays an important role in the regulation of the immune system. It has been shown that miR-155 deficiency leads to a malfunction of the adaptive immune system. These mice cannot establish memory cells as a result of infection. However, it is only little known about the role of miR-155 in the innate immune system. It has been shown that expression of miR-155 positively correlates with the inflammatory status of myeloid cells. In short, if the cellular inflammatory markers are highly regulated, the expression of miR-155 is also highly regulated.
content.title_en: The role of microRNA-155 in innate community and immunopathology

content.text: Analysis and diagnostic benefit of Interleukin-1 beta (IL-1ß) and the soluble interleukin-2 receptor alpha (sIL-2Rα) in dogs. IL-1ß, sIL-2Ra, dog, dog. - cytokines are increasingly becoming a focus when it comes to establishing reliable serological markers for the diagnosis of certain disease symptoms in dogs. Against this background, two previously little-considered cytokines in serum of healthy and diseased dogs were investigated in the present study. Cytokines are interleukin-1 beta (IL-1β) and soluble interleukin 2 receptor alpha (sIL-2Rα), which were determined by sandwich ELISA. The aim of the investigations was to determine the diagnostic importance of IL-1β in inflammatory events and of sIL-2Rα in the context of neoplasms and non-malignant international diseases. The results were already published (sIL-2Rβ, PRACH et al. 2013a) or as a result of the results of the study were summarized.
content.title_en: Analysis and diagnostic benefit of interleukin-1 beta (IL-1ß) and soluble interleukin-2 receptor alpha (sIL-2Rα) in dogs

content.text: The aim of this thesis is to present the information of the route and the information of the route. In several experiments in urban environments, the tactile navigation system was compared with existing navigation systems, and thereby measured performance and cognitive stress. <dt.> Visual and auditory displays composition each other in presenting turn-by-turn route information in conventional car navigation systems, but may results in driving activity and driving activity.
content.title_en: Supporting route guidance of car drivers with a tactile display on urban roads

content.text: Social policy between tradition and modernity: state regulations in the intersection of labour market integration and reproduction in Germany, France and Spain. The study asks about the explanatory power of traditions for the divergence of employment-related social policies. Based on a historical analysis of developments and traditional lines, it is shown by the example of Germany, France and Spain that different cultural traditions have developed here, which lead to a specific understanding. Based on the concept of secondary care arrangements, which is elaborated in the historical analysis, a categorization of contemporary regulations is carried out. In this process a theory of different modernization strategies is developed, which creates a basis for further research and, in particular, has a explanatory power for the diversity of regulations beyond the countries analysed; it thus provides an approach point to a culturally sensitive understanding in the field of social policy studies.
content.title_en: Social policy between tradition and modernity: state regulations in the intersection of labour market integration and reproduction in Germany, France and Spain

content.text: Nanoscopy for the structure clarification of DNA. The use of metallic or metal-coated measuring probes for scanning probe microscopy (SPM – engl. scanning probe microscopy) is the prerequisite for the combination with surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS – engl. surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy). Ideally, only the end-of-life metal nanoparticles are used for the amplification of the specific Raman information. Due to the low range of the evanescent field of the irradiated nanoparticle used for detection, extremely small areas can be investigated spectroscopically. In this case, single molecule sensitivity can be achieved, which is supported by the topographical information of the scanning probe micros. These properties of the TERS technology thus create the potential of the DNA sample for the analysis of individual DNA sequences.
content.title_en: Nanoscopy for structure reconnaissance of DNA

content.text: The present work was accepted as a dissertation by the Council of the Faculty of Law of the Friedrich Schiller University Jena in the winter semester 2013/2014. The author is dedicated to the question of which criteria a meaningful distribution of competences should be carried out. Using the example of water protection, the legislative competence system of the European multi-level system is examined whether the criteria of effectiveness, efficiency and subsidiarity are met. To this end, the first part of the work sets out concepts and concepts of water protection, multi-level system and competence. Based on these concepts and concepts, the second part analyses the national and European legal competences in the field of water protection and examines whether this competence system takes account of the requirements of water protection.

content.text: The German Migration Business is the topic of the German Migration Business: An empirical study of the choice of places of residence and work, the satisfaction and relocation of talents in German cities. From the introduction: Cities are located in an "interurban war for talent". Therefore, it is important for cities that follow the personal approach to know how to win this fight. They have to know which location factors and to what extent the location factors attract talented people and keep them at the current place of residence and work. I will answer this question in my dissertation project, with the focus of the work on the talents from the media industry. The main goal of the work is the analysis of the migration behaviour of workers in the media industry. This is accompanied by the identification of those factors that determine the choice of places of residence and work, the overall satisfaction and the relocation decision. As the employees of the cultural and creative industries in Germany in general and the media industry in particular are analyzed by the media industry in the cities, the four metropolises are considered to be of more than one million inhabitants. So those who are analysed in the context of the Hamburg, the work of the Munich and the German population.

content.text: Last-time consumer load management between the energy market and Smart Grid. The system change from conventional demand-oriented generation to supply-based consumption raises the question of a participation of private consumers, which played a decisive role in 2011 with a total share of 26% of the demand for electrical energy in Germany. The present paper examines the flexibility of the load of "private last-consumers" by means of variable tariffing and their application as a method in the Smart Grid system. In view of the state of research on technical and economic background, the question of integrating private last-consumers into grid operation is answered. To this end, flexible tariffs as well as smart metering are explained as prerequisites, as well as the grid development index (GDI) as a classification of the development stage of a smart grid are introduced. In a field trial, the theoretical findings are applied to a distribution network of a suburban small town in Germany. Based on the available real measurement data, it is then examined whether Demand Side Management, which relies on variable tariffs, meets the requirements of a smart grid in suburban and rural areas.
content.title_en: Last-time private consumer load management between energy market and smart grid

content.text: Planning and optimization of flow assembly systems: a contribution taking into account changing requirements for process reliability, product quality and flexibility. Originally, the design of assembly systems in the form of flow systems aimed at an evenly high number of parts of a single product with a high degree of automation. For reasons such as increasing requirements due to customer requests or sales changes, assembly processes are constantly adapted to the changed framework conditions. Such requirements have an impact on the structure and design of flow assembly systems. Thus, aspects such as redundancy, buffering and the integration of quality stations gain in importance when planning such systems. New methods are developed to improve the configuration and operation of post-processing loops, the converging or diverging and parallel structures. The developed structures have more advantages in terms of flexibility, redundancy, availability, utilization and buffer capacities compared to conventional structures.
content.title_en: Planning and optimization of flow assembly systems: a contribution taking into account changing requirements for process reliability, product quality and flexibility

content.text: The Europeanization of North Rhine-Westphalia's energy and climate policy: the reign of CDU/FDP from 2005 to 2010. In the present case study, Simon Wiegand examines the positions, strategies of influence and functions of state government and state parliament factions in North Rhine-Westphalia in the political process for the "European energy and climate package" in the reign of CDU/FDP from 2005 to 2010. Can the theses often represented in the political science discussion confirm the loss of significance of the German countries by European integration and the deparliamentaryization of subnational politics? The present study investigates these and further questions and thereby examines the relationship between Europeanization and state policy. The Europeanization of North Rhine-Westphalia's energy and climate policy did not lead to the exclusion of the country in the European multi-level system and not to the deparliamentarization of subnational politics during the 14th election period. content.text: Acquisition of modelling skills: Empirical comparison of a holistic and an atomistic approach to the promotion of modelling skills.In Germany, the acquisition of mathematical modelling skills has been mandatory since its establishment in the educational standards for pupils of all school forms and stages. Susanne Brand compares an integral and disintegrating modeling approach to the promotion of modelling skills empirically in the context of the intervention project ERMO. Their results show that the effectiveness of the two approaches examined is to be considered in a differentiated way, in particular with regard to the performance strength and heterogeneity of learning groups. content.text: The city at the gates: Lüneburg and its surroundings in the late Middle Ages. The medieval city did not end at its walls. In many respects, the medieval city space extended beyond its internal area and structured the supposedly empty field beyond the narrower border. These included forests, gardens and other land in bourgeois and communal property, commercial enterprises (goats, mills, quarries) and utilities (wells) as well as military fortifications (land defences). Urban rights of rule in the surrounding countryside were also the focus of the council's policy as were the trade routes necessary for the economic success of a city and its merchants. Niels Petersen reconstructs in detail the surrounding area of the Hanse and salt town of Lüneburg, which in the 15th century belonged to the largest cities in Northern Germany, and orders the results into the city-remote research and the recent "space" discussions. Here it becomes clear that the city space - also in Lüneburg - is not abstractly definable, but rather was practically and symbolically produced by the German Research Forum of Lüneburger Ausgebrüchsches.
content.title_en: The city at the gates : Lüneburg and its surroundings in the late Middle Ages

content.text: The scaenae frons of the Nysa Theater am Maeander. Summary: Nysa, one of the most important cities of ancient Caria, is located on the road from Ayd?n (the ancient Tralleis) to Denizli, about 3 km northwest of the present-day village Sultanhisar. The preserved remains of the city and the inscriptions as well as the small finds indicate that Nysa was continuously inhabited from Hellenistic to Byzantine times. The Nysa Theatre was most likely part of the basic equipment of the Hellenistic city and was rebuilt several times in the Roman Empire. The overall complex consists of the auditorium, the orchestra, the prosekenion and the stage house with three-storey scaenae frons
content.title_en: The scaenae frons of the Nysa Theater on the Maeander

content.text: The development of a CAE tool for designing flight control and hydraulic systems. The practical support of the engineer in designing flight control and hydraulic systems - including the computer - is the focus of this work. The data is derived from the data that was established during the aircraft design for a new aircraft project. From this the requirements for the flight control system are derived: What moment is necessary to move the control surfaces of the aircraft in all flight situations? At what speed must the control surfaces be ejected. What influence does the required reliability have on the design? With the help of these preliminary considerations the hydraulic, linear actuators of the flight control can then be dimensioned and integrated into the wings or the control systems. Furthermore, the connection of the actuators to the energy systems and computers of the aircraft will be examined. With the help of a stationary calculation the hydraulic system is designed. Finally, it is shown how the design of the aircraft systems can be economically evaluated based on the "Direct Operating Costs".
content.title_en: Development of CAE tool for designing flight control and hydraulic systems

content.text: The use of adaptive learning methods to regulate industrial combustion processes is actively discussed. In this work, the approach of the functional learning methods to improve process management in large industrial combustion plants is explained. To this end, the essential components of such combustion processes are presented, and it is explained why conventional control methods (e.g. PID controllers) can not or only insufficiently master parts of this process. Learningable models are in principle able to ensure better process management. Likewise, the problems of standard learning methods with the data of real processes are shown. In the main part of the work three improvement approaches are developed: The influence of intoxicated data on the learning process. In order to obtain good models despite such data, both intoxicated points (outliers) are used from the data set as well as robust training methods. The adaptation of a learningable model to changes of the process over long periods of time. It is shown that adapting the data of a process already leads to advantages over a static model. On combustion data the best results are achieved with the weighted combination of adaptive models in ensembles. The functional error of the measurement of the existing measurement of the model is already tested.
content.title_en: Use of adaptive learning methods to regulate industrial combustion processes

content.text: The theory and policy of the housing market: an analysis of housing policy in Germany, with particular consideration of the economic theory of politics. The peculiarities of the housing economy lead to frictions in the coordination and allocation processes of the housing market. The author checks whether there is a market failure on the housing market, which could be used as an economic justification for state interventions. Subsequently, the housing policy instruments are analysed with regard to their target adequacy. As appropriate criteria, the social security and efficiency are brought into the center of the considerations. The analysis also includes housing policy in East Germany. -- As a result, since the Second World War, Germany has been able to identify a housing policy that is not efficient and socially safe. Rather, the state regulations reinforce or generate the coordination and allocation disorders. -- Using the approaches of the New Institution Economism and the Public Choice Theory, the tendency to a short-term, discretionary interventionist housing policy is explained as a result of interactions of the involved actors. Annette Mayer develops solutions, the incentives and the working conditions of the politicians are to correct the incentives and the office conditions, the housing market.
content.title_en: Theory and politics of the housing market: an analysis of housing policy in Germany, with particular reference to the economic theory of politics
