content.text: The objective of the qualitative study is to use identity structures as a theoretical framework and reference point for social integration processes. Methodological and methodological frameworks to advance to this field of subject matter is the Grounded Theory Methodology. The analytical focus is on identity structures of a selected group of prisoners who have repeated incarceration experiences and subsequently reveal certain characteristic combinations. In particular, negatively grounded experience values of society and socialization instances cause the subjects to open their own biography as well as their social positioning for a self-referential discourse. In this process, social experiences of disrespect are processed, interpretable as an attempt to establish normalization and connection skills, which then in a context of ‘authenticity', as a function of the function of the class of the person in the context of the profession, which in the context of the profession is a pre-conceived concept.

content.text: Studies on the technofunctionality of egg yolk fractions in fine baked goods, using the example of biscuits and sand cakes. Egg yolk fractions, cake structure, rheology. - In fine baked goods, such as biscuits and sand cakes, chicken egg is the most important structural ingredient. Besides its taste and nutritional value, it is valued primarily because of its three outstanding technological properties: the thermal gel formation, foaming capacity and its excellent emulsifying properties, where the egg yolk also plays a decisive role. Egg yolks can now be separated in three main fractions in an inexpensive and industrial way: the low-density lipoproteins (LDL), granula and livetine and freeze dry using a special process. Here, the technofunctional properties can be fully preserved and exploited. The present work aimed to develop the technofunctional self-creases of newly developed freeze-d egg yolk fractions (LDL, granula, livetine) in order to use the sugar in a targeted manner.
content.title_en: Studies on the technofunctionality of egg yolk fractions in fine bakery products using the example of biscuits and sandcakes

content.text: The model is fully documented and the model is fully validated. The model is then used to describe the solid copper-press contacts. The calculation of the press associations according to DIN 7190 is not applicable in the design of massive copper contacts because high deformation degrees and friction stresses occur during the joining process. The new model not only offers shortened and efficient design cycles for new high-performance contacts (HLK), but also deepens the basic understanding of the joining process and contact properties. After a short motivation of the topic and an introduction to cold contacting technology, the third chapter develops the basics of experimental work and simulation methods. The challenges in the modelling of joining processes lie in the material description and friction characterization. Therefore, the two topics are presented in two independent chapters, starting from the respective state of the technology up to the validation of the new methods and models. The fourth chapter deals with the material description and includes two new methods for the constructional determination of the flow properties of copper materials. The reciprocity of the reciprocity is described in a few ways.
content.title_en: Finite element simulation for the cold-joining of high power connectors

content.text: Environmental information for consumers: basics, methods and opportunities for impact. Increasing environmental problems are the burden that the past has put on the new millennium. It remains questionable what ecological role the consumer should play and what means can be used to promote environmentally friendly consumer behaviour. Economical foundations about the costs and benefits of ecological action on the one hand, social psychological interdependencies and psychology of consumer behaviour on the other hand form the scientific poles of the present study. Effective behavioural corrections are linked to the convictions of the individual consumer regarding the results of his actions, the expectations of other and the individual barriers to master. The empirical results show where the promising priorities of environmental consumer information lie. It is about information oriented to the consumer needs, which answers in detail in quick access application-related questions, positively achieved instead of failures and dispenses with general moralisation. This information calls for consumers not only from the state and from consumer and environmental associations, but also emphatically from companies.
content.title_en: Environmental information for consumers: basics, methods and opportunities for impact

content.text: The forecasting of the interest rate is traditionally very important in the context of the individual and macroeconomic relevance of interest rate changes. Nevertheless, the scientific literature shows only a relatively few studies which analyse the prognosis quality of econometric methods "out of sample". In the context of a theoretical analysis as well as a broad empirical study, the author shows possibilities of forecasting money and capital market interest rates. In the framework of the strategy underlying the concept of the work "market-based interest rate forecasts" the interest rate development is predicted by market expectations, which are reflected in interest rates and the interest rate structure, are extracted and analysed using econometric methods. The methodical approach of the work is based on recent international studies, in which interest rates and interest rate structure are modelled as so-called regime switching processes. -- In the first main part of the work, the author leads from the perspective of the application-oriented time series analysts into the regime switching technique. In the second main part, the forecasting of the interest rate variables is shown in the context of the theoretical forecasting.
content.title_en: Market-based interest rate forecasts with regime switching models

content.text: The first investment decision must take account of the possibility of making subsequent decisions. Real investment is linked to a variety of different decisions. These decisions depend to a large extent on each other. The initial investment decision must take account of the possibility of making subsequent decisions. This fact becomes particularly relevant when deposits from investment projects are expected in the distant future, i.e. when there is a long time between the initial investment decision and the sale of products. In this case, uncertainty about prices, demand or behaviour of competitors and the possibility of responding to them play an important role. The author deals with the sequential nature of investment decisions under uncertainty. In this respect, models are developed that are based on option price and play-heoretical findings and thus can include both uncertainty about prices and demand as well as the behaviour of competitors in the analysis. From these models, numerous insights that are of considerable importance for the further development of investment theory can be derived.
content.title_en: Sequential investment decisions under uncertainty

content.text: The public is not asked to consider the motives of the public-sector investor, but rather the motives of the public-sector investor, although a closer examination of the motives of the public-sector investor would be of great importance for individual investment decisions. In this work, the question is in particular about why innovative growth companies are deciding to finance the public-sector and against private placement of the shares. -- The examination of the various possible motives of an exchange-market start is first based on theory, taking into account the specificities of the innovation process. Subsequently, the theoretical considerations in the context of a comprehensive study of the stock market newcomers in the New Market and in other German market segments are subjected to empirical review. -- The examination of the material financing theoretical work shows that the advantages of a stock market start ultimately correspond to the broad distribution of the share market, the information aggregation in the secondary market prices and the directness of the capital-allocation relationship. -- The results of the empirical investigation are particularly significant in the case of the two-participating companies.
content.title_en: Motives of the IPO on the New Market : Public financing of innovations from a theoretical and empirical perspective

content.text: The basic symmetry of the symmetry is performed with the same frequency of the symmetry. For this work, specific symmetry models are investigated. These models are from the field of theoretical solid-state physics, where they serve to describe the electron structure of strongly correlated solids. The molecular-specific parameters of the model are obtained directly from ab-initio calculations. To solve the electron-structure problem, the method of exact diagonalization has been implemented and parallelized. System-specifically, an electron-phonon coupling is introduced, symmetries are used and approximation methods developed. The approximations combine a local description of d-orbitals with a molecular orbital approach for s- and p-orbital, they provide in favorable cases a correlation energy with a fault of a few promille in comparison to the exact solution at a significantly reduced calculation time. With these methods, three problems have been investigated. First, the effect of strong electron correlation on the charge transfer in Creutz-taube-ktion has been analyzed with a local frequency of the symmetry.
content.title_en: Chemically motivated Hubbard models: exact diagonalization, charge transfer and local approximation processes

content.text: Probabilistic life-cycle models for thermomechanical fatigue of soldering compounds in CSP components. Summary: The aim of this work was to create a reliability model for Chip Scale Package (CSP) which can be used to estimate the life of components under changed ambient loads, or newly developed components. One prerequisite for this is the determination of basic data for the representation of assembly reliability with components such as μBGA (Micro Ball Grid Array) and QFN (Quad Flat No Lead), as well as lead-free solders for thermal alternating loads. In the work, all relevant influencing variables that influence the life of the assemblies are to be found and converted into a universal reliability model for the various CSPs. The investigated designs include various μBGA and QFN. The focus of the investigations was on thermomechanical issues.
content.title_en: Probabilistic life models for thermomechanical fatigue of solder joints in CSP components

content.text: Media (sub)culture : Stories - Discourses - Designs. The scientific analysis of the media society is often normative. Accordingly predictable and unsatisfactory are its findings and interpretations. Christoph Jacket's study seeks ways out of this impasse by presenting innovative readings of the three prominent strands of critical theory (Frankfurt School and Successor), cultural studies and sociocultural constructivism. From them, a separate media culture observation grid with the levels Main and Sub is prepared. The yields of this new method are shown in the final focus of the central actors in media and pop culture, the stars.
content.title_en: Media culture : Stories - Discourses - Designs

content.text: Ar@chitekturen in Zelluloid : The cinematic view of space. In the subject of architecture and film, the first thing you associate is scenery or set design, thinking of films like »Metropolis« or »Blade Runner«. This book proposes a new perspective: it shows the means by which the film designs spaces, awakens emotions and lets the viewer immerse themselves in an illusion space. This knowledge is also of great interest for the architectural spatial design. Thus, filmic spatial concepts such as editing or the cadration from the point of view of architecture are considered and discussed from the point of view of perception theory. Theoretical approaches and exemplary study examples create an intermedial interface that creates a new understanding of the origin of spatial effects.
content.title_en: Ar@chitectures in Celluloid : The cinematic view of the room

content.text: Optimization of the use of unmanned flight systems using mathematical optimization methods. In this work a model has been developed which includes new aspects regarding the planning of trajectories of flight drones by means of mathematical optimization. In particular, the linearization of circles or balls by means of the method of Glineur can be successfully implemented and tested. It was shown that a trajectory under temporal and local boundary conditions could be solved plausibly with the given formulas. Furthermore, it was illustrated that such problems can also be solved with simple hardware and software. Only with increasing complexity and secondary conditions it leads the system to the limits.
content.title_en: Optimization of the use of unmanned flight systems using mathematical optimization methods

content.text: The global data processing system is based on the global data protection reform. The main challenges of cloud computing to the legal framework for data protection are discussed in practice and based on typical conflict areas. The main focus is on the data protection law applicable, the personal data access, data and information security, and the order data processing. As global data flows form the technical backbone of a globalised world economy, the focus is also on international data transfers – for reasons of practice relevance, above all in the USA on the basis of the »Safe Harbor Agreement«. / »Cloud Computing – Challenges to the Legal Framework for Data«.
content.title_en: Cloud computing - Challenges to the legal framework for data protection

content.text: "Thank you for your entry into the logbook" : literary mass communication on the social web. Summary: This paper examines various variants of literary mass communication on the social web. After an introductory chapter, which also explains the technical framework conditions of online communication, the special features of mass communication on various social web platforms are illuminated. In the main part of the dissertation, the author presents various projects of literary mass communication, including literature on Twitter, sequel novels on Facebook, literature and secondary literary communication on literary platforms as well as literary communication on blogs and much more. In this context, the special production conditions are examined, the texts undergo an analysis and the distribution as well as the connection communication via social channels. In a final chapter the specific attraction of participation in literary online mass communication on the social web is elaborated. The work sees itself as a broad analysis of a field of literary communication that has so far been little considered.
content.title_en: "Thank you for your entry in the logbook" : literary mass communication in the social web

content.text: The purpose of Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) is to classify and manage information at a cost. Information that is often accessed in a company can be separated from information with a lower access frequency and be provided and managed on the most appropriate storage medium in accordance with the company requirements. Rapid data growth, high storage, administration and operating costs as well as numerous legal requirements are the main reasons for the emergence of ILM. To analyse the cost and benefit ratio that arises in the implementation and application of ILM, this work will simulate and evaluate a process for the economic analysis of the management of unstructured data in the ILM. It will examine the influence of automated classification and management on varying amounts of data with varying access frequencies and usage levels to the economy of the ILM, in addition to the management of the internal data analysis, the management of the cloud is also involved in the management of the business.
content.title_en: Economic analysis of automated management of unstructured data in information lifecycle management

content.text: Violence in computer games: Facets of pleasure. Grand Theft Auto, Battlefield, Counter-Strike - Violence in computer games is always controversially discussed. But what emotional experiences does the playful use of virtual violence enable? Through participating observations in online games and at LAN parties as well as through interview, magazine and video analyses, Christoph Bareuther works out how millions of people can experience something as amusing, which shocks others. Without using valuable clichés, the ethnographic study thus makes a decisive contribution to a debate in the intersection of popular culture, politics and public opinion Grand Theft Auto, Battlefield, Counter-Strike - Violence in computer games is repeatedly controversially discussed. But what emotional experiences does the playful use of virtual violence enable others to experience? Through participating observations in online games and at LAN parties as well as through interview, magazine and video analyses, Christoph Bareuther works out how millions of people can experience something as a pleasure, what shocks others. Without serving any valid clichés, the community's critical contribution to the field of culture of communication and the subject of communication.
content.title_en: Violence in computer games : Facets of pleasure

content.text: Deinstitutionalization of the humanities through organisational change: self-determination and participation of disabled people as a challenge for change processes in organizations. This work explores the extent to which the reforms of the housing-related services of the so-called disability assistance required in the field of healing education under the term deinstitutionalization can be realized by a change of the organizations addressed. The core of the work is an empirical study on the decentralisation and regionalization of a large and complex institution. The theoretical foundation of the study is based on the deinstitutionalisation of the medical educational discourse and is supplemented and further developed by an institution-sociological perspective of neo-institutionalism. The qualitative study subsequently analyses the structural and substantive facets of the change of the large and complex institution in its interaction. The results thus show the complexity of the change processes, especially in terms of the everyday reality of residents in stationary settings. The rebinding of the empirical results on the deinstitutionalization theory (heilopädagogik and neoinstitutionalism) is a key element of an active strategy of deinstitutionalizationalization. The DIP is a passively disabled of the participation in the production of the humanities.
content.title_en: Deinstitutionalisation through organisational change: self-determination and participation of disabled people as a challenge for change processes in organisations

Furthermore, the implementation of modules for sample pretreatment with low technical effort is feasible. In this work the influences on SERS-Spectres are investigated. In this work, the pyridine and monosubstituent analdimensions are shown in the analysis of the disease.

content.text: The work deals with the legal classification of networks. For this purpose, the understanding of networks in sociology, economics, politics and geography is first analyzed. The work then deals with the recognition of network relationships in the legal system. The legal assessment begins with the question whether and to what extent relationships between network actors are subject to contract law. In this respect, the bipolar starting point for most legal standardisations is already a major challenge. Furthermore, the social, property, enrichment and criminal law is viewed. The latter areas of law are particularly important because network-oriented actions do not necessarily have to be linked to a contractual relationship. Finally, special forms of action are considered legally, which have a particularly high network orientation according to the economic science perspective.
content.title_en: Network relations in the civil law system

content.text: Collecting things, creating knowledge: The history of natural history collections in Basel, 1735-1850. In the transition from the 18th to the 19th century, the collection of objects in nature was established from a leisure activity of individual individuals to scientific practice.For example, researchers developed new answers to scientific questions – for example, the nature's nature or the development of living beings.In the natural science museums, this new knowledge could be negotiated and established with a broad audience.Based on the history of natural history collections in Basel, Flavio Häner is working on how not only new scientific disciplines emerged from this period, but a society arose in which questions about nature could no longer be answered by referring to the biblical history of creation.
content.title_en: Collecting things, creating knowledge : The history of natural history collections in Basel, 1735-1850

content.text: Climate change: Why do we have the responsibility to solve the problems that arise and why we don't!. What is justice? What could just regulations look like for the disasters and sufferings that climate change triggers or will trigger? These are often unfair, because they often hit more people who have contributed the least to climate change. But what exactly do we understand by the term: ‘climate change'? And can this really hit people directly? A short scientific outline here solves the most important questions. Since this is a philosophical work, it must first be clarified whether man can be the cause of something like climate warming. Robert Spaemann's thesis is that man can change world affairs with his individual actions through his free will. Hans Jonas adds that by this ability, we are responsible for the deliberate and unintentional consequences of our actions. This would be from a natural science perspective (1st part of the work) and from a philosophical perspective (beginning part 2nd) ...
content.title_en: Climate change: Why we have the responsibility to solve the problems that arise and why we do not!

content.text: Approach model for systematic operational flexibility planning: a reference model for producing companies using the example of the photovoltaic industry. Practice, especially the photovoltaic industry, is confronted with hardly predictable fluctuations in demand, in short volatility, to which it is necessary to react flexibly. In theory, flexibility research is based on the beginnings of business economics, and flexibility is now required by entire value chains. Nevertheless, up to now, business literature lacks a theoretically based, comprehensive and practical approach model, which provides a guide to systematic flexibility planning. In this work, such a method model for systematic operational flexibility planning is developed using the example of the photovoltaic industry, which also represents a reference model for any value-added production systems.
content.title_en: Approach model for systematic operational flexibility planning: a reference model for manufacturing companies using the example of the photovoltaic industry

content.text: The aim of this work was to examine the chances and limitations of marker-supported and genomic selection for increasing yield, as well as resistance to ear-supported selection. Genomic selection, however, allows the precise prediction of the three characteristics. Comparing various genomic selection models shows that epistasy contributes substantially to phenotypic variation. Genomics-breeding was the driving force of predictive accuracy of genomic selection. The reliability criterion facilitates the utilization of the relationality by estimating the predictive accuracy of individual genotypes.

content.text: Physical hydrogels on polyurethane basis. Physical hydrogels are currently becoming increasingly interested in the cell substrates, as viscoelasticity or stress relaxation is an important parameter in mechanotransduction, which has been neglected so far. In this work, multi-functional polyurethanes have been designed, which form physical hydrogels via a novel geling mechanism. In water, the anionic polyurethanes spontaneously form aggregates, which are held in solution by electrostatic rejection. A fast geling can be achieved from here by charge shielding, which leads to aggregation and a network is formed. This can be done by adding different acids or salts, so that both acidic (pH 4-5) and pH neutral hydrogels can be obtained. While conventional hydrogels on polyurethane basis are usually produced by toxic isocyanate-containing prepolymers, the physical geling mechanism described here is suitable for use in sensitive environments. While conventional hydrogels on polyurethane basis can be characterized by an excellent hydrogel generation independently of the over-relation.
content.title_en: Physical hydrogels based on polyurethane

content.text: Efficient and accurate evaluation of aggregation into totals in population balance equations. Applications of population balance equations can be found in many chemical production processes such as crystallization or production of pharmaceuticals. In such equations, an aggregation process is described by source and sink integrale. The numerical analysis of the source integral is usually of square order. In this dissertation, we focus on the efficient evaluation of such aggregation integrale and reduce the complexity to quasilinear. We provide numerous numerical tests for various initial values that provide (heuristic) strategies for the choice of the discretization parameters. Applications of population balance equations can be found in many chemical production processes, e.g. crystallization and precision of pharmaceutical materials. In population balance equations the aggregation process is determined by quantity and quantity in aggregate.
content.title_en: Efficient and accurate evaluation of aggregation integrals in population balance equations
